lines.value: another demonstration of elphaba's innate power occurs when she rescues the infant snow monkey which she later names chistery seeing the monkey stranded on an island in the middle of a lake elphaba feels compelled to save him and runs toward the island despite her mortal allergy to water
lines.name: English

lines.value: as her feet make contact with the surface of the lake a pane of ice forms beneath them allowing her to reach the island unharmed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the others in the caravan speculate that the lake had previously been enchanted by a magician but when liir recalls the incident in son of a witch he claims that the world conformed itself to suit her needs implying that elphaba did indeed cause the ice to appear as well as possibly categorizing this power as a form of reality warping
lines.name: English

lines.value: of course liir was rather young at the time and as he himself admits he may simply have over romanticized the incident in his mind
lines.name: English

lines.value: apart from those incidents there are others that may or may not be attributed to elphaba's dormant powers such as the storm that only she and her roommate galinda notice or the horns that attack fiyero
lines.name: English

lines.value: any magically empowered character in the land of oz could well have provoked both these last events
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the musical elphaba possesses the ability to perform a magical attack on anyone toward whom she feels anger
lines.name: English

lines.value: she uses this power twice following the song dear old shiz madame morrible insists upon caring for nessarose something that elphaba has always done herself
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the headmistress ignores her objections she flies into a rage and somehow causes everyone standing around nessarose's wheelchair to be thrown backward
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chair then spins in place for several seconds before reversing into elphaba's hands
lines.name: English

lines.value: she uses this power a second time when following the firing of doctor dillamond the new history teacher brings a caged lion cub into the classroom and announces that he intends to prevent the animal from learning to talk
lines.name: English

lines.value: this enrages elphaba and she uses her magic to throw everyone away from the cage and subsequently immobilize them long enough to take the lion cub out of the room and set it free
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this instance her power does not affect fiyero the first suggestion that she may have feelings for him
lines.name: English

lines.value: besides her specific powers elphaba's musical counterpart has amazing power and proficiency with magic in general to the extent that madame morrible insists that she be tutored in sorcery individually
lines.name: English

lines.value: elphaba can perform the spells of the grimmerie reputed to be the most powerful in all the land of oz with ease even succeeding in creating an effective result when the subject of the spell is many miles away and when she has adapted the incantation to suit the circumstance in which it is used
lines.name: English

lines.value: an example of such a success when both of the aforementioned problems have been in play is the spell she used to save fiyero from death although admittedly that spell has the unintended effect of transforming him into a scarecrow
lines.name: English

lines.value: she has also used the book's spells to accomplish feats that appear to be impossible for ozian magicians such as enabling things to fly
lines.name: English

lines.value: toward the end of the musical it is revealed that the wizard is in fact elphaba's father and madame morrible attributes elphaba's immense magical power to the fact that she was a child of both worlds
lines.name: English

lines.value: in both the musical and the novel elphaba is shown to have certain precognitive and or clairvoyant abilities
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the book the focal point of this power is a mirror made for her by turtle heart
lines.name: English

lines.value: she uses the mirror as a scrying tool in early childhood and through it foresees several events including the arrival of the wizard in oz
lines.name: English

lines.value: her clairvoyant abilities are in evidence at two points during the musical during the song the wizard and i elphaba sings of how she has just experienced a vision almost like a prophecy in which she foresees that one day all of oz will hold a celebration all to do with her
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a tragic twist this actually turns out to be the celebration that takes place following her supposed death
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second reference to this ability occurs when she has a vision of dorothy's house flying through the sky accompanied by a feeling that nessarose is in danger
lines.name: English

lines.value: her seeing the house could be regarded as simply catching sight of it as it is carried by the cyclone however the fact that fiyero who was with her at the time could not see it seems to support the theory of its being a vision
lines.name: English

lines.value: elphaba is able to read the grimmerie despite the fact that the book is written in the lost language of spells
lines.name: English

lines.value: she first demonstrates this talent when the wizard asks her to perform a levitation spell on one of his pet monkeys as proof of her powers she finds exactly the right spell within seconds reads it as easily as she would her own language and makes it work perfectly on her first try
lines.name: English

lines.value: however although she has an instinctive knack for knowing which spell is appropriate in certain cases and can pronounce the words of the language she later reveals that she does not actually understand what they mean
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the novel elphaba also possesses the ability to read the grimmerie but with nowhere near the same facility
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is able to understand fragments of the text but admits that most of it is misty to [her] eyes
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite this she gleans much magical knowledge from the book over her many years of studying it and puts the knowledge to good use
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the novel the grimmerie is revealed to have been created on earth which is why it is illegible to the people of oz
lines.name: English

lines.value: however being of mixed ozian and earthly blood elphaba possesses a natural ability to at least partially understand the contents of the book
lines.name: English

lines.value: church of the lukumi babalu aye inc v hialeah was a case in which the supreme court of the united states held that an ordinance passed in hialeah florida forbidding the unnecessar[y] killing of an animal in a public or private ritual or ceremony not for the primary purpose of food consumption was unconstitutional
lines.name: English

lines.value: santeria is an afro american religion developed as a syncretism of roman catholicism and yoruba religion by yoruba people brought as slaves from yorubaland to cuba by the atlantic slave trade
lines.name: English

lines.value: adherents believe they can fulfill their destiny through the aid of beings known as orishas who subsist off blood from animal sacrifice
lines.name: English

lines.value: animals usually chickens killed during ritual slaughter are then cooked and eaten by the celebrants except during death and healing rituals where sick energy is believed to have passed into the sacrifice
lines.name: English

lines.value: santeria has been subject to widespread persecution in cuba so it is traditionally practiced in secret employing saint symbolism
lines.name: English

lines.value: the church of lukumi babalu aye inc is a florida nonprofit organized in 1973 by ernesto pichardo who was an italero level priest in the santeria faith
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lucumi language is used in the santeria liturgy and babalu-aye is the spirit of wrath and disease
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 1987 the church leased a property at 173 w 5th street hialeah in miami dade county florida and announced its intention to use the site to openly practice the faith
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hialeah city council held an emergency public session on june 9 1987
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the session councilman silvio cardoso stated that the religion is in violation of everything this country stands for councilman andres mejides observed that the bible does not allow this particular type of animal sacrifice and councilman julio martinez noted to audience applause that in cuba people were put in jail for practicing this religion hialeah's police chaplain testified that the church worshiped demons and the city attorney testified that this community will not tolerate religious practices abhorrent to its citizens pichardo's brief testimony was met with taunts from the audience
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of the session the city council passed a resolution announcing its commitment to prohibit all religious groups which are inconsistent with public morals peace or safety
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city further passed a resolution incorporating florida's animal cruelty statute into the city code and the city attorney obtained a florida attorney general's opinion from bob butterworth concluding that the state statute did not permit ritual animal sacrifice
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 1987 the city council unanimously passed three new ordinances that criminalized sacrifices of animals for any type of ritual regardless of whether or not the flesh or blood of the animal is to be consumed the city council exempted kosher slaughterhouses regular slaughterhouses hunting fishing pest extermination euthanasia of stray animals and feeding live rabbits to greyhounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the church sued in the united states district court for the southern district of florida
lines.name: English

lines.value: on june 10 1988 us district judge eugene p spellman granted absolute immunity to the individual city council members and the mayor
lines.name: English

lines.value: on october 5 1989 after a nine day bench trial judge spellman granted summary judgment to the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1991 the united states court of appeals for the eleventh circuit affirmed in an unsigned one paragraph per curiam decision where it noted that judge spellman employed an arguably stricter standard than that applied in employment division v smith 1990 which had in the interim found native americans could be fired for their ritual use of peyote
lines.name: English

lines.value: in smith justice antonin scalia had even cited judge spellman's opinion as authority which the city highlighted in their appeals brief
lines.name: English

lines.value: the court in wisconsin v yoder 1972 had explicitly provided amish parents a religious exemption from mandatory school attendance under the free exercise clause
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in the years since free exercise claimants had lost every case before the court with the exception of a line of employment decisions cases terminated by smith
lines.name: English

lines.value: the church's petition for certiorari from the supreme court of the united states was granted with douglas laycock appearing for the church during oral arguments on november 4 1992
lines.name: English

lines.value: on june 11 1993 the supreme court unanimously reversed
lines.name: English

lines.value: justice anthony kennedy in an opinion of the court joined in parts by chief justice william rehnquist and justices byron white john paul stevens antonin scalia david souter and clarence thomas concluded that the city's ordinances violated the free exercise clause of the united states constitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: kennedy read the smith decision as requiring a compelling governmental interest if a law is not of neutral and general applicability
lines.name: English

lines.value: kennedy went on in a section souter and white refused to join to conclude that although the ordinances were facially neutral they were religiously gerrymandered with care to only apply to religious killings
lines.name: English

lines.value: kennedy in a section only joined by stevens details the ordinances legislative history even citing taped excerpts of the hialeah city council meeting
lines.name: English

lines.value: next in a section souter refused to join kennedy notes the numerous exemptions in the florida statute concluding the law is not generally applicable because it effectively applies only against conduct motivated by religious belief finally in a section joined by the full seven justice majority kennedy applies strict scrutiny which the city ordinances fail
lines.name: English

lines.value: because the ordinance suppressed more religious conduct than was necessary to achieve its stated ends it was deemed unconstitutional with justice anthony kennedy stating in the decision religious beliefs need not be acceptable logical consistent or comprehensible to others in order to merit first amendment protection
lines.name: English

lines.value: justice scalia joined by chief justice rehnquist defended the smith decision and attacked the use of legislative intent opining that there would be no constitutional violation if the hialeah city council set out resolutely to suppress the practices of santeria but ineptly adopted ordinances that failed to do so
lines.name: English

lines.value: justice souter writing alone for eighteen pages noted that the smith rule in my view may be reexamined consistently with principles of stare decisis
lines.name: English

lines.value: justice harry blackmun joined by justice sandra day o'connor concurred in the judgment only
lines.name: English

lines.value: refusing to endorse the approach used in the majority opinion blackmun wrote i continue to believe that smith was wrongly decided
lines.name: English

lines.value: blackmun goes on citing an amicus curiae brief by people for the ethical treatment of animals to observe that had this case presented a law that sincerely pursued the goal of protecting animals from cruel treatment the result may have been different
lines.name: English

lines.value: somewhat similarly in 2009 a freedom of religion case related to animal sacrifice was taken to the us court of appeals for the fifth circuit in the case of merced v kasson
lines.name: English

lines.value: merced was a santeria priest and the president of templo yoruba omo orisha texas inc a santeria religious group
lines.name: English

lines.value: he challenged euless texas city ordinances prohibiting the slaughter of four legged animals
lines.name: English

lines.value: the court ruled that the ordinances substantially burden plaintiff's free exercise of religion without advancing a compelling governmental interest using the least restrictive means and that merced was entitled under the texas religious freedom restoration act trfra to an injunction preventing the city from enforcing its ordinances that burdened his religious practices relating to the use of animals
lines.name: English

lines.value: the court did not reach merced's claims under the first and fourteenth amendments
lines.name: English

lines.value: was japan's first television documentary miniseries
lines.name: English

lines.value: run on nhk for seventeen installments in 1974 and 1975 the theme of the program was why civilizations flourished and declined footage was seen from over 150 world heritage sites in 44 countries
lines.name: English

lines.value: an experimental series of programs legacy for the future paved the way for the modern japanese television documentary that nhk has since become known for
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: the river flows in a mostly eastern direction until it meets the penobscot at howland
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is approximately in length

lines.value: the united states government maintains three river flow gauges on the piscataquis river

lines.value: the river is impounded by the howland dam at its confluence with the penobscot river

lines.value: arthur a archie trapp november 7 1918 &ndash august 2 2007 was a politician in manitoba canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served in the legislative assembly of manitoba as a liberal progressive from 1958 to 1959
lines.name: English

lines.value: the son of albert trapp and charlotte arnhold he was born in brokenhead manitoba
lines.name: English

lines.value: trapp farmed and also operated timber and auctioneering businesses
lines.name: English

lines.value: he married juliana freund
lines.name: English

lines.value: like his father he served as reeve for the rural municipality of brokenhead
lines.name: English

lines.value: trapp later was employed with the department of indian affairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: after his retirement he became owner and operator of a fishing lodge in northern manitoba
lines.name: English

lines.value: trapp was elected to the manitoba legislature in the 1958 provincial election defeating progressive conservative candidate ga stewart by 176 votes in the mid northern constituency of lac du bonnet
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served in the parliamentary opposition during his time in the legislature
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1959 election trapp challenged cooperative commonwealth federation edward schreyer in the neighbouring constituency of brokenhead
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was unsuccessful finishing in third place
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died in winnipeg at the age of 88
lines.name: English

lines.value: friedrich hermann loew 19 july 1807 - 21 april 1879 was a german entomologist who specialised in the study of diptera an order of insects including flies mosquitoes gnats and midges
lines.name: English

lines.value: he described many world species and was the first specialist to work on the diptera of the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: hermann loew was born in weissenfels saxony a short distance south of halle germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: the loew family though not wealthy was well placed
lines.name: English

lines.value: loew's father was a functionary for the department of justice of the duchy of saxony who later became a geheimer regierungsrath of prussia
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1817 and 1829 loew attended first the convent school of rossleben then the university of halle wittenberg graduating in mathematics philology and natural history
lines.name: English

lines.value: recognizing his abilities as a mathematician the university on his graduation appointed him as a lecturer in the same subjects
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1830 he went to berlin and gave lessons in different higher grade schools including the kadetten schule military school
lines.name: English

lines.value: here he was private tutor to prince biron heir to the duchy of courland and semigallia and the young friedrich wilhelm ernst albrecht von graefe 1828-1870 later one of the most famous oculists of all times
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1834 loew was appointed superior teacher oberlehrer at the friedrich wilhelm gymnasium in posen known today as st john cantius high school in poznan poland where he taught mathematics and natural history
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the same year he married the daughter of senior preacher ehricht a favourite sermoniser
lines.name: English

lines.value: several of loew's pupils at posen became scientific celebrities the most notable being the philosopher kuno fischer 1824-1907 and the mathematicians leo konigsberger 1837-1921 and lazarus immanuel fuchs 1835-1902
lines.name: English

lines.value: that they became such gifted though they were must have been due to loew's extraordinary abilities and his popularity with students
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1841-2 loew accompanied heinrich kiepert 1818-1899 a celebrated geographer and august schoenborn to the near east
lines.name: English

lines.value: the results of this trip were later partly communicated to hermann carl conrad burmeister 1807-1892 philipp christoph zeller and to alexander von humboldt 1769-1859 but the remainder the greatest part were used in loew's own later publications
lines.name: English

lines.value: august schoenborn philologist and geographer was also a professor at the friedrich wilhelm gymnasium in posen and author of latin school books
lines.name: English

lines.value: he eventually became loew's brother in law
lines.name: English

lines.value: humboldt was of course the author of the chattily readable kosmos an account of the visible universe and the most celebrated german naturalist explorer of his day
lines.name: English

lines.value: many other countries were visited en route including turkey and asia minor
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1848 loew was elected to the german parliament in frankfurt am main
lines.name: English

lines.value: elected to the first german parliament when 40 years old loew resisted the separatist longings of the poles from his outpost posen near the frontier of poland
lines.name: English

lines.value: he belonged to heinrich von gagern's imperial party a grouping which fostered liberalism in germany and pursued a policy of fusion for the german states
lines.name: English

lines.value: disillusioned by failure to realise german unity and distressed by the death of his 21-year-old daughter from the plague in 1850 loew left politics
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1850 he was appointed director of the royal realschule mesritz a realschule is a school emphasizing technical and scientific studies
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to the efforts of loew the mesritz realschule was later to become a gymnasium a more classical sort of school though still scientific
lines.name: English

lines.value: while at mesritz loew gave up politics so as not to be in conflict with the educational department and resisted offers of a seat in the prussian landtag federal state parliament for the district of mesritz bomst
lines.name: English

lines.value: severe health problems between 1851 and 1854 forced retirement
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1868 he received a pension and took up the study of diptera full time after moving to guben prussia
lines.name: English

lines.value: here he worked incessantly on diptera
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1870 he was elected city councillor and vice president of the city council in guben and held a seat in the legislature in berlin for the sorau guben district between 1873 and 1876
lines.name: English

lines.value: the imminent end of loew was signalled on a summer holiday in blankenburg in thuringia when he had a paralytic stroke after which he sought treatment in the diaconissen haus in halle saxony and died on april 21 1879
lines.name: English

lines.value: only three of his seven children survived him
lines.name: English

lines.value: his obituary in the vassisches zeitung described him as a distinguished pedagogue naturalist pioneer of german unity
lines.name: English

lines.value: a lutheran protestant loew's motto was gott helfe - god helps or god may help
lines.name: English

lines.value: loew was an obsessive worker
lines.name: English

lines.value: something of his nature can be judged from his refusing to eat warm food to pay off the loans incurred during his education and from his extraordinary calligraphy with its machine like precision
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is never any difficulty with reading a loew label characteristically justified to the side margins
lines.name: English

lines.value: loew shared such personality traits with the neurotically obsessive fellow entomologist alexander henry haliday
lines.name: English

lines.value: hermann loew was undoubtedly the dominant dipterist from the 1840s and the following three decades
lines.name: English

lines.value: although predominantly a describer delineating the taxonomically useful characters of more than 4000 species mainly from the palaearctic and north america but also from the afrotropics and the far east loew made important contributions to higher taxonomy
lines.name: English

lines.value: hermann loew is best known with regard to diptera paleontology for his work with baltic amber inclusions
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the first investigator to seriously interest himself in the diptera of amber and his 1850 work on the amber diptera from the baltic region was the major foundation for all future study on amber diptera
lines.name: English

lines.value: loew's personal baltic amber collection is in the natural history museum london
lines.name: English

lines.value: types of fossil species based on material in the klebs collection are now in gottingen
lines.name: English

lines.value: fossil types based on specimens from the berendt collection are in the palaontologisches museum humboldt-universitat berlin
lines.name: English

lines.value: types of recent diptera are in the museum fur naturkunde humboldt-universitat berlin except for the north american species which are in the museum of comparative zoology cambridge massachusetts the south african material which is in the university of halle zoological museum and the alaskan species which are in the zoological museum in helsingfors
lines.name: English

lines.value: other loew specimens including types are in the natural history museum in stockholm and in the natural history museum london lepidoptera from turkey
lines.name: English

lines.value: small numbers of specimens are in the natural history museum in dublin ireland and in the hope department of entomology university of oxford
lines.name: English

lines.value: aside from diptera collected by loew himself mostly from the area around posen and meseritz then in prussia but now in poland and elsewhere in what is now germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: the collection contains much material collected by other mostly anonymous german entomologists from germany and other parts of europe.there is also material collected in not by loew : brasilien bismark arch [ipelago] ralum bogota columbien chile venezuela,cuba carolina chile sumatra soekaranda montivide[o] askhaabad transcaspian amboine klein asien asia minor arab fel andalusia griechenland santiago lapland n kamerun cameroons kaukkasus texas aegyptea
lines.name: English

lines.value: in these respects the collection though impressive in most respects differs little from that of other contemporary assemblages
lines.name: English

lines.value: the collection however contains
lines.name: English

lines.value: colette de jouvenel also known as bel gazou july 1913 1981 was the daughter of french writer colette and her second husband henri de jouvenel
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was the half sister of renaud de jouvenel and bertrand de jouvenel
lines.name: English

lines.value: born at castel novel in correze she spent her childhood in the care of her english nanny miss draper only rarely seeing her famous mother
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1935 colette de jouvenel married dr dausse a man she thought she knew
lines.name: English

lines.value: they divorced one year later
lines.name: English

lines.value: she produced an animated film for l'office de radiodiffusion television francaise entitled introduction a colette
lines.name: English

lines.value: it premiered 18 march 1968
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is buried next to her mother at pere lachaise in paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: amga (; ) is a rural locality a selo and the administrative center of amginsky district of the sakha republic russia located on the amga river
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also the only inhabited locality and the administrative center of amginsky rural okrug within amginsky district
lines.name: English

lines.value: population
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name amga is derived from an evenk word meaning gorge or ravine
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was first founded by the cossacks in 1652 as the ostrog fortress of amga sloboda ().
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first church was built in 1680 but it burned down later and was subsequently rebuilt a number of times
lines.name: English

lines.value: agriculture has been conducted in the area since 1695 it was the first place in yakutia used for growing crops
lines.name: English

lines.value: amga was a place of political exile in the russian empire with the most famous exile being vladimir korolenko who was exiled here for six years in 1879
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was also the site for fighting during the russian civil war
lines.name: English

lines.value: somewhere in the area was the old river crossing of amginsk
lines.name: English

lines.value: from about 1750 to 1850 a horse track led northwest to yakutsk
lines.name: English

lines.value: across the river one route led south to uda bay and the other went southeast to ust maya and from there south to ayan
lines.name: English

lines.value: from perhaps 1662 there were a few russian peasants in the area but agriculture was usually unsuccessful
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1737 stepan krasheninnikov noted that they had abandoned agriculture and were distinguishable from their yakut neighbors only in religion
lines.name: English

lines.value: *official website of the sakha republic
lines.name: English

lines.value: registry of the administrative territorial divisions of the sakha republic
lines.name: English

lines.value: dr william eagle clarke fls frse pbou iso lld 16 march 1853 - 10 may 1938 was a british ornithologist
lines.name: English

lines.value: clarke was born in leeds where his father william clarke was a solicitor and educated at the grammar school and at yorkshire college leeds where he studied under professor l c miall
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was originally a civil engineer and surveyor but later took up natural history as a profession
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became curator of leeds museum in 1884 moving to the natural history department of the royal scottish museum in 1888 where he was keeper from 1906 to 1921
lines.name: English

lines.value: he went on several expeditions including the rhone valley sclavonia hungary and andorra
lines.name: English

lines.value: he observed that the rhone valley was important for migratory birds
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also worked on collections obtained by others and described the negros bleeding heart
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was instrumental in recognizing that lighthouses and lightships were capable of collecting a great deal of migration information
lines.name: English

lines.value: for his work on bird migration he became the first recipient of the godman salvin medal in 1922
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1903 he was elected a fellow of the royal society of edinburgh his main proposer being ramsay heatley traquair
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was president of the british ornithologists union in 1918
lines.name: English

lines.value: andrew baxter 1686/1687 aberdeen23 april 1750 whittingehame east lothian was a scottish metaphysician
lines.name: English

lines.value: baxter was educated at king's college university of aberdeen
lines.name: English

lines.value: he maintained himself by acting as tutor to noblemen's sons
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1741 to 1747 he lived with lord blantyre and mr hay of drummelzier at utrecht and made excursions in flanders france and germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: returning to scotland he lived at whittingehame near edinburgh until his death in 1750
lines.name: English

lines.value: at spa he had met john wilkes then twenty years old and formed a lasting friendship with him
lines.name: English

lines.value: baxter's chief work an inquiry into the nature of the human soul editions 1733 1737 and 1745 with appendix added in 1750 in answer to an attack in maclaurin's account of sir i newton's philosophical discoveries and dedication to john wilkes examines the properties of matter
lines.name: English

lines.value: it described the one essential property of matter as its inactivity vis inertiae accepted later by monboddo
lines.name: English

lines.value: all movement in matter is therefore caused by some immaterial force namely god
lines.name: English

lines.value: but the movements of the body are not analogous to the movements of matter they are caused by a special immaterial force the soul
lines.name: English

lines.value: the soul as being immaterial is immortal and its consciousness does not depend upon its connection with the body
lines.name: English

lines.value: he claimed the argument was supported by an analysis of the phenomena of dreams which are ascribed to direct spiritual influences
lines.name: English

lines.value: lastly baxter attempted to prove that matter is finite
lines.name: English

lines.value: baxter's inquiry met rather different reactions
lines.name: English

lines.value: e.g it was criticized by benjamin franklin in a letter which pointed on baxter's lack of understand in mechanics yet left a lasting impression on samuel taylor coleridge who said i should not wonder if i found that andrew had thought more on the subject of dreams than any other of our psychologists scotch or english'
lines.name: English

lines.value: his work is an attack on john toland's letters to serena 1704 which argued that motion is essential to matter and on locke and berkeley
lines.name: English

lines.value: his criticism of berkeley in the second volume is however based on the common misinterpretation of his theory
lines.name: English

lines.value: sir leslie stephen described him as a curious example of the effects of an exploded metaphysics on a feeble though ingenious intellect
lines.name: English

lines.value: baxter's ideas on dreams were contested by thomas branch in his thoughts on dreaming 1738
lines.name: English

lines.value: syndicate wars is the second video game title in the syndicate series created by bullfrog productions in 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was released for dos and the playstation
lines.name: English

lines.value: syndicate wars presents a followup to the events in syndicate taking place 95 years later the year 2191
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the game's opening the player controlled syndicate called eurocorp is at the peak of its power achieved in the previous game an alliance of corporations controlling the world through a combination of military and economic power and technological mind control
lines.name: English

lines.value: corporate decisions are facilitated through a number of ai entities connected through a global communications network
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the game opens this totalitarian status quo is threatened by the emergence of a virus named "" in the global communications system damaging mind control implants and leaving citizens vulnerable to co option
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the newly liberated persons dubbed unguided citizens choose to engage in an armed insurrection
lines.name: English

lines.value: the unguided appear in early missions as random antagonistic elements but over time form a well organized militia
lines.name: English

lines.value: viral damage to the global network causes disruption to syndicate coordinations with individual stations isolating themselves to avoid receiving rogue communication
lines.name: English

lines.value: the london station as the headquarters of the eurocorp syndicate attempts to regain authority via direct intervention by the game's signature quartets of heavily armed agents
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bulk of the game concerns the development of armed conflict between eurocorp and the church of the new epoch a church led by a group called the nine seeking to undermine the world rule by corporations in favor of subjecting its parishioners to its own variety of mind control
lines.name: English

lines.value: harbinger was their first step in demolishing the existing world order
lines.name: English

lines.value: as insurrections take hold the player is also obliged to conduct missions to control rogue elements within the syndicate itself as various sub corporations change allegiances or make bids for independence
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ironic parallels between the objectives of church of the new epoch and the original eurocorp syndicate itself are abundantly clear throughout the game and indeed the game can be played from the point of view of the church itself to similar ends indeed it is revealed very early in the game when played on the church's side that the disciple in control of church agents is a former eurocorp agent who has been converted
lines.name: English

lines.value: syndicate wars preserves the isometric view of syndicate while adding rotation and pitch controls over the view
lines.name: English

lines.value: control over one's agents or acolytes when playing as the church is largely the same as the previous syndicate games being based on a combination of keyboard and mouse actions
lines.name: English

lines.value: agents may be commanded singly or in groups with simple instructions to assume positions pursue or attack npcs collect items etc agents may be set to behave passively acting only when commanded or to react to threats through control of brain and adrenal functions the effectiveness of this autonomous operation may be improved over the course of the game through cybernetic brain upgrades amongst others
lines.name: English

lines.value: notably the player has access to view the entire area of the game map for a level on first entering it an area of the map need not be seen by the physical characters for its terrain and events to be known
lines.name: English

lines.value: this often allows the player to formulate a strategy and plan routes through the map
lines.name: English

lines.value: consequently the player generally has a good idea of the forces opposing him or her before starting the level aside from cases where opposing elements were previously concealed in vehicles buildings etc the armament of those forces however is generally known only by comparison to other recently encountered forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: the relatively simplistic combat mechanics of syndicate wars do not provide much scope for sophistication in infantry tactics
lines.name: English

lines.value: combat tactics in the game are usually centered on maneuvering to attack small portions ideally one or two agents of the opposing force at a time with intervals in between for regeneration of health body shield strength and ammunition energy by one's own agents
lines.name: English

lines.value: with only four controllable agents the player's own forces are almost always outnumbered and hence most combat strategy is simply a matter of possessing superior weaponry while avoiding encirclement or confrontation with large numbers of enemies simultaneously
lines.name: English

lines.value: some missions however require multiple objectives to be completed simultaneously and therefore require the team to be split up into pairs or even individual agents
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some instances use of terrain can be significant such as when attempting to approach a target while remaining immune to long range small arms fire or when attempting to ensure an open field of engagement in which to use area of effect weapons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the selection of weapons in syndicate wars are quite similar to those in the previous games being principally an array of small arms weapons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the weapon of choice for the early game is the minigun chosen for good range and damage properties
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is later supplemented by long range rifles medium range gauss guns and a variety of directed energy weapons from a basic pulse laser to the highly destructive graviton gun
lines.name: English

lines.value: other more specialized weapons also appear
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is no ammunition per se instead all reusable items draw power from a portable micro fusion reactor carried by each agent
lines.name: English

lines.value: sustained use depletes a shared stored energy pool which is gradually replenished
lines.name: English

lines.value: in general the more effective the weapon the more energy it requires and hence the lower the rate of fire
lines.name: English

lines.value: at later stages of the game management of this recharging time becomes a significant element of combat tactics
lines.name: English

lines.value: as other weapons or other items are encountered in the game they may be passed to one's research and development teams for productization any enemy weapon captured may be used immediately and carried into future missions but must be productized before more copies can be purchased or to reduce the energy cost of using it most of the landscape in syndicate wars is destructible in the face of explosive weapons most notably high explosive charges and even nuclear grenades which can be used to destroy buildings for example when robbing banks to secure capital and kinetic bombardment from armed satellites
lines.name: English

lines.value: the persuadertron from the first game also reappears now with three models
lines.name: English

lines.value: persuadertrons or for the church of the new epoch the indoctrinator are hand held mind control devices which enslave persons nearby
lines.name: English

lines.value: an upgraded version referred to as the persuadertron 2 is available when playing as eurocorp as the game progresses
lines.name: English

lines.value: persuaded persons follow the agent holding the persuadertron until one or the other is killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: they will also collect dropped weapons and fight on behalf of the persuadertron's wielder albeit with limited effectiveness
lines.name: English

lines.value: many missions involve the use of this device to abduct scientists or executives friendly to opposing factions in the syndicate
lines.name: English

lines.value: in many cases persons persuaded become available to the player as research scientists or agents
lines.name: English

lines.value: the range and effectiveness of the persuadertron varies with the brain implant sophistication of the agent wielding it and the number of persons already persuaded at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of ground vehicles appear in syndicate wars
lines.name: English

lines.value: some are taken directly from another bullfrog game hi octane while others are stylistically similar to those found in syndicate these differ in durability but all have essentially unlimited personnel capacity for the player's agents and persuaded persons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the game adds a series of flying vehicles as well in some missions which are used as antagonists and may be captured for use by the player
lines.name: English

lines.value: vehicles are self navigating from an interface perspective the player picks the point on or near a street and the vehicle will drive or fly there without further intervention assuming the point was reachable
lines.name: English

lines.value: the self navigation is fairly robust almost always choosing an ideal route and avoiding confusion from loops and overpasses
lines.name: English

lines.value: most missions in syndicate wars adopt one or two basic motifs of action assassination persuasion etc these motifs are as in the original syndicate often explicit in the player's mission orders
lines.name: English

lines.value: combined with the background story presented for each most missions further the basic plot as the confrontation between eurocorp and church of the new epoch develops
lines.name: English

lines.value: missions differ from one another less in terms of their objectives as in their settings complexity and combat elements
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the game maps are generally quite similar depicting futuristic technological cities with roads buildings parks etc the map layout and architectural differences between each city are often significant and many cities have unique buildings parks or sculptures
lines.name: English

lines.value: syndicate wars was developed by bullfrog productions using a modified version of the engine used in magic carpet
lines.name: English

lines.value: the development team leader mike diskett recounted that " in the first [syndicate] one of the biggest complaints was it was an isometric view and if you walked behind a building that was it you couldn't see yourself
lines.name: English

lines.value: so now you can walk behind buildings and simply rotate the map so you can always keep yourself in view
lines.name: English

lines.value: we had to wait for a while for the technology to catch up so we could actually do that the ai was also enhanced so that enemies would work as a team whereas in the original syndicate each one would act as though unaware of the other members of their group
lines.name: English

lines.value: diskett described the multiplayer mode as a mixture of quake and command & conquer because you end up with the quake aspect of just going out there to kill as many people as possible but you also build bases up
lines.name: English

lines.value: this isn't something we've designed in this is just how we ended up playing it syndicate wars includes in game advertising for manga entertainment's ghost in the shell and judge dredd from 2000 ad
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was originally announced that the game would be released exclusively for the playstation in the second quarter of 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead in 1996 it was released for dos with the delayed playstation version arriving in 1997
lines.name: English

lines.value: a sega saturn version was being coded by a programmer who used the pseudonym zzkj but was never published
lines.name: English

lines.value: during development zzkj commented " the first thing we had to do was figure out what can be done in the 2d part of the saturn
lines.name: English

lines.value: that then tells me what i need to fit in the available space then we figure out what can actually fit in the available space and then the initial stages of the saturn conversion is to basically get the engine up and running
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was difficult because the saturn's only got 2 mb of ram it can be done but the saturn is pushed a bit which is why i took the project on i don't believe in doing easy projects in 2008 a digital distribution version on the playstation network of the playstation version was released
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 2010 two game community developers finished a reverse engineering project of syndicate wars and released builds for windows mac and linux
lines.name: English

lines.value: this version is complete beside the networking and joystick part
lines.name: English

lines.value: syndicate wars received a generally positive reception
lines.name: English

lines.value: a reviewer for next generation described it as even more dark and menacing than the original he said that while the graphics suffer from chunkiness and ragged characters in the standard vga mode in svga mode they are stunning
lines.name: English

lines.value: while he complained that the control interface is a pain to adjust to he found the new weapons completely interactive environments and numerous missions make it worthwhile to do so
lines.name: English

lines.value: while similarly praising the polygonal graphics interactive environments and numerous missions greg kasavin of gamespot found the characters to be overly small and hard to discern between even in svga and complained that the rotational graphics engine often results in enemies getting free hits
lines.name: English

lines.value: he nonetheless concluded syndicate wars masterfully recaptures the dark deadly emotion of the original adds to it a huge variety of weapons and scenarios and refurbishes it with a gorgeous new coat of paint it won computer games strategy pluss 1996 action game of the year award
lines.name: English

lines.value: bullfrog originally planned to create another game in the syndicate universe named creation
lines.name: English

lines.value: in syndicate wars are therefore in game ads for creation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the game's premise was that a rival corporation funds a space mission to a planet that may be able to support life from earth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the planet is mostly water so a submersible craft is the only means to explore it and catalogue the alien aquatic life while avoiding the syndicate eurocorp that wants to thwart your mission
lines.name: English

lines.value: creation was cancelled in development and never released
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a 2006 interview at the leipzig games convention for gamespot syndicate wars producer peter molyneux said that he would like to revisit some of his old efforts but adds that it is very unlikely that will happen
lines.name: English

lines.value: but molyneux makes one possible exception aside from the licensing complications some sort of next gen online version of syndicate would certainly be popular with gamers starbreeze studios developed a new syndicate game for ea which was released on 21 february 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 15 may 2013 mike diskett syndicate wars lead posted a video on youtube that revealed an imminent june kickstarter crowdfunding campaign for a new spiritual successor to syndicate wars
lines.name: English

lines.value: the satellite reign named game was successfully crowdfunded on july 29 2013 and released on august 28 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: peter pete joseph incaviglia born april 2 1964 is a retired major league baseball mlb left fielder
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was drafted in the first round eighth overall pick by the montreal expos in the 1985 amateur draft out of oklahoma state university but was traded later the same year to the texas rangers
lines.name: English

lines.value: he debuted in the major leagues on april 8 1986 without having spent any time in the minor leagues
lines.name: English

lines.value: incaviglia played for 12 seasons from 1986 to 1998 with six different teams
lines.name: English

lines.value: his last game was on september 27 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was noted for his power but also for his tendency to strike out
lines.name: English

lines.value: he led the majors in strikeouts by a hitter in 1986 and 1988
lines.name: English

lines.value: he struck out 1277 times in his career
lines.name: English

lines.value: he owns the single season national collegiate athletic association ncaa home run record with 48 and run batted in record with 143
lines.name: English

lines.value: at oklahoma state incaviglia became one of the greatest power hitters in college baseball history
lines.name: English

lines.value: in three seasons he amassed 100 home runs in 213 games and had a career slugging percentage of .915
lines.name: English

lines.value: in his junior season he hit 48 home runs and finished the year with an ncaa record 1.140 slugging percentage
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also led oklahoma state to the college world series in each of his three seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is still the ncaa division i baseball all time leader in home runs in a career and home runs in a season
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was elected to the college baseball hall of fame in 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: incaviglia's rookie season came in 1986
lines.name: English

lines.value: drafted by the montreal expos he refused to play a day in the minor leagues
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was traded to the texas rangers in exchange for bob sebra and jim anderson
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rangers would grant the request and make him the 15th player in major league history to debut in the majors without ever playing minor league ball since the amateur draft began in 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had the tenth most home runs in the league 30 and set a rangers club record but also struck out the most times in 1986 and currently holds eighth place on the single season strikeout record
lines.name: English

lines.value: his rookie season set a standard that he would be unable to match the rest of his career
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1987 his home run output decreased by three but his batting average climbed 21 points he had a better slugging percentage and he cut down his strikeouts by 17.incaviglia hit at least 20 home runs in his first five seasons all with texas
lines.name: English

lines.value: his playing time and production dropped thereafter in single seasons with detroit and houston but his career received a boost when he was signed by the philadelphia phillies before the 1993 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: he and fellow outfielder jim eisenreich were key acquisitions for the team that would go on to win the division and reach the world series one year after finishing in last place
lines.name: English

lines.value: in just 368 at bats incaviglia hit 24 home runs and drove in a career best 89 runs
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also posted career highs in ops .848 and war 2.9
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result of the expos trading incaviglia immediately after signing him major league baseball instituted a rule whereby a team cannot trade a drafted player until he has been under contract to the club for at least one year
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was known as the pete incaviglia rule
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rule was changed during the 2015 season allowing teams to trade drafted players the day after the world series concludes
lines.name: English

lines.value: incaviglia was the hitting coach for the erie seawolves the detroit tigers class aa affiliate in the eastern league for the three seasons but was dismissed at the end of the 2006 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: incaviglia was announced as the first manager of the grand prairie airhogs on october 24 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airhogs began play in may 2008 in the american association of independent professional baseball and reached the southern division playoffs in his first season as their manager
lines.name: English

lines.value: after five seasons as manager of the laredo lemurs even winning the 2015 american association championship he returned to the airhogs as hitting coach after the lemurs shut down operations prior to the 2017 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 6 2017 incaviglia was announced as the second manager of the sugar land skeeters a position vacated by gary gaetti
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 20 2007 incaviglia was named in jason grimsley's unsealed affidavit as an alleged user of amphetamines
lines.name: English

lines.value: kabhi haan kabhi naa () is a 1994 indian hindi romantic coming of age comedy film directed by kundan shah and starring shah rukh khan suchitra krishnamurthy and deepak tijori
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is one of the rare mainstream hindi movies in which the hero plays the role of a loser
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is widely considered to be one of shah rukh khan's best performances and he has said that it is his favourite film
lines.name: English

lines.value: he received the filmfare critics award for best performance for his role
lines.name: English

lines.value: for this film khan took a signing amount of rs 5000 and did the entire film for rs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was remade in telugu as swapnalokam 1999 with jagapathi babu
lines.name: English

lines.value: shah rukh khan has bought the rights to the film under his banner red chillies entertainment
lines.name: English

lines.value: the movie begins with sunil shah rukh khan being woken up from his dream of marrying the girl he loves anna suchitra krishnamurthy by sunil's sister sadiya siddiqui
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil is a happy go lucky scamp who loves music and is not interested in studies which bothers his father vinayak anjan srivastav
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil anna and chris deepak tijori are 3 members of a 6-person music band who are looking to make it big
lines.name: English

lines.value: anna rejoins the group after being away for a while which makes chris happy too as he too loves anna
lines.name: English

lines.value: after anna reenters his life sunil begins to try and change his ways in order to get anna to fall in love with him
lines.name: English

lines.value: during a performance at a friend's wedding sunil realises that anna and chris have some chemistry between them
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil is devastated so he decides to create a rift between anna and chris
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil eventually gets caught in his own web of lies
lines.name: English

lines.value: anna furious with sunil for such a betrayal slaps him and decides to never talk to sunil ever after
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil is thrown out of the band for being a miscreant
lines.name: English

lines.value: however as luck were to have it fortune favours sunil who saves the band from being heckled at a local club performance by putting on a stellar show so the entire band forgives and forgets
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile anna's father has been giving thought to getting her settled in life and decides that chris is worthy of the honour
lines.name: English

lines.value: he makes his intentions known to approach chris parents with a proposal
lines.name: English

lines.value: however chris parents have other ideas and decide chris marriage to their friend's daughter
lines.name: English

lines.value: anna and her family are dejected
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil consoles anna during this time and the tide slowly turns in his favour
lines.name: English

lines.value: anna's father having realised that sunil will love and take care of anna convince anna to marry sunil
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil is overjoyed until he realises anna still loves chris
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil decides to reunite the two and get them married
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the wedding day as chris and anna are about to exchange rings chris ring slips out of his hand and rolls out of sight
lines.name: English

lines.value: everybody starts searching for it
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunil spots the ring but feigns ignorance even as his younger sister gazes at him with a heavy heart
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually chris locates the ring and the couple get married
lines.name: English

lines.value: just after the wedding sunil is shown sitting on the sidewalk dejected and heartbroken
lines.name: English

lines.value: by happenstance a random girl juhi chawla who is lost and is seeking directions approaches sunil
lines.name: English

lines.value: some time later sunil and the girl are seen walking in the moonlight and talking merrily
lines.name: English

lines.value: the movie ends with anthony and vasco two criminals who are a part of the story see sunil with the new girl and break the fourth wall saying that sunil will be alright
lines.name: English

lines.value: the criminals hear the police siren and immediately scamper away as the credits roll
lines.name: English

lines.value: the music and background score was composed by jatin lalit while the lyrics were penned by majrooh sultanpuri
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song sachi ye kahani hai samples the boney m song rasputin
lines.name: English

lines.value: selsun blue is an over the counter brand of dandruff shampoo now owned by sanofi
lines.name: English

lines.value: first made by abbott laboratories the brand was bought by chattem in 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: chattem was acquired by sanofi in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: selsun blue has been marketed as a more effective alternative to brand leader head & shoulders due to its superior performance in randomized trials
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the counter selsun blue contains 1% selenium sulfide as its active ingredient in its most popular version the word selsun is a portmanteau of selenium sulfide + n
lines.name: English

lines.value: chattem announced that on november 1 2005 they would introduce a new line of shampoos under the brand name selsun salon
lines.name: English

lines.value: these contained a different active ingredient than selsun blue pyrithione zinc 1% and are oriented toward the higher end shampoo market
lines.name: English

lines.value: other active ingredients such as salicylic acid and botanicals are in other versions of selsun blue brand dandruff shampoo
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2011 the selsun blue brand consisted of 15 products spread across two brand segments naturals and base
lines.name: English

lines.value: the naturals line of products contains the active ingredient salicylic acid in addition to 8 moisturizers & botanicals plus vitamins b5 & e salicylic acid is a keratolytic agent that assists with cell shedding or flaking
lines.name: English

lines.value: the base brand consists of six types including medicated with menthol 2-in-1 normal to oily moisturizing itchy dry scalp and deep cleansing with micro beads
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first four types contain the active ingredient selenium sulfide which has been shown to have anti fungal properties
lines.name: English

lines.value: more specifically selenium sulfide an anti infective agent relieves itching and flaking of the scalp and removes the dry scaly particles commonly referred to as dandruff or seborrhea
lines.name: English

lines.value: selenium sulfide is also used to treat tinea versicolor a fungal infection of the skin
lines.name: English

lines.value: deep cleansing was launched by chattem in january 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to the active ingredient salicylic acid the product contains scrubbing micro beads
lines.name: English

lines.value: like chattem's other products selsun blue is sold through mass merchandisers drug and food retailers
lines.name: English

lines.value: * official website
