lines.value: double truck refers to a pair of facing pages usually in a newspaper or magazine with content that stretches over both pages
lines.name: English

lines.value: in most newspapers and magazines the booklet like format is accomplished by folding large sheets of paper in half
lines.name: English

lines.value: this allows the pages to be opened like a book
lines.name: English

lines.value: sometimes usually only in magazines the pages are stapled or stitched at the fold to hold the pages together
lines.name: English

lines.value: under this technique each sheet of paper is actually four separate pages of the finished product
lines.name: English

lines.value: two pages appear next to each other on the front of the sheet with the other two likewise on the reverse side
lines.name: English

lines.value: each time an additional sheet is added the publication gains four additional pages
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of this most newspapers and publications are printed with page multiples of four
lines.name: English

lines.value: this creates a rather confusing arrangement of pages
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example in a 16 page newspaper which uses 4 sheets of paper the pages are arranged as follows notice how in this example the two middle pages 8 and 9 will appear next to each other on the back of sheet d this creates a double truck
lines.name: English

lines.value: on a typical newspaper page there is a margin on all four sides say 1 inch all around
lines.name: English

lines.value: obviously you don't want print running right against the edge of the paper but you also don't want print to run into the fold or where the publication might be stapled
lines.name: English

lines.value: however when the two pages meet in the middle like 8 and 9 in our example this isn't a concern because both pages appear right next to each other and lie relatively flat
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a double truck the text and images on the pages crosses over the fold
lines.name: English

lines.value: this can create some eye catching visual effects
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example newspaper often use a double truck to display large illustrations graphics maps or photo collages often in full color
lines.name: English

lines.value: often double trucks are saved for special reports or in depth graphical elements
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition it is also possible to produce double truck advertisements which are quite eye catching as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: typically advertisers pay a premium price for such ads
lines.name: English

lines.value: although newspapers are most frequently published with page counts in multiples of four it is possible to achieve page counts in multiples of two
lines.name: English

lines.value: to do this a sheet of paper with only one page on each side is added often but not always in the center
lines.name: English

lines.value: this sheet sometimes called a dink is half the size of a normal sheet because it doesn't have a mate next to it
lines.name: English

lines.value: dinks are generally not used in magazines or bound publications because they cannot be held in place
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name double truck comes from the days when the heavy forms for newspaper pages the metal version of each page largely filled with lead type were rolled around the composing room floor on heavy carts called trucks
lines.name: English

lines.value: two pages for one project meant a double truck
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kossuth bridge or kossuth hid was a bridge that stood over the river danube in budapest from 15 january 1946 to 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the soviet red army took budapest in early 1945 they found all the city's five bridges had been blown up by retreating german troops
lines.name: English

lines.value: arpad hid was not blown up it was just incomplete under construction
lines.name: English

lines.value: soon a pontoon bridge was created for military logistical purposes but its capacity proved insufficient and presence of winter icepacks on the danube made it impossible to maintain a permanent link across the 290-metre-wide river with a floating bridge
lines.name: English

lines.value: a decision was made to build a spar type bridge in record time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the total destruction of industry and lack of raw materials in hungary required cannibalizing several dozen oil wells in the oil fields of zala county for the construction project
lines.name: English

lines.value: steel piping was pulled from the depths and used as the main spars for the bridge
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is said some steel from gunbarrels from abandoned and destroyed world war ii battle tanks were incorporated in the structure
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of the tight schedule and design restrictions dictated by available substandard materials the bridge was built with numerous concrete pylons with smallish 30 and 40-metre-wide openings between them
lines.name: English

lines.value: the construction project was entirely carried out by soviet military engineering troops with some 15 fatalities due to hurry and harsh work conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: this claim soviet troops erecting is incorrect
lines.name: English

lines.value: the design collective was led by hilvert elek and endre misteth engineers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the erection project management were done by zsigmondy bela erdelyi and vajda valamint fabian somogyi and gyorgy companies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the top overseer chief project manager was szechy karoly
lines.name: English

lines.value: the steel structure was manufactured by weiss manfred rt and the gyori waggongyar
lines.name: English

lines.value: the permanent link built right at the southern corner of budapest's parliament building was often referred to as the link of life especially in the leftist press
lines.name: English

lines.value: indeed for six months until 20 august 1946 it was the only connection between the two halves of the city buda and pest
lines.name: English

lines.value: officially inaugurated as the lajos kossuth bridge it was named after the patriot leader of hungary's 1848-49 revolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to its hasty construction the kossuth bridge had several restrictions on use
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was used mainly for pedestrian crossing
lines.name: English

lines.value: heavier trucks could cross at 20 km h and in only one direction at a time
lines.name: English

lines.value: during sessions of parliament it was sometimes shut down for noise and security reasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: both bus and truck traffic was on the bridge numerous photographs and news film clips attest to that
lines.name: English

lines.value: in three years following world war ii all of the demolished danube bridges were rebuilt except elizabeth bridge easing the traffic situation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kossuth bridge gradually became a maintenance problem and its low span more of an obstacle to shipping on the river danube
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was finally shut down in 1957 and dismantled in 1960 and not replaced
lines.name: English

lines.value: nowadays only two plaques embedded in the riverbanks remind visitors of the bridge's former location
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is thought that a bridge will be erected in the same place around 2020 as part of the long term budapest infrastructure modernization program
lines.name: English

lines.value: eyebeam was a daily comic strip written and illustrated by sam hurt at the university of texas at austin
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike most college strips its popularity led to a print life past hurt's graduation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the strip ran in the college's daily texan from 1980 1990 though examples from 1978-1979 exist
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1983 austin's daily paper the american statesman picked up the strip
lines.name: English

lines.value: other newspapers around the us followed suit although eyebeam's family of subscribers was never greater than a few dozen
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1982 eyebeam's popularity was such that a monster character called hank the hallucination ran for the university of texas student government presidency campaign slogan get real and won
lines.name: English

lines.value: a figment of eyebeam's imagination even within the boundaries of the comic hank received more votes than the two human candidates combined
lines.name: English

lines.value: after it was ruled that imaginary characters could not serve in the post future democratic adviser and cnn political contributor paul begala was the campus second choice
lines.name: English

lines.value: following his loss begala wrote a tongue in cheek complaint for the texan arguing i cannot help but feel hank's platform is illusory at best i must say that the candidate himself lacks substance the strip developed a devoted enough fanbase to support a steady series of paperback collections as well as ancillary merchandise such as t shirts
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning as a fairly typical college life strip eyebeam quickly mutated into something more
lines.name: English

lines.value: besides the title character a bemused rail thin lawyer and acceptor of weirdness and the aforementioned hank regular characters included eyebeam's down to earth but sexually voracious girlfriend sally and his best friend the conical ne'er do well ratliff mcnubb
lines.name: English

lines.value: secondary characters included the slacker robot im4u the narcissistic rod rutherford rod's lovestruck girlfriend beth and eyebeam's coworker vernon who seemed to be missing the top of his head
lines.name: English

lines.value: much later ratliff's rambunctious niece peaches burst into the storylines which indirectly led to the strip's demise
lines.name: English

lines.value: hurt's drawing style was thick and loose and used periodically shifting backgrounds as were found in george herriman's krazy kat
lines.name: English

lines.value: a vase of flowers for example could be exchanged for an umbrella stand and then a fountain without narrative explanation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the strip's logo was similarly ever changing
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the strip's odder visual elements were accepted at face value if discussed at all such as sally's endless jet stream of hair ratliff's sea of trash bedroom or ratliff's spherical automobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1990 hurt abandoned the comic strip taking an offer from united feature syndicate to start a new strip based on the peaches character queen of the universe the strip was sometimes called peaches queen of the universe hurt's freewheeling style did not translate as well under the syndicated system which was apparently hoping for a female calvin character and the latter strip was not a success
lines.name: English

lines.value: hurt described the strip's demise as the result of a printing accident [it] drowned in a sea of red ink some readers felt the most eyebeam like sequences of the strip's run came at the very end after hurt had gotten the cancellation notice
lines.name: English

lines.value: sam hurt revived eyebeam in 1995 but as a weekly
lines.name: English

lines.value: a comic book series also appeared combining reprints with fresh material
lines.name: English

lines.value: hurt discontinued eyebeam for a second time in 2002 and resumed it for a third time in 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2008 the strip appears weekly in the austin chronicle as well as on hurt's website
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the comics journal compiled its 2000 list of the greatest comics of the century eyebeam received one judge's vote
lines.name: English

lines.value: hurt remains in austin texas where he does animation and sculpture
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first of a three volume compilation of hurt's queen of the universe strip was released in 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: eyebeam comics were extensively used in the american bar association's essay compilation full disclosure do you really want to be a lawyer
lines.name: English

lines.value: hurt received a doctor of jurisprudence degree from the university of texas law school in 1983 characters from eyebeam are animated by sam hurt in a music video by brave combo the hokey pokey sally eyebeam ratliff and hank appear
lines.name: English

lines.value: rain lover 1964-1989 was a champion australian thoroughbred racehorse best remembered for their back to back wins in the 1968 and 1969 vrc melbourne cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: rain lover was sired by the good racehorse latin lover gb a son of the unbeaten ribot his dam rain spot was by valognes gb
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was owned and bred by clifford a reid who won the 1945 melbourne cup with rainbird
lines.name: English

lines.value: trainer mick robins a former coal miner from broken hill new south wales had obtained his trainer's licence just three months before he took over rain lover's conditioning
lines.name: English

lines.value: in his first melbourne cup triumph under jockey jim johnson rain lover won by a record eight length margin and in a record time of 3:19.1
lines.name: English

lines.value: controversy surrounded his second win as the hot favourite and heavily backed big philou trained by bart cummings was the victim of a doping scandal and was withdrawn from the race 39 minutes before the start
lines.name: English

lines.value: burdened with 9 st 7 lbs
lines.name: English

lines.value: rain lover still went on to win the race from alsop and created history as the first back to back winner since archer in 1861 and 1862
lines.name: English

lines.value: amongst his other major wins were the sajc adelaide cup vatc st george stakes twice and the ajc chipping norton stakes
lines.name: English

lines.value: retired to stud in 1970 rain lover enjoyed moderate success as a sire before his death in 1989
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of his best winners being princess veronica vatc easter cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: * rain lover's pedigree and partial racing stats
lines.name: English

lines.value: clipper tours was an australian coach operator in sydney
lines.name: English

lines.value: clipper tours was formed by ray cotrill in campsie
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 1964 the business was sold to ron deane who operated deanes coaches on sydney's north shore
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 1985 the business was sold to australian rambler coaches melbourne proprietor don nugent and jim hawkesford
lines.name: English

lines.value: in march 1994 it was sold to ross adair
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the late 1980s a depot was established in canberra with an express service from sydney to canberra commencing in march 1989
lines.name: English

lines.value: this ceased in october 1990 with the canberra depot closed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 1997 the business was purchased by driver group
lines.name: English

lines.value: driver's primary interest in clipper tours was the gray line franchise that it held
lines.name: English

lines.value: having separated this from the business clipper tours was sold back to the deane family in february 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: the deanes by now had sold their north shore operation and were operating south trans
lines.name: English

lines.value: by this stage the operation had relocated from macquarie park to waterloo
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2002 clipper tours was placed in administration
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trading name was purchased by former owner jim hawkesford with some of his hawkesfords coaches fleet having clipper signwriting applied
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2011 hawkesfords was placed in administration and liquidated
lines.name: English

lines.value: when ron deane purchased the business in 1964 it consisted of three bedfords
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1969 the fleet had grown to 13 coaches
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 1970 the first of many denning coaches was purchased
lines.name: English

lines.value: it later purchased mercedes benz o302s and domino products no doubt helped by dennis deane being a domino sales representative
lines.name: English

lines.value: it then purchased man mercedes benz o303 and scania coaches
lines.name: English

lines.value: under deane's ownership clipper tours livery was a variation of the yellow with white and blue deanes coaches livery
lines.name: English

lines.value: following its sale in october 1985 the white with maroon and blue of australian rambler coaches was adopted
lines.name: English

lines.value: when sold back to deane's a variation of the south trans livery was introduced
lines.name: English

lines.value: the national origins formula was an american system of immigration quotas used between 1921 and 1965 which restricted immigration on the basis of existing proportions of the population
lines.name: English

lines.value: it aimed to reduce the overall number of unskilled immigrants to allow families to reunite and to prevent immigration from changing the ethnic distribution of the population
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1921 emergency quota act restricted immigration to 3% of foreign born persons of each nationality that resided in the united states in 1910
lines.name: English

lines.value: the immigration act of 1924 also called the national origins act provided that for three years the formula would change from 3% to 2% and the basis for the calculation would be the census of 1890 instead of that of 1910
lines.name: English

lines.value: after june 30 1927 total immigration from all countries will be limited to 150000 with allocations by country based upon national origins of inhabitants according to the census of 1920
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quota system applied only to non asian immigrants
lines.name: English

lines.value: it aimed to reduce the overall number of unskilled immigrants to allow families to reunite and to prevent immigration from changing the ethnic distribution of the population
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1924 act also included the asian exclusion act which limited immigration to persons eligible for naturalization
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result east asians and south asians were effectively banned from immigrating
lines.name: English

lines.value: africans were also subjected to severe restrictions
lines.name: English

lines.value: immigration from north and south america was not restricted
lines.name: English

lines.value: the immigration and nationality act of 1952 retained but relaxed the national origins formula president truman want to abolish it but congress override his veto
lines.name: English

lines.value: it modified the ratios to be based on the 1920 census and eliminated racial restrictions but retained restrictions by national origin
lines.name: English

lines.value: president harry truman vetoed it because of its continued use of national quotas but the act was passed over his veto
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quotas were in addition to 600000 refugees admitted from europe after world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: the national origins formula was abolished by the immigration and nationality act of 1965 which marked a significant change in american immigration policy
lines.name: English

lines.value: it replaced the system with two quotas for the western and eastern hemispheres
lines.name: English

lines.value: keith david boyce 11 october 1943 - 11 october 1996 was a cricketer who played 21 tests and 8 one day internationals for the west indies between 1971 and 1976
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died from the effects of chronic cirrhosis of the liver while sitting in a chair at a pharmacist's in speightstown barbados on his birthday on october 11th 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: boyce was the first man to take eight wickets in a list a match he achieved the feat when he took 8-26 for essex against lancashire in 1971
lines.name: English

lines.value: no other player dismissed eight batsmen in a one day innings until kent's derek underwood claimed 8-31 against scotland sixteen years later
lines.name: English

lines.value: boyce's finest moment in test cricket came in the first test of the 1973 tour of england when he took 5/70 and 6/77 in a 158-run victory
lines.name: English

lines.value: boyce had been recruited for essex by trevor bailey and in 1974 was named one of the wisden cricketers of the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: following an injury he returned to his home island of barbados where he suffered several personal setbacks
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was married twice and had two daughters
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are the billboard r&b singles chart number one singles of 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: slipstream is a 2005 science fiction film written by louis morneau and phillip badger and directed by david van eyssen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film stars sean astin vinnie jones and ivana milicevic
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was first shown at the london sci fi and fantasy film festival on february 3 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film concerns the efforts of a socially inept scientist sean astin and a female fbi agent ivana milicevic to recover a time travel device called slipstream that was stolen by a group of bank robbers commanded by vinnie jones
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was imagined as part science fiction part action and part buddy comedy
lines.name: English

lines.value: stuart conway sean astin has developed a hand held cellphone like time travel device called slipstream that allows the user to travel back in time 10 minutes by interfacing with a cellphone system regional antenna
lines.name: English

lines.value: at first he uses the device primarily to try albeit unsuccessfully to arrange a date with a female bank clerk
lines.name: English

lines.value: the final time he tries to use the device a group of bank robbers commanded by winston briggs vinnie jones rush into the bank and demand the money from the vault
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time fbi agent sarah tanner ivana milicevic and her male partner jake kevin otto are in the bank tracking stuart
lines.name: English

lines.value: tanner initiates a gunfight against jake's advice
lines.name: English

lines.value: both agents are armed with pistols while the criminals are wielding automatic weapons
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the end of the fight jake is shot and killed because he chased the criminals outside the bank
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the fight stuart had been shot in the chest by a stray bullet
lines.name: English

lines.value: before he dies stuart takes sarah and himself back in time to before the bank robbery and sarah unsuccessfully tries to foil the heist
lines.name: English

lines.value: unfortunately briggs takes the slipstream device as a souvenir
lines.name: English

lines.value: stuart and sarah realize it's only a matter of time before briggs and his cronies discover the true potential of the device
lines.name: English

lines.value: what follows is a high speed car chase of the criminals a hijacking of a bus a highway shootout and a shootout in and downing of a commercial airliner
lines.name: English

lines.value: near the end as a passenger in the falling airplane stuart is able to reverse the entire sequence of events because being airborne he has access to many cellphone relay systems and therefore is not restricted to the 10-minute limit
lines.name: English

lines.value: stuart rewinds time to just before the bank robbery taking sarah with him but briggs grabs on as well and is rewinded too
lines.name: English

lines.value: this time briggs decides not to rob the bank as he knows what will happen and that all of his men will die and he and his men leave without anyone being the wiser
lines.name: English

lines.value: this time stuart is able to get a date with the teller by being himself and escapes using the slipstream device from the bank when he is about to be arrested
lines.name: English

lines.value: sarah is relieved that her partner is alive again and decides to let stuart go as she knows he's harmless
lines.name: English

lines.value: the movie ends with stuart having fun using the slipstream device
lines.name: English

lines.value: george henry thorn junior 12 october 1838 &ndash 15 january 1905 was a member of the queensland legislative assembly and a premier of queensland australia
lines.name: English

lines.value: george thorn junior was born in sydney new south wales a son of george thorn senior and his wife jane nee handcock
lines.name: English

lines.value: his father was one of the founders of the city of ipswich and a founding member of the queensland legislative assembly representing the seat of west moreton
lines.name: English

lines.value: george thorn junior was schooled at the king's school parramatta
lines.name: English

lines.value: he attended the university of sydney and was awarded a bachelor of arts degree in 1858
lines.name: English

lines.value: his sister jane thorn married george harris a member of the queensland legislative council in 1860
lines.name: English

lines.value: the couple lived for 27 years in the now heritage listed newstead house in brisbane where their parties were the highlight of brisbane society
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the 1867 colonial election thorn followed in his father's footsteps by being elected a member of the queensland legislative assembly in the seat of west moreton which he held until the 1873 election
lines.name: English

lines.value: following that he represented the seat of fassifern from 25 november 1873 the 1873 queensland state election until he resigned on 9 january 1874 in order to be appointed to the queensland legislative council on 9 january 1874
lines.name: English

lines.value: his brother john thorn won the resulting by election in fassifern on 24 january 1874
lines.name: English

lines.value: during thorn's time on the legislative council he was the government's representative in the council
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also held the role of queensland postmaster general 9 january 1874 to 8 july 1876
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 14 june 1876 arthur macalister member for ipswich resigned
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the legislative council was a lifetime appointment thorn resigned on 16 june 1876 to successfully contest the seat of ipswich at a by election on 20 june 1876
lines.name: English

lines.value: thorn became premier of queensland and secretary for public works and mines on 5 june 1876
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he resigned from these roles on 8 march 1877 but remained in the ministry of his successor john douglas as secretary for public works from 8 march 1877 to 7 november 1877 and then as secretary for public lands and mines from 7 november 1877 to 6 february 1878
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 14 february 1878 thorn married celia constance maude uniacke daughter of richard uniacke of melbourne at ellengowan on the darling downs
lines.name: English

lines.value: thorn resigned from the seat of ipswich on 18 february 1878
lines.name: English

lines.value: john macfarlane won the resulting by election on 7 march 1878
lines.name: English

lines.value: thorn became queensland commissioner to the 1878 paris exposition
lines.name: English

lines.value: on his return from europe on 17 april 1879 by another by election he successfully contested the seat of northern downs and held it until the 1883 election in september
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 19 july 1887 alfred midgley the member for fassifern resigned
lines.name: English

lines.value: thorn won the resulting by election on 4 august 1887
lines.name: English

lines.value: he held the seat until the 1888 election
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 6 may 1893 the 1893 queensland state election thorn was elected again in fassifern
lines.name: English

lines.value: he held the seat until 11 march 1902 when he was defeated in the 1902 election by thomas de montmorency murray prior
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had no further involvement in politics after that
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 15 january 1905 george thorn died from heart failure at his home at booval queensland
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was buried in the anglican section of ipswich general cemetery
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gold mining town thornborough was named after him
lines.name: English

lines.value: <references >
lines.name: English

lines.value: euroscepticism also known as eu scepticism means criticism of the european union eu and european integration
lines.name: English

lines.value: it can also mean opposition to and total rejection of the eu anti-eu-ism
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main sources of euroscepticism have been notions that integration weakens national sovereignty and the nation state that there is a democratic deficit in the european union that the eu is too bureaucratic that it encourages high levels of migration or perceptions that it is a neoliberal organisation which benefits the business elite at the expense of the working class
lines.name: English

lines.value: euroscepticism is found in political parties across the political spectrum both left wing and right wing
lines.name: English

lines.value: recently the rise in populist right wing parties in europe is strongly linked to a rise in euroscepticism on the continent
lines.name: English

lines.value: eurobarometer surveys of eu citizens show that trust in the eu and its institutions has declined strongly since a peak in 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: since then it has been consistently below 50%
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 2009 survey showed that support for eu membership was lowest in latvia the united kingdom uk and hungary
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 2016 the countries viewing the eu most unfavourably were greece france spain and the uk
lines.name: English

lines.value: a referendum on continued eu membership was held in the uk in 2016 which resulted in a 51.9% vote in favour of leaving the eu
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 2015 trust in the eu has risen slightly in most eu countries as a consequence of falling unemployment rates and accelerating economic growth
lines.name: English

lines.value: euroscepticism should not be confused with anti europeanism as the former is internal while the latter is external and the latter refers to rejection of european culture and europeanisation and sentiments opinions and discrimination against european ethnic groups
lines.name: English

lines.value: the opposite of euroscepticism is known as pro europeanism or european unionism
lines.name: English

lines.value: while having some overlaps euroscepticism and anti europeanism are different
lines.name: English

lines.value: anti europeanism has always had a strong influence in american culture and american exceptionalism which sometimes sees europe on the decline or as a rising rival power or both
lines.name: English

lines.value: some aspects of euroscepticism in the united kingdom have been mirrored by us authors
lines.name: English

lines.value: there can be considered to be several different types of eurosceptic thought which differ in the extent to which adherents reject integration between member states of the european union eu and in their reasons for doing so
lines.name: English

lines.value: aleks szczerbiak and paul taggart described two of these as hard and soft euroscepticism
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to taggart and szczerbiak hard euroscepticism also called anti eu ism is a principled opposition to the eu and european integration and therefore can be seen in parties who think that their countries should withdraw from membership or whose policies towards the eu are tantamount to being opposed to the whole project of european integration as it is currently conceived the europe of freedom and direct democracy group in the european parliament typified by such parties as the united kingdom independence party ukip displays hard euroscepticism
lines.name: English

lines.value: in western european eu member countries hard euroscepticism is currently a characteristic of many anti establishment parties
lines.name: English

lines.value: some hard eurosceptics prefer to call themselves eurorealists rather than sceptics and regard their position as pragmatic rather than in principle
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally tony benn a left wing labour party mp who fought against european integration in 1975 by opposing membership of the european communities in that year's referendum on the issue emphasised his opposition to xenophobia and his support of democracy saying my view about the european union has always been not that i am hostile to foreigners but that i am in favour of democracy [...] i think they're building an empire there they want us to be a part of their empire and i don't want that the czech president vaclav klaus rejected the term euroscepticism for its purported negative undertones saying at a meeting in april 2012 that the expressions for a eurosceptic and their opponent should be a euro realist and someone who is euro naive respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: francois asselineau of the french popular republican union has criticised the use of the term sceptic to describe hard eurosceptics and would rather advocate the use of the term euro opponent
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he believes the use of the term sceptic for soft eurosceptics to be correct since other eurosceptic parties in france are merely criticising the eu without taking into account the fact that the treaty on the functioning of the european union can only be modified with a unanimous agreement of all the eu member states something he considers impossible to achieve
lines.name: English

lines.value: soft euroscepticism is support for the existence of and membership of a form of european union but with opposition to specific eu policies or in taggart's and szczerbiak's words where there is not a principled objection to european integration or eu membership but where concerns on one or a number of policy areas lead to the expression of qualified opposition to the eu or where there is a sense that national interest is currently at odds with the eu's trajectory the european conservatives and reformists group typified by centre right parties such as the british conservative party or czech civic democratic party along with the european united left nordic green left which is an alliance of the left wing parties in the european parliament display soft euroscepticism
lines.name: English

lines.value: some have claimed that there is no clear line between the presumed hard and soft euroscepticism
lines.name: English

lines.value: kopecky and mudde have said that if the demarcation line is the number of and which policies a party opposes then the question arises of how many must a party oppose and which ones should a party oppose that makes them hard eurosceptic instead of soft
lines.name: English

lines.value: some scholars consider the gradual difference in terminology between hard and soft euroscepticism inadequate to accommodate the large differences in terms of political agenda
lines.name: English

lines.value: therefore hard euroscepticism has also been referred to as europhobia as opposed to mere euroscepticism
lines.name: English

lines.value: other alternative names for hard and soft euroscepticism include respectively withdrawalist and reformist euroscepticism
lines.name: English

lines.value: a survey in conducted by tns opinion and social on behalf of the european commission showed that across the eu as a whole those with a positive image of the eu are down from a high of 52% in 2007 to 37% in autumn 2015 this compares with 23% with a negative image of the eu and 38% with a neutral image
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 43% of europeans thought things were going in the wrong direction in the eu compared with 23% who thought things were going in the right direction 11% don't know
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 32% of eu citizens tend to trust the eu as an institution and about 55% do not tend to trust it 13% don't know
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz officially known as nuestra senora de la paz (; '), also named chuqi yapu chuquiago in aymara is the seat of government and the de facto national capital of the plurinational state of bolivia the constitutional capital of bolivia is sucre
lines.name: English

lines.value: with an estimated 789541 residents as of 2015 la paz is the third most populous city in bolivia after santa cruz de la sierra and el alto
lines.name: English

lines.value: its metropolitan area which is formed by la paz el alto and viacha makes up the most populous urban area in bolivia with a population of 2.3 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also the capital of the la paz department
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city located in west central bolivia southeast of lake titicaca is set in a canyon created by the choqueyapu river
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is located in a bowl like depression surrounded by the high mountains of the altiplano
lines.name: English

lines.value: overlooking the city is the towering triple peaked illimani
lines.name: English

lines.value: its peaks are always snow covered and can be seen from many parts of the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: at an elevation of roughly above sea level la paz is the highest capital city in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to its altitude la paz has an unusual subtropical highland climate with rainy summers and dry winters
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz was founded on october 20 1548 by the spanish conquistador captain alonso de mendoza at the site of the inca settlement of laja as a connecting point between the commercial routes that led from potosi and oruro to lima the full name of the city was originally nuestra senora de la paz meaning our lady of peace in commemoration of the restoration of peace following the insurrection of gonzalo pizarro and fellow conquistadors against the first viceroy of peru
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city was later moved to its present location in the valley of chuquiago marka
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz was under spanish colonial rule as part of the viceroyalty of the rio de la plata before bolivia gained independence
lines.name: English

lines.value: since its founding the city was the site of numerous revolts
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1781 the indigenous leader and independence activist tupac katari laid siege to the city for a total of six months but was finally defeated
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 16 1809 the bolivian patriot pedro domingo murillo ignited a revolution for independence marking the beginning of the spanish american wars of independence which gained the freedom of south american states in 1821
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the seat of the government of bolivia la paz is the site of the palacio quemado the presidential palace
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also the seat of the bolivian legislature the plurinational legislative assembly and numerous government departments and agencies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the constitutional capital of bolivia sucre retains the judicial power
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city hosts numerous foreign embassies as well as international missions in the country
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz is an important political administrative economic and sports center of bolivia it generates 25% of bolivia's gross domestic product and serves as the headquarters for numerous bolivian companies and industries
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz is also an important cultural center of latin america as it hosts several landmarks belonging to the colonial times such as the san francisco church the metropolitan cathedral the plaza murillo and the jaen street
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city is renowned for its unique markets particularly the witches market and for its vibrant nightlife
lines.name: English

lines.value: its unusual topography offers unique views of the city and the surrounding mountains of the cordillera real from numerous natural viewing points
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz is also home to both the longest and highest urban cable car network in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 2015 it was officially recognized as one of the new 7 wonders cities together with beirut doha durban havana kuala lumpur a nd vigan
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz is listed on the global cities index 2015 and is considered a global city type gamma by globalization and world cities research network gawc
lines.name: English

lines.value: this area had been the site of an inca city located on a major trading route
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the spanish conquistadors entered the area in 1535 they did not found la paz until 1548
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally it was to be at the site of the native american settlement laja with the full name of the city being nuestra senora de la paz meaning our lady of peace
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name commemorated the restoration of peace following the insurrection of gonzalo pizarro and fellow conquistadors four years earlier against blasco nunez vela the first viceroy of peru
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town site was moved a few days later to its present location in the valley of chuquiago which is more clement
lines.name: English

lines.value: control over the former inca lands had been entrusted to pedro de la gasca by the spanish king and holy roman emperor emperor charles v gasca commanded alonso de mendoza to found a new city commemorating the end of the civil wars in peru the city of la paz was founded on october 20 1548 by alonzo de mendoza with juan de vargas appointed as its first mayor
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1549 juan gutierrez paniagua was commanded to design an urban plan that would designate sites for public areas plazas official buildings and a cathedral
lines.name: English

lines.value: these were meant to express the ideals and relationships of spanish colonial society
lines.name: English

lines.value: la plaza de los espanoles which is known today as the plaza murillo was chosen as the location for government buildings as well as the metropolitan cathedral
lines.name: English

lines.value: spain controlled la paz with a firm grip and the spanish king had the last word in all matters political but consultation was extended taking months or longer by sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: indigenous and other unrest was repeated around the turn of the nineteenth century
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1781 for a total of six months a group of aymara people laid siege to la paz
lines.name: English

lines.value: under the leadership of tupac katari they destroyed churches and government property
lines.name: English

lines.value: thirty years later indians conducted a two month siege against la paz
lines.name: English

lines.value: this incident was the setting for the origin of the legend of the ekeko
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1809 the struggle for independence from the spanish rule brought uprisings against the royalist forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 16 1809 pedro domingo murillo said that the bolivian revolution was igniting a lamp that nobody would be able to turn off
lines.name: English

lines.value: this uprising formally marked the beginning of the liberation of south america from spain
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first open rebellions against the spanish crown took place in la paz and the city of sucre simultaneously
lines.name: English

lines.value: this event is known as the primer grito libertario de america
lines.name: English

lines.value: pedro domingo murillo was hanged at the plaza de los espanoles that night
lines.name: English

lines.value: after bolivia gained independence la paz named this plaza after him to commemorate him always
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is remembered as the voice of revolution across south america
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1825 after the decisive victory of the republicans at ayacucho over the spanish army in the course of the spanish american wars of independence the city's full name was changed to la paz de ayacucho meaning the peace of ayacucho
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1898 la paz was made the de facto seat of the national government with sucre remaining the nominal historical as well as judiciary capital
lines.name: English

lines.value: this change reflected the shift of the bolivian economy away from the largely exhausted silver mines of potosi to the exploitation of tin near oruro and resulting shifts in the distribution of economic and political power among various national elites
lines.name: English

lines.value: located at 16.5 68.1333 la paz is built in a canyon created by the choqueyapu river now mostly built over which runs northwest to southeast
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city's main thoroughfare which roughly follows the river changes names over its length but the central tree lined section running through the downtown core is called the prado
lines.name: English

lines.value: the geography of la paz in particular the altitude is marked by social differences
lines.name: English

lines.value: the more affluent residents live in the lower central areas of the city southwest of the prado
lines.name: English

lines.value: many middle class residents live in high rise condos near the center

lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz is renowned for its unique markets unusual and dramatic topography and traditional culture
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz is located in the valleys of the andes close to the eastern split of the altiplano region
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is closer to such notable mountains as the illimani guardian of la paz huayna potosi mururata and illampu
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: at more than above sea level higher parts of la paz have an unusual subtropical highland climate cwc according to the koppen climate classification with subpolar oceanic characteristics less than 4 months have a mean temperature above 10 c bordering on a tundra climate et
lines.name: English

lines.value: the whole city has rainy summers and dry winters
lines.name: English

lines.value: night time temperatures range from cold to very cold
lines.name: English

lines.value: snow flurries can occur in winter especially at dawn and it usually melts before noon
lines.name: English

lines.value: at these high altitudes despite being located only 16 degrees from the equator the city's average temperature is similar to that of cities such as bergen norway or torshavn faroe islands located as far as 60 and 62 degrees from the equator respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: the temperatures in the central la paz at and in the zona sur southern zone at above sea level are warmer subtropical highland climate cwb according to the koppen classification
lines.name: English

lines.value: owing to the altitude of the city temperatures are consistently cool to mild throughout the year though the diurnal temperature variation is typically large
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city has a relatively dry climate with rainfall occurring mainly in the slightly warmer months of november to march
lines.name: English

lines.value: at 4012 metres february and march the two cloudiest months of the year both in late summer receive a low daily average of around 5 hours of sunshine
lines.name: English

lines.value: conversely june and july the two sunniest months of the year both in winter receive an abundant daily average of around 8 hours of sunshine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the seasonally uneven distribution of the year's annual precipitation often results in destructive mudslides experienced in summer due to the excessive amount of precipitation typically observed throughout the season

lines.value: the city of la paz has a consistently decreasing volume of colonial buildings mostly centered around the vicinity of the plaza murillo
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to a lack of funds and the inability of property owners to pay for restorations to colonial buildings many have been torn down or are in a dilapidated state
lines.name: English

lines.value: as historic buildings are more expensive to keep land owners find it less of a burden to construct more modern buildings as opposed to keeping the old ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: although there has been an increasing number of projects and propositions to restore some of the city's colonial buildings the future of these historic edifices remains uncertain
lines.name: English

lines.value: the economy of la paz has improved greatly in recent years mainly as a result of improved political stability
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to the long period of high inflation and economic struggle faced by bolivians in the 1980s and early 1990s a large informal economy developed
lines.name: English

lines.value: evidence of this is provided by the markets found all around the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: while there are stable markets almost every street in the downtown area and surrounding neighborhoods has at least one vendor on it
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz remains the principal center of manufacturing enterprises that produce finished product goods for the country with about two thirds of bolivia's manufacturing located nearby
lines.name: English

lines.value: historically industry in bolivia has been dominated by mineral processing and the preparation of agricultural products
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in the urban centre of la paz small plants carry out a large portion of the industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: food tobacco products clothing various consumer goods building materials and agricultural tools are produced
lines.name: English

lines.value: the water supply of la paz is threatened by the impact of climate change through the melting of glaciers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city receives its drinking water from three water systems el alto achachicala and pampahasi
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz shares the first and largest of these systems with its sister city el alto
lines.name: English

lines.value: all three systems are fed by glaciers and rivers in the cordillera mountain range
lines.name: English

lines.value: 20-28 % of its water is fed by glaciers the remainder coming from rainfall and snowmelt
lines.name: English

lines.value: the glaciers recede as a result of climate change initially increasing water availability during the dry season but ultimately threatening a substantial decrease in dry season run off when they completely disappear
lines.name: English

lines.value: a small glacier the chacaltaya near el alto already disappeared in 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: the el alto system receives its water from the tuni dam and two water channels
lines.name: English

lines.value: these channels divert water that flows from the zongo glacier on the slopes of huayna potosi and from condoriri north of el alto
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2.9 km long zongo glacier retreats at a rate of about 18 meters per year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tuni and condoriri glaciers have lost 39% of their area between 1983 and 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to a study by the stockholm environment institute sei the el alto system is the least resilient against the impact of climate change among the three systems
lines.name: English

lines.value: the study says that reducing water distribution losses is the most effective short term strategy to deal with water scarcity
lines.name: English

lines.value: new water sources further to the north in the cordillera include the khara kota and taypicacha but they are expensive to develop and their water supply is also affected by glacier melt
lines.name: English

lines.value: la paz is part of the union of ibero american capital cities from october 12 1982 establishing brotherly relations with the following cities additionally agreement was reached by twin cities with la paz is also a member of merco ciudades a group of 180 cities within mercosur since 1999

lines.value: in mathematics curvature is any of a number of loosely related concepts in different areas of geometry
lines.name: English

lines.value: intuitively curvature is the amount by which a geometric object such as a surface deviates from being a flat plane or a curve from being straight as in the case of a line but this is defined in different ways depending on the context
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a key distinction between extrinsic curvature which is defined for objects embedded in another space usually a euclidean space - in a way that relates to the radius of curvature of circles that touch the object - and intrinsic curvature which is defined in terms of the lengths of curves within a riemannian manifold
lines.name: English

lines.value: this article deals primarily with extrinsic curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: its canonical example is that of a circle which has a curvature equal to the reciprocal of its radius everywhere
lines.name: English

lines.value: smaller circles bend more sharply and hence have higher curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: the curvature of a smooth curve is defined as the curvature of its osculating circle at each point

lines.value: curvature is normally a scalar quantity but one may also define a curvature vector that takes into account the direction of the bend in addition to its magnitude

lines.value: the curvature of more complex objects such as surfaces or even curved n dimensional spaces is described by more complex objects from linear algebra such as the general riemann curvature tensor

lines.value: this article sketches the mathematical framework which describes the curvature of a curve embedded in a plane and the curvature of a surface in euclidean space

lines.value: augustin louis cauchy defined the center of curvature as the intersection point of two infinitely close normals to the curve the radius of curvature as the distance from the point to and the curvature itself as the inverse of the radius of curvature

lines.value: it is natural to define the curvature of a straight line to be constantly zero

lines.value: geometrically the curvature measures how fast the unit tangent vector to the curve rotates

lines.value: if a curve keeps close to the same direction the unit tangent vector changes very little and the curvature is small where the curve undergoes a tight turn the curvature is large

lines.value: these two approaches to the curvature are related geometrically by the following observation

lines.value: in the first definition the curvature of a circle is equal to the ratio of the angle of an arc to its length

lines.value: thus if is the arc length parametrization of then the unit tangent vector is given by the plane containing the two vectors and is called the osculating plane to the curve at

lines.value: the radius of the circle is called the radius of curvature and the curvature is the reciprocal of the radius of curvature the tangent curvature and normal vector together describe the second order behavior of a curve near a point
lines.name: English

lines.value: in three dimensions the third order behavior of a curve is described by a related notion of torsion which measures the extent to which a curve tends to move in a helical path in space
lines.name: English

lines.value: the torsion and curvature are related by the frenet serret formulas in three dimensions and their generalization in higher dimensions

lines.value: when a one dimensional curve lies on a two dimensional surface embedded in three dimensions further measures of curvature are available which take the surface's unit normal vector into account
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are the normal curvature geodesic curvature and geodesic torsion
lines.name: English

lines.value: any non singular curve on a smooth surface will have its tangent vector lying in the tangent plane of the surface orthogonal to the normal vector
lines.name: English

lines.value: the normal curvature is the curvature of the curve projected onto the plane containing the curve's tangent and the surface normal ; the geodesic curvature , is the curvature of the curve projected onto the surface's tangent plane and the geodesic torsion or relative torsion , measures the rate of change of the surface normal around the curve's tangent
lines.name: English

lines.value: let the curve be a unit speed curve and let so that form an orthonormal basis the darboux frame
lines.name: English

lines.value: the above quantities are related by
lines.name: English

lines.value: all curves with the same tangent vector will have the same normal curvature which is the same as the curvature of the curve obtained by intersecting the surface with the plane containing and
lines.name: English

lines.value: taking all possible tangent vectors the maximum and minimum values of the normal curvature at a point are called the principal curvatures and and the directions of the corresponding tangent vectors are called principal normal directions
lines.name: English

lines.value: curvature can be evaluated along surface normal sections similar to above see e.g earth radius of curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: in contrast to curves which do not have intrinsic curvature but do have extrinsic curvature they only have a curvature given an embedding surfaces can have intrinsic curvature independent of an embedding
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gaussian curvature named after carl friedrich gauss is equal to the product of the principal curvatures,
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a dimension of length 2 and is positive for spheres negative for one sheet hyperboloids and zero for planes
lines.name: English

lines.value: it determines whether a surface is locally convex when it is positive or locally saddle shaped when it is negative
lines.name: English

lines.value: gaussian curvature is an intrinsic property of the surface meaning it does not depend on the particular embedding of the surface intuitively this means that ants living on the surface could determine the gaussian curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example an ant living on a sphere could measure the sum of the interior angles of a triangle and determine that it was greater than 180 degrees implying that the space it inhabited had positive curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the other hand an ant living on a cylinder would not detect any such departure from euclidean geometry in particular the ant could not detect that the two surfaces have different mean curvatures see below which is a purely extrinsic type of curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: formally gaussian curvature only depends on the riemannian metric of the surface
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is gauss's celebrated theorema egregium which he found while concerned with geographic surveys and mapmaking
lines.name: English

lines.value: an intrinsic definition of the gaussian curvature at a point is the following imagine an ant which is tied to with a short thread of length
lines.name: English

lines.value: it runs around while the thread is completely stretched and measures the length of one complete trip around
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the surface were flat she would find
lines.name: English

lines.value: on curved surfaces the formula for will be different and the gaussian curvature at the point can be computed by the bertrand diquet puiseux theorem as the integral of the gaussian curvature over the whole surface is closely related to the surface's euler characteristic see the gauss bonnet theorem
lines.name: English

lines.value: the discrete analog of curvature corresponding to curvature being concentrated at a point and particularly useful for polyhedra is the angular defect the analog for the gauss bonnet theorem is descartes theorem on total angular defect
lines.name: English

lines.value: because gaussian curvature can be defined without reference to an embedding space it is not necessary that a surface be embedded in a higher dimensional space in order to be curved
lines.name: English

lines.value: such an intrinsically curved two dimensional surface is a simple example of a riemannian manifold
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mean curvature is an extrinsic measure of curvature equal to half the sum of the principal curvatures,
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a dimension of length 1
lines.name: English

lines.value: mean curvature is closely related to the first variation of surface area
lines.name: English

lines.value: in particular a minimal surface such as a soap film has mean curvature zero and a soap bubble has constant mean curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike gauss curvature the mean curvature is extrinsic and depends on the embedding for instance a cylinder and a plane are locally isometric but the mean curvature of a plane is zero while that of a cylinder is nonzero
lines.name: English

lines.value: the intrinsic and extrinsic curvature of a surface can be combined in the second fundamental form
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is a quadratic form in the tangent plane to the surface at a point whose value at a particular tangent vector to the surface is the normal component of the acceleration of a curve along the surface tangent to ; that is it is the normal curvature to a curve tangent to see above
lines.name: English

lines.value: symbolically thus the second fundamental form encodes both the intrinsic and extrinsic curvatures
lines.name: English

lines.value: a related notion of curvature is the shape operator which is a linear operator from the tangent plane to itself
lines.name: English

lines.value: when applied to a tangent vector to the surface the shape operator is the tangential component of the rate of change of the normal vector when moved along a curve on the surface tangent to
lines.name: English

lines.value: the principal curvatures are the eigenvalues of the shape operator and in fact the shape operator and second fundamental form have the same matrix representation with respect to a pair of orthonormal vectors of the tangent plane
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gauss curvature is thus the determinant of the shape tensor and the mean curvature is half its trace
lines.name: English

lines.value: by extension of the former argument a space of three or more dimensions can be intrinsically curved
lines.name: English

lines.value: the curvature is intrinsic in the sense that it is a property defined at every point in the space rather than a property defined with respect to a larger space that contains it
lines.name: English

lines.value: in general a curved space may or may not be conceived as being embedded in a higher dimensional ambient space if not then its curvature can only be defined intrinsically
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the discovery of the intrinsic definition of curvature which is closely connected with non euclidean geometry many mathematicians and scientists questioned whether ordinary physical space might be curved although the success of euclidean geometry up to that time meant that the radius of curvature must be astronomically large
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the theory of general relativity which describes gravity and cosmology the idea is slightly generalised to the curvature of spacetime in relativity theory spacetime is a pseudo riemannian manifold
lines.name: English

lines.value: once a time coordinate is defined the three dimensional space corresponding to a particular time is generally a curved riemannian manifold but since the time coordinate choice is largely arbitrary it is the underlying spacetime curvature that is physically significant
lines.name: English

lines.value: although an arbitrarily curved space is very complex to describe the curvature of a space which is locally isotropic and homogeneous is described by a single gaussian curvature as for a surface mathematically these are strong conditions but they correspond to reasonable physical assumptions all points and all directions are indistinguishable
lines.name: English

lines.value: a positive curvature corresponds to the inverse square radius of curvature an example is a sphere or hypersphere
lines.name: English

lines.value: an example of negatively curved space is hyperbolic geometry
lines.name: English

lines.value: a space or space time with zero curvature is called flat
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example euclidean space is an example of a flat space and minkowski space is an example of a flat spacetime
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are other examples of flat geometries in both settings though
lines.name: English

lines.value: a torus or a cylinder can both be given flat metrics but differ in their topology
lines.name: English

lines.value: other topologies are also possible for curved space
lines.name: English

lines.value: see also shape of the universe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mathematical notion of curvature is also defined in much more general contexts
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of these generalizations emphasize different aspects of the curvature as it is understood in lower dimensions
lines.name: English

lines.value: one such generalization is kinematic
lines.name: English

lines.value: the curvature of a curve can naturally be considered as a kinematic quantity representing the force felt by a certain observer moving along the curve analogously curvature in higher dimensions can be regarded as a kind of tidal force this is one way of thinking of the sectional curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: this generalization of curvature depends on how nearby test particles diverge or converge when they are allowed to move freely in the space see jacobi field
lines.name: English

lines.value: another broad generalization of curvature comes from the study of parallel transport on a surface
lines.name: English

lines.value: for instance if a vector is moved around a loop on the surface of a sphere keeping parallel throughout the motion then the final position of the vector may not be the same as the initial position of the vector
lines.name: English

lines.value: this phenomenon is known as holonomy
lines.name: English

lines.value: various generalizations capture in an abstract form this idea of curvature as a measure of holonomy see curvature form
lines.name: English

lines.value: a closely related notion of curvature comes from gauge theory in physics where the curvature represents a field and a vector potential for the field is a quantity that is in general path dependent it may change if an observer moves around a loop
lines.name: English

lines.value: two more generalizations of curvature are the scalar curvature and ricci curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a curved surface such as the sphere the area of a disc on the surface differs from the area of a disc of the same radius in flat space
lines.name: English

lines.value: this difference in a suitable limit is measured by the scalar curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: the difference in area of a sector of the disc is measured by the ricci curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: each of the scalar curvature and ricci curvature are defined in analogous ways in three and higher dimensions
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are particularly important in relativity theory where they both appear on the side of einstein's field equations that represents the geometry of spacetime the other side of which represents the presence of matter and energy
lines.name: English

lines.value: these generalizations of curvature underlie for instance the notion that curvature can be a property of a measure see curvature of a measure
lines.name: English

lines.value: another generalization of curvature relies on the ability to compare a curved space with another space that has constant curvature
lines.name: English

lines.value: often this is done with triangles in the spaces
lines.name: English

lines.value: the notion of a triangle makes senses in metric spaces and this gives rise to spaces
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gambia followed a formal policy of non alignment throughout most of former president dawda jawara's tenure
lines.name: English

lines.value: it maintained close relations with the united kingdom senegal and other african countries
lines.name: English

lines.value: the july 1994 coup strained the gambia's relationship with western powers particularly the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 1995 president yahya jammeh has established diplomatic relations with several additional countries including libya the republic of china on taiwan before 2013 and cuba
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gambia plays an active role in international affairs especially west african and islamic affairs although its representation abroad is limited
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a member of the economic community of west african states ecowas the gambia has played an active role in that organization's efforts to resolve the liberian civil war and contributed troops to the community's cease fire monitoring group ecomog
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also has sought to mediate disputes in nearby guinea bissau and the neighbouring casamance region of senegal
lines.name: English

lines.value: the people's republic of china cuba libya nigeria senegal sierra leone the united kingdom and the united states of america have embassies or high commissions in the gambia
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 25 may 2005 the gambia announced its readiness to establish full diplomatic relations with the turkish republic of northern cyprus
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gambia did not do so however citing international opinion
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 2010 the gambia severed all diplomatic ties with iran following the seizure of a suspicious arms shipment in nigeria
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the early months of the libyan civil war the gambia became the first african state to recognize the national transitional council as the sole legitimate representative of libya
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gambia was a member of the commonwealth of nations from its independence in 1965 until its withdrawal in october 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: after presidential elections in 2016 the winning candidate adama barrow promised to return the gambia to the commonwealth
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 14 february 2017 the gambia began the process of returning and formally presented its application to rejoin to secretary general patricia scotland on 22 january 2018
lines.name: English

lines.value: boris johnson who became the first british foreign secretary to visit the gambia since the country gained independence in 1965 announced that the british government welcomed the gambia's return to the commonwealth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gambia rejoined on 8 february 2018
lines.name: English

lines.value: wise county is a county in the us state of texas
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the 2010 census the population was 59127
lines.name: English

lines.value: its county seat is decatur
lines.name: English

lines.value: wise county is part of the dallas fort worth arlington tx metropolitan statistical area
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wise eyes crime watch program eventually adopted by mostly rural counties in several states was started in 1993 by then sheriff phil ryan
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 10 1837 the battle of the knobs was fought in what is now wise county between about 150 indian warriors and 18 republic of texas soldiers under lieutenant a b benthuysen
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite being heavily outnumbered the texas soldiers held their ground killing or wounding an estimated 50 indians and losing 10 of their own men
lines.name: English

lines.value: more settlers began coming into the area not long afterward with people relocating from both the upper south and deep south
lines.name: English

lines.value: wise county was not founded until 1856
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was named after virginia congressman henry a wise who had supported annexation of texas by the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was elected governor of virginia in 1856
lines.name: English

lines.value: as few residents of wise county were slaveholders opinions were mixed at the time of the civil war and many people opposed secession
lines.name: English

lines.value: unionists were persecuted in north texas and some were lynched
lines.name: English

lines.value: forty two men were murdered in the great hanging at gainesville in october 1862 over the course of several days in neighboring cooke county
lines.name: English

lines.value: this has been described as the largest act of vigilante violence in us history
lines.name: English

lines.value: in recent years wise county allowed an increase in hydraulic fracturing
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2011 the parr family and others filed a lawsuit against several energy companies including republic energy inc and ryder scott petroleum claiming the extracting processes have created health complications for their family and neighbors
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 2014 the parrs won a $2.9 million award from a dallas jury
lines.name: English

lines.value: el paso county is the westernmost county in the us state of texas
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the 2010 census the population was 800647 making it the sixth most populous county in the state of texas
lines.name: English

lines.value: its seat is the city of el paso the sixth most populous city in texas and the 19th-most populous city in the united states

lines.value: the county was created in 1850 and later organized in 1871
lines.name: English

lines.value: el paso is short for el paso del norte which is spanish for the pass of the north

lines.value: it is named for the pass the rio grande creates through the mountains on either side of the river

lines.value: the county is northeast of the mexico united states border

lines.value: el paso county is included in the el paso metropolitan area

lines.value: along with hudspeth county it is one of only two counties in texas in the mountain time zone all other texas counties use central time

lines.value: el paso county is historically democratic and the 2008 presidential election was no exception

lines.value: democrat barack obama won 66% of the vote with 121589 votes even though he lost the entire state of texas by about 946000 votes
lines.name: English

lines.value: republican john mccain won 33% of the vote in el paso county with 61598 votes
lines.name: English

lines.value: other candidates won 1% of the vote
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 democrat john f kerry won el paso county but by a smaller margin than barack obama
lines.name: English

lines.value: john kerry won 56% of the vote and 95142 votes
lines.name: English

lines.value: republican george w bush won 43% of the vote with 73261 votes
lines.name: English

lines.value: other candidates won 1% of the vote
lines.name: English

lines.value: the el paso county sheriff's office is headquartered in an unincorporated area in el paso county
lines.name: English

lines.value: at one point it was headquartered within the city of el paso
lines.name: English

lines.value: the leo samaniego law enforcement complex is adjacent to the sheriff's office headquarters
lines.name: English

lines.value: like all texas counties el paso county is governed by a commissioners court which consists of a county judge who is elected county wide and four county commissioners who represent individual precincts
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the county judge possesses some traditional powers of a judge the county judge functions primarily as the chief executive of the county
lines.name: English

lines.value: the county judge presides over commissioners court meetings casts one vote on commissioners court as do county commissioners and lacks veto authority
lines.name: English

lines.value: the el paso county judge is ruben vogt and the county commissioners are carlos leon precinct 1 david stout precinct 2 vince perez precinct 3 and andrew haggerty precinct 4
lines.name: English

lines.value: haggerty is a republican the other commissioners and the county judge are democrats
lines.name: English

lines.value: vogt was appointed county judge in october 2017 by the county commissioners following county judge veronica escobar's resignation to run for congress
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was previously escobar's chief of staff
lines.name: English

lines.value: he will serve the remainder of her term through the end of 2018
lines.name: English

lines.value: leon and perez were first elected to their positions in 2012 were reelected in 2016 and have been in office since 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: haggerty and stout were first elected to their positions in 2014 and have been in office since 2015
lines.name: English
