lines.value: hettinger county ( ) is a county located in the us state of north dakota
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the 2010 census the population was 2477
lines.name: English

lines.value: its county seat is mott
lines.name: English

lines.value: the county was created in 1883 but it was not fully organized until 1907
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city of hettinger north dakota is in nearby adams county
lines.name: English

lines.value: hettinger county was named by tom hettinger the great grandson of erastus a williams who was speaker of the dakota territory house of representatives the year hettinger was established in honor of his father in law mathias hettinger
lines.name: English

lines.value: the county was founded by the dakota territory legislature in 1883 and was formally organized with its own county government on april 17 1907 by a proclamation signed by governor john burke
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1891 the north dakota legislature approved legislation to annex hettinger county into neighboring stark county but the law was vetoed by governor eli c d shortridge
lines.name: English

lines.value: annexation was attempted a second time in 1895 when the legislature passed legislation expanding the boundaries of stark billings and mercer counties subject to approval by the counties voters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vote was approved annexation went into effect november 3 1896 and hettinger county was eliminated
lines.name: English

lines.value: however wilson l richards a cattle rancher in one of the annexed counties sued to overturn the annexation because he and other landowners were now subject to taxation by stark county
lines.name: English

lines.value: the case went to the north dakota supreme court which ruled the law unconstitutional on may 18 1899
lines.name: English

lines.value: the annexation remained in effect however due to a replacement law approved by the legislature march 9 1899 in anticipation of the court's decision
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second annexation law was overturned by the north dakota supreme court in 1901 because the annexation was not referred to the voters of the affected counties as required by the north dakota constitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: the legislature passed a third annexation law in 1903 this time submitting it to the voters stark county and the unorganized counties of dunn and hettinger for approval
lines.name: English

lines.value: the annexation was approved by 502 votes in stark county and 65 votes in hettinger county but it failed by 1 vote in dunn county
lines.name: English

lines.value: stark county claimed the annexation vote valid since the legislation required a majority of the aggregate votes cast
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the north dakota constitution required a majority vote in each affected county subject to annexation so the state of north dakota sued stark county on the grounds that the enabling legislation was unconstitutional and that the no vote in dunn county meant the annexation failed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the north dakota supreme court ruled the 1903 law unconstitutional in 1905 which ended further attempts at annexation
lines.name: English

lines.value: as an unorganized county hettinger remained attached to stark county for judicial purposes until it was formally organized in 1907
lines.name: English

lines.value: union county is a county located in the southern part of the us state of iowa
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the 2010 census the population was 12534
lines.name: English

lines.value: the county seat is creston
lines.name: English

lines.value: organized at a time of tensions before the american civil war the county was named in 1853 for the union that people wanted to preserve
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rural county's peak of population was in 1930
lines.name: English

lines.value: its economy is based on agriculture and related industries
lines.name: English

lines.value: creston and the county are still served by the burlington northern santa fe railroad bnsf the largest network in the nation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first permanent european american settlers came in 1849 and 1850
lines.name: English

lines.value: mormons had earlier established mt pisgah in the eastern part of the county as a way station as they traveled west but had left this area by 1848
lines.name: English

lines.value: settlers used pisgah as a base to found farms along the grand and platte rivers that run through the county
lines.name: English

lines.value: they found a market for their produce with the emigrants traveling overland to california to take part in the gold rush
lines.name: English

lines.value: travelers often sought shelter with the settlers along the way
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1851 one settler counted 2600 teams driven by emigrants to california they often drove herds of sheep and cattle trying to get animals to the gold fields to feed the miners but many died along the way
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first village was petersville founded in 1853 the same year that the county was organized
lines.name: English

lines.value: the county was named for the union which many people wanted to preserve at a time of rising tensions between the north and the south
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the american civil war railroad construction linked the areas of the county giving rise to new towns and gave access to other markets
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1868 the railroad reached afton iowa and the next year creston the county seat was made a division point
lines.name: English

lines.value: the railroad built service facilities there a roundhouse and related structures
lines.name: English

lines.value: the railroad brought many immigrants and migrants to the area who were attracted to the fertile soil as farmland
lines.name: English

lines.value: immigrants came from across central and eastern europe as well as from eastern states of the us
lines.name: English

lines.value: the burlington northern santa fe railroad bnsf continues to be important in the area as it is the chief network for hauling grain and coal
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the years it drew workers from industrial cities such as chicago to creston
lines.name: English

lines.value: the county has an annual fair each year
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the late 19th century southwestern iowa claimed the title of bluegrass capital having cultivated bluegrass throughout the area
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1889 the bluegrass association was founded made up of representatives of the 18 counties in this region
lines.name: English

lines.value: they decided to build a bluegrass palace on the union county fairgrounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was designed by louis syberkro an artist and constructed by j c woodruff both of creston
lines.name: English

lines.value: made of sod and baled hay on a wood frame the building was 100 feet square with corner turrets and a central tower 92 feet high
lines.name: English

lines.value: it held exhibits of farm products and resource commodities from counties of the association including wood coal sandstone and marble
lines.name: English

lines.value: the palace was such a success that the bluegrass association commissioned an even larger one the next year which supplied about three times as much space
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a separate wing was an auditorium large enough to hold 2000 people
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lytton national park's main attraction is fort lytton historic military precinct providing guided tours of historic fort lytton a museum and reenactments
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is open free on sundays public holidays and for special events
lines.name: English

lines.value: access to the park at other times is by appointment only and is subject to fees
lines.name: English

lines.value: the park was created in 1990 as queensland's first historic national park
lines.name: English

lines.value: it initially contained only heritage listed fort lytton a colonial coastal fort that continued to operate as a military base until after the second world war
lines.name: English

lines.value: the park was extended in 1999 to include lytton quarantine station which occupied abutting land
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quarantine station is also heritage listed but is only open to the public on special occasions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the park is located in the brisbane suburb of lytton in queensland australia
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is northeast of the brisbane cbd near the mouth of the brisbane river
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lytton was constructed in 1880 1881 to protect both the city and the port from naval attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the australian colonies became a federation the commonwealth of australia in 1901 the fort and the land on which it stood were transferred to the commonwealth
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lytton continued to operate as a military base until shortly after the second world war ww2
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was closed down progressively the last operation to close being the signal station which closed in 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: the land and fort were sold to the ampol oil company in 1963 as the site for a new oil refinery now the caltex refinery
lines.name: English

lines.value: the land contained three parcels that had particular historic significance
lines.name: English

lines.value: these were the land containing the original fort the land containing lytton hill and the land containing the remains of a ww2 heavy anti aircraft battery
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1988 ampol transferred the parcel containing the original fort to the queensland government and this became fort lytton national park in 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is one of two adjacent precincts in fort lytton national park the other one is the quarantine station
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the main attraction of the park and is open free on sundays most public holidays and other special occasions
lines.name: English

lines.value: it features both guided and self guided tours of the historic fort and other military structures a military museum and regular historic reenactments although not every week
lines.name: English

lines.value: soon after the creation of the national park volunteers of the royal artillery association of queensland created a sub branch to work with the queensland parks and wildlife service to develop a historic military exhibit for the public
lines.name: English

lines.value: that sub branch became fort lytton historical association flha in 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: flha is a non profit volunteer organization which provides free guided tours of the fort on sundays and public holidays
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also operates the visitor information centre and sells basic refreshments
lines.name: English

lines.value: flha seeks donations to cover its expenses
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 1990 the royal artillery association volunteers and subsequently the flha volunteers have worked closely with the queensland parks and wildlife service to research curate and operate fort lytton military museum
lines.name: English

lines.value: the museum has a collection of over 2000 items which are distributed throughout the park including in 5 buildings 6 gun pits 2 shelter structures and several open air locations
lines.name: English

lines.value: admission to the museum is free although two of the buildings the submarine mining building and the black powder rooms can only be accessed on guided tours
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lytton quarantine station was established in 1913 1914 to accommodate newly arrived immigrants and persons considered to be at risk of causing infection to the general population
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quarantine station was on land adjacent to fort lytton
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the late 1980s the quarantine station had closed completely
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1988 management of part of the quarantine site and buildings including the quarantine station jetty was taken over by the queensland parks and wildlife service and was incorporated into fort lytton national park in 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: the quarantine station is only open to the public on special occasions but visitors can always walk around the outside of the buildings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the visitor and information centre which is also the headquarters of fort lytton historical association previously housed the quarantine station laundry
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland is a city in knox county maine in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the 2010 census the city population was 7297
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the county seat of knox county
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city is a popular tourist destination
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a departure point for the maine state ferry service to the islands of penobscot bay vinalhaven north haven and matinicus
lines.name: English

lines.value: abenaki indians called it catawamteak meaning great landing place in 1767 john lermond and his two brothers from warren built a camp to produce oak staves and pine lumber
lines.name: English

lines.value: thereafter known as lermond's cove it was first settled about 1769
lines.name: English

lines.value: when in 1777 thomaston was incorporated lermond's cove became a district called shore village
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 28 1848 it was set off as the town of east thomaston
lines.name: English

lines.value: renamed rockland in 1850 it was chartered as a city in 1854
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland developed rapidly because of shipbuilding and lime production
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1854 alone the city built eleven ships three barks six brigs and four schooners
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city had twelve lime quarries and 125 lime kilns with upwards of 300 vessels to transport the mineral to various ports in the country
lines.name: English

lines.value: in march 1877 the granite cutters international union was formed in rockland
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was one of the earliest craft unions in the united states and formed among the region's growing granite industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1886 shipbuilding was surpassed by the lime business which had twelve manufacturers employing 1000 workers
lines.name: English

lines.value: nevertheless rockland had three or more shipyards a marine railway five sail lofts and two boatbuilders
lines.name: English

lines.value: other industries included three grain mills two foundries three carriage factories six lumber mills two machine shops three cooperies one tannery four granite and marble works two boot and shoe factories and four printing offices
lines.name: English

lines.value: fishing was also important
lines.name: English

lines.value: fleets of friendship sloops sailed between the harbor and fishing grounds across penobscot bay
lines.name: English

lines.value: the opening of the knox and lincoln railroad in 1871 brought an influx of tourists
lines.name: English

lines.value: inns and hotels were established to accommodate them with the grandest being the bay point hotel in 1889
lines.name: English

lines.value: with a commanding view near the breakwater the resort offered every luxury and amusement
lines.name: English

lines.value: renamed the samoset hotel in 1902 it was successful until the great depression which began a slow decline
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the age of automobiles travelers were no longer restricted to the limits of train service but were free to explore elsewhere
lines.name: English

lines.value: closed in 1969 the victorian hotel burned in 1972
lines.name: English

lines.value: a new samoset resort opened in 1974
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1915 the new superdreadnought conducted tests and completed her running trials just off the shore from rockland
lines.name: English

lines.value: today rockland is an officially designated micropolitan area
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the early 1990s rockland has seen a shift in its economy away from the fishery and toward a service center city
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has also seen a substantial increase in tourism and the downtown has transformed into one of unique shops boutiques fine dining and art galleries
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland is the commercial center of the midcoast maine region with many historic inns a coffee roaster a food co op a community radio station wrfr lp and the farnsworth art museum
lines.name: English

lines.value: on march 13 2017 the rockland city council approved a resolve to support community diversity
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland was named a coast guard city in march 2008 in recognition of the long standing and special relationship that the city and its residents have with the united states coast guard
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland is home to the maine lobster festival a celebration held annually in honor of the town's primary export lobster
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the first week of august thousands of people come from all over the world to participate in this five day event
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland also is home to the farnsworth art museum a world famous art gallery containing paintings by andrew wyeth and other well known new england artists
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland's main street also features numerous small shops and businesses including coffee shops book stores art supply stores restaurants organic markets computer repair and toy stores
lines.name: English

lines.value: penobscot bay which rockland borders is known internationally as one of the best recreational sailing grounds in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city's breakwater built in the 19th century also draws tourists
lines.name: English

lines.value: also the maine eastern railroad is based in rockland and offers limited seasonal passenger train excursions starting in brunswick running to rockland and back
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland is located at 44.109569 -69.114652
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the united states census bureau the city has a total area of of which is land and is water
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland is located on penobscot bay and the gulf of maine part of the atlantic ocean
lines.name: English

lines.value: about ten miles to the east are the islands of north haven and vinalhaven reached by ferry from rockland
lines.name: English

lines.value: rockland is crossed by us 1 and 1a and state routes 17 73 and 90
lines.name: English

lines.value: it borders the towns of owls head to the southeast thomaston to the southwest warren to the northwest and rockport to the northeast
lines.name: English

lines.value: across the highway stands a sturdy two story post office building apparently with upstairs living quarters also a roadside cafe and a small farming ranching supply business in more modest one story quarters comprising the entire nonresidential district

lines.value: hans wilhelm langsdorff 20 march 1894 - 20 december 1939 was a german naval officer most famous for his command of the panzerschiff pocket battleship admiral graf spee during the battle of the river plate
lines.name: English

lines.value: he held the rank of kapitan zur see naval captain
lines.name: English

lines.value: langsdorff was born on 20 march 1894 in bergen on the island of rugen he was the eldest son in a family with legal and religious traditions rather than a naval tradition
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1898 the family moved to dusseldorf where they were neighbours of the family of graf count maximilian von spee who was to become a german naval hero while losing his life at the battle of the falkland islands in 1914
lines.name: English

lines.value: influenced by his honoured neighbours langsdorff entered the kiel naval academy against his parents wishes in 1912
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the first world war the then lieutenant langsdorff received the iron cross 2nd class at the battle of jutland in 1916 and subsequently worked on minesweepers for the rest of the war
lines.name: English

lines.value: he received the iron cross 1st class sometime during the remainder of the war but the exact date is unknown
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1923 while posted to the navy office in dresden langsdorff met ruth hager
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two were married in march 1924 with their son johann being born on 14 december
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 1925 langsdorff was posted to the defence ministry in berlin to coordinate relations between the navy and the army
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1927 he was posted to the command of a torpedo boat flotilla and in april 1930 he was promoted to lieutenant commander
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1931 he was recalled to berlin as his administrative abilities had become well known and appreciated
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the rise to power of the nazis langsdorff requested duty at sea in 1934 but was instead appointed to the interior ministry
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1936 and 1937 while on board the new pocket battleship admiral graf spee as part of the staff of admiral boehm langsdorff participated in the german support of the nationalist side in the spanish civil war
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 1 january 1937 langsdorff was promoted to captain
lines.name: English

lines.value: he received command of the admiral graf spee in october 1938
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 21 august 1939 admiral graf spee left port with orders to raid enemy commercial shipping in the south atlantic following the outbreak of the second world war
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the first three weeks of the war the ship hid in the open ocean east of brazil while the german government determined how serious britain was about the war
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 20 september 1939 admiral graf spee was released to carry out its orders
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the next 10 weeks langsdorff and admiral graf spee were extremely successful stopping and sinking nine british merchant ships totalling over 50000 tons
lines.name: English

lines.value: langsdorff adhered to the hague conventions and avoided killing anyone his humane treatment won the respect of the ships officers detained as his prisoners
lines.name: English

lines.value: langsdorff's luck ran out on the morning of 13 december 1939 when his lookouts reported sighting a british cruiser and two destroyers
lines.name: English

lines.value: admiral graf spee now suffered engine fatigue that reduced her top speed to 23kn
lines.name: English

lines.value: after langsdorff had committed his ship to the attack it became apparent that the destroyers were in fact light cruisers hms ajax and hmnzs achilles in addition to the heavy cruiser hms exeter
lines.name: English

lines.value: naval analysts claim that langsdorff then committed a grievous tactical error
lines.name: English

lines.value: his ship outgunned all his opponents having 11 inch 280 mm main guns to exeter's 8 inch 200 mm and ajax and achilles's 6 inch 150 mm guns
lines.name: English

lines.value: exeter was severely damaged and forced to withdraw later she reengaged and further damaged and listing again withdrew
lines.name: English

lines.value: but she had sent a most consequential 8-inch shell into spee destroying steam boilers needed to operate the ship's fuel cleaning system
lines.name: English

lines.value: langsdorff learned that he had 16 hours of pre cleaned fuel in his ready tanks with no hope of replacement or repairs to the system at sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: soon the two light cruisers got into range and scored 20 hits on admiral graf spee including the food stores and bakeries
lines.name: English

lines.value: simultaneously langsdorff and the british commodore decided to break off the action langsdorff heading for the neutral port of montevideo in uruguay to make repairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the uruguayan authorities followed international treaties and although granting an extra 72 hours stay over the normal 24 hours required that admiral graf spee leave port by 20:00 on 17 december 1939 or else be interned for the duration of the war
lines.name: English

lines.value: langsdorff sought orders from berlin and was given instructions that the ship was not to be interned in uruguay which was sympathetic to britain or to be allowed to fall into enemy hands but he was given no directive as to what action to take
lines.name: English

lines.value: he therefore considered that he could try to take the ship to the friendlier buenos aires in argentina although it was thought that the channel was not sufficiently deep for the ship he could take the ship out to sea to battle the british forces again british propaganda was trying to persuade people that a large british force already lay in wait for him though in fact it would not be able to arrive for five days or he could scuttle the ship
lines.name: English

lines.value: he decided to scuttle largely to spare his crew further casualties
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the limit of uruguayan territorial waters she stopped and her crew was taken off by argentine barges
lines.name: English

lines.value: shortly thereafter planted charges blew up admiral graf spee and she settled into the shallow water today she has settled in the mud and lies in 7 8 metres of water depending on the tide
lines.name: English

lines.value: langsdorff was taken to the naval hotel in buenos aires where he wrote letters to his family and superiors
lines.name: English

lines.value: he wrote on 19 december 1939 i can now only prove by my death that the fighting services of the third reich are ready to die for the honour of the flag
lines.name: English

lines.value: i alone bear the responsibility for scuttling the panzerschiff admiral graf spee
lines.name: English

lines.value: i am happy to pay with my life for any possible reflection on the honour of the flag
lines.name: English

lines.value: i shall face my fate with firm faith in the cause and the future of the nation and of my fuhrer after this he committed suicide with a pistol whilst lying upon graf spee's battle ensign
lines.name: English

lines.value: his body was buried in the german section of the la chacarita cemetery in buenos aires argentina
lines.name: English

lines.value: hans langsdorff's son joachim langsdorff also joined the german navy
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was killed while piloting a biber midget submarine in december 1944
lines.name: English

lines.value: his craft was later recovered by the royal navy and is currently displayed at the imperial war museum in london
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town of ajax in ontario canada which is named after the royal navy cruiser involved in graff spee's destruction and which also has streets within it named after royal naval personnel involved in the action named a street in 2007 in honour of hans langsdorff langsdorff drive
lines.name: English

lines.value: otto jahn (; 16 june 1813 in kiel - 9 september 1869 in gottingen was a german archaeologist philologist and writer on art and music
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the completion of his university studies at christian albrechts universitat in kiel the university of leipzig and humboldt university berlin he traveled for three years in france and italy
lines.name: English

lines.value: in rome he was greatly influenced by the work of august emil braun 1809-1856
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1839 he became privatdozent at kiel and in 1842 professor extraordinary of archaeology and philology at the university of greifswald ordinary professor 1845
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1847 he accepted the chair of archaeology at leipzig however he along with theodor mommsen 1817-1903 and moritz haupt 1808-1874 were dismissed from the university in 1851 for having taken part in the political movements of 1848-1849
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1855 he was appointed professor of the science of antiquity and director of the academic art museum at bonn
lines.name: English

lines.value: while here he turned down an offer as successor to eduard gerhard 1795-1867 at berlin
lines.name: English

lines.value: his biography of wolfgang amadeus mozart appeared in 1856 the centenary of mozart's birth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the work is admired for its scholarly approach at the time novel in mozart biography and in versions revised by hermann abert and cliff eisen continues in use today
lines.name: English

lines.value: among jahn's notable students was the classical archaeologist and philologist hugo blumner
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eurasian teal or common teal anas crecca is a common and widespread duck which breeds in temperate eurasia and migrates south in winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eurasian teal is often called simply the teal due to being the only one of these small dabbling ducks in much of its range
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bird gives its name to the blue green colour teal
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a highly gregarious duck outside the breeding season and can form large flocks
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is commonly found in sheltered wetlands and feeds on seeds and aquatic invertebrates
lines.name: English

lines.value: the north american green winged teal a
lines.name: English

lines.value: carolinensis was formerly and sometimes is still considered a subspecies of a crecca
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eurasian teal belongs to the true teals a group of small anas dabbling ducks closely related to the mallard a
lines.name: English

lines.value: platyrhynchos and its relatives that latter group in fact seems to have evolved from a true teal
lines.name: English

lines.value: it forms a superspecies with the green winged teal and the speckled teal a
lines.name: English

lines.value: flavirostris
lines.name: English

lines.value: a proposed subspecies a
lines.name: English

lines.value: c nimia of the aleutian islands differs only in slightly larger size it is probably not distinct
lines.name: English

lines.value: whether the eurasian and green winged teals are to be treated as one or two species is still being reviewed by the aou while the iucn and birdlife international separate them nowadays
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the almost identical and highly apomorphic nuptial plumage of their males which continues to puzzle scientists they seem well distinct species as indicated by a wealth of behavioural morphological and molecular data
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eurasian teal was first scientifically named by carl linnaeus in his 1758 edition of systema naturae
lines.name: English

lines.value: his latin description reads [anas] macula alarum viridi linea alba supra infraque oculos - "a duck with green speculum a white line above and below the eyes - and his primary reference was the bird's description in his earlier work fauna svecica
lines.name: English

lines.value: in fact the description he used in systema naturae was the name under which the bird went in the fauna svecica demonstrating the value of his new binomial nomenclature by compressing the long winded names formerly used in biological classification into much simpler scientific names like anas crecca
lines.name: English

lines.value: linnaeus also noted in his description that earlier authors had already written about the eurasan teal at length conrad gessner had described it in the historiae animalium as the anas parva small duck among his querquedulae teals ulisse aldrovandi had called it phascade or querquedula minor lesser teal and was duly referenced by francis willughby who named the species querquedula secunda aldrovandi the second teal of aldrovandus
lines.name: English

lines.value: john ray may be credited with formally introducing the name common teal while eleazar albin called it simply the teal
lines.name: English

lines.value: as regards the type locality linnaeus simply remarked that it inhabits freshwater ecosystems in europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scientific name is from latin anas duck and kricka the swedish name for this species
lines.name: English

lines.value: the specific name of linnaeus is onomatopoetic referring to the male's characteristic call which was already discussed by linnaeus sources
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scientific name of the eurasian teal unchanged since linnaeus time- therefore translates as duck that makes cryc common names like the bokmal krikkand danish krikand and german krickente mean the same
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eurasian teal is the smallest extant dabbling duck at length and with an average weight of in drake males and in hens females
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wings are long yielding a wingspan of
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bill measures in length and the tarsus
lines.name: English

lines.value: from a distance the drakes in nuptial plumage appear grey with a dark head a yellowish behind and a white stripe running along the flanks
lines.name: English

lines.value: their head and upper neck is chestnut with a wide and iridescent dark green patch of half moon or teardrop shape that starts immediately before the eye and arcs to the upper hindneck
lines.name: English

lines.value: the patch is bordered with thin yellowish white lines and a single line of that colour extends from the patch's forward end curving along the base of the bill
lines.name: English

lines.value: the breast is buff with small round brown spots
lines.name: English

lines.value: the center of the belly is white and the rest of the body plumage is mostly white with thin and dense blackish vermiculations appearing medium grey even at a short distance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the outer scapular feathers are white with a black border to the outer vanes and form the white side stripe when the bird is in resting position
lines.name: English

lines.value: the primary remiges are dark greyish brown the speculum feathers are iridescent blackish green with white tips and form the speculum together with the yellowish white tips of the larger upperwing coverts which are otherwise grey
lines.name: English

lines.value: the underwing is whitish with grey remiges dense dark spotting on the inner coverts and a dark leading edge
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tail and tail coverts are black with a bright yellowish buff triangular patch in the center of the coverts at each side
lines.name: English

lines.value: in non breeding eclipse plumage the drake looks more like the hen it is more uniform in colour with a dark head and vestigial facial markings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hen itself is yellowish brown somewhat darker on wings and back
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a dark greyish brown upper head hindneck eyestripe and feather pattern
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pattern is dense short streaks on the head and neck and scaly spots on the rest of the body overall they look much like a tiny mallard a
lines.name: English

lines.value: platyrhynchos hen when at rest
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wings are coloured similar to the drake's but with brown instead of grey upperwing coverts that have less wide tips and wider tips of the speculum feathers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hen's rectrices have yellowish white tips the midbelly is whitish with some dark streaking
lines.name: English

lines.value: immatures are coloured much like hens but have a stronger pattern
lines.name: English

lines.value: the downy young are coloured like in other dabbling ducks brown above and yellow below with a yellow supercilium
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are recognizable by their tiny size however weighing just at hatching
lines.name: English

lines.value: the drake's bill is dark grey in eclipse plumage often with some light greenish or brownish hue at the base
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bill of hens and immatures is pinkish or yellowish at the base becoming dark grey towards the tip the grey expands basewards as the birds age
lines.name: English

lines.value: the feet are dark grey in males and greyish olive or greyish brown in females and immatures
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iris is always brown
lines.name: English

lines.value: moults during summer
lines.name: English

lines.value: male in eclipse resembles female but with darker upperparts and grey bill
lines.name: English

lines.value: flight feathers are moulted simultaneously and birds are flightless for up to 4 weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is a noisy species
lines.name: English

lines.value: the male whistles cryc or creelycc not loud but very clear and far carrying
lines.name: English

lines.value: the female has a feeble keh or neeh quack
lines.name: English

lines.value: males in nuptial plumage are distinguished from green winged teals by the horizontal white scapular stripe the lack of a vertical white bar at the breast sides and the quite conspicuous light outlines of the face patch which are indistinct in the green winged teal drake
lines.name: English

lines.value: males in eclipse plumage females and immatures are best recognised by their small size calls and the speculum they are hard to tell apart from the green winged teal however
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eurasian teal breeds across northern eurasia and mostly winters well south of its breeding range
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in the milder climate of temperate europe the summer and winter ranges overlap
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example in the united kingdom and ireland a small summer population breeds but far greater numbers of siberian birds arrive in winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the caucasus region western asia minor along the northern shores of the black sea and even on the south coast of iceland and on the vestmannaeyjar the species can be encountered all year too
lines.name: English

lines.value: in winter there are high densities around the mediterranean including the entire iberian peninsula and extending west to mauretania on japan and taiwan as well as in south asia
lines.name: English

lines.value: other important wintering locations include almost the entire length of the nile valley the near east and persian gulf region the mountain ranges of northern iran and south korea and continental east and southeast asia
lines.name: English

lines.value: more isolated wintering grounds are lake victoria the senegal river estuary the swamps of the upper congo river the inland and sea deltas of the niger river and the central indus river valley
lines.name: English

lines.value: vagrants have been seen in inland zaire malaysia on greenland and on the marianas palau and yap in micronesia they are regularly recorded on the north american coasts south to california and south carolina
lines.name: English

lines.value: altogether the eurasian teal is much less common than its american counterpart though still very plentiful
lines.name: English

lines.value: its numbers are mainly assessed by counts of wintering birds some 750000 are recorded annually around the mediterranean and black seas 250000 in temperate western europe and more than 110000 in japan
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1990 and 1991 a more detailed census was undertaken yielding over 210000 birds wintering in iran some 109000 in pakistan about 77000 in azerbaijan some 37000 in india 28000 in israel over 14000 in turkmenistan and almost 12000 in taiwan
lines.name: English

lines.value: it appears to be holding its own currently with its slow decline of maybe 1 2% annually in the 1990s - presumably mainly due to drainage and pollution of wetlands - not warranting action other than continuing to monitor the population and possibly providing better protection for habitat on the wintering grounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iucn and birdlife international classify the eurasian teal as a species of least concern unchanged from their assessment before the split of the more numerous a
lines.name: English

lines.value: carolinensis
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eurasian teal is one of the species to which the agreement on the conservation of african eurasian migratory waterbirds aewa applies
lines.name: English

lines.value: this dabbling duck is highly gregarious outside of the breeding season and will form large flocks
lines.name: English

lines.value: in flight the fast twisting flocks resemble waders despite its short legs it is also rather nimble on the ground by ducks standards
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the breeding season it is a common inhabitant of sheltered freshwater wetlands with some tall vegetation such as taiga bogs or small lakes and ponds with extensive reedbeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: in winter it is often seen in brackish waters and even in sheltered inlets and lagoons along the seashore
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eurasian teal usually feeds by dabbling upending or grazing it may submerge its head and on occasion even dive to reach food
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the breeding season it eats mainly aquatic invertebrates such as crustaceans insects and their larvae molluscs and worms
lines.name: English

lines.value: in winter it shifts to a largely granivorous diet feeding on seeds of aquatic plants and grasses including sedges and grains
lines.name: English

lines.value: diurnal throughout the breeding season in winter they are often crepuscular or even nocturnal feeders
lines.name: English

lines.value: it nests on the ground near water and under cover
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pairs form in the winter quarters and arrive on the breeding grounds together starting about march
lines.name: English

lines.value: the breeding starts some weeks thereafter not until may in the most northernly locations
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nest is a deep hollow lined with dry leaves and down feathers built in dense vegetation near water
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the females have started laying the males leave them and move away for shorter or longer distances assembling in flocks on particular lakes where they moult into eclipse plumage they will usually encounter their offspring only in winter quarters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the clutch may consist of 5 16 eggs but usually numbers 8 11 they are incubated for 21 23 days
lines.name: English

lines.value: the young leave the nest soon after hatching and are attended by the mother for about 25 30 days after which they fledge
lines.name: English

lines.value: the drakes and the hens with young generally move to the winter quarters separately
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the first winter the young moult into adult plumage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the maximum recorded lifespan - though it is not clear whether this refers to the common or the green winged teal was over 27 years which is rather high for such a small bird
lines.name: English

lines.value: roadmarks is a science fantasy novel by american author roger zelazny written during the late 1970s and published in 1979
lines.name: English

lines.value: the novel postulates a road that travels through time with a nexus placed every few years where a handful of specially gifted people are able to get on and off
lines.name: English

lines.value: while there is a plot involving a series of assassination attempts on the protagonist the novel's main strengths lie in the unique nature of the setting character development structure and the short vignettes on each of the would be assassins
lines.name: English

lines.value: the book has two poetry collections as characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: les fleurs du mal by charles baudelaire and leaves of grass by walt whitman appear as cybernetic extensions of themselves
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are companions of the protagonist and his son randy and are referred to as flowers and leaves respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: both talk argue and quote their own content frequently exhibiting human like intelligence to such degree that it seems certain they could easily pass the turing test
lines.name: English

lines.value: the novel alternates between non linear two and linear one chapters
lines.name: English

lines.value: zelazny explained i did not decide until i was well into the book that since there was really two time situations being dealt with on-road and off road with off road being anywhen in history i needed only two chapter headings one and two to let the reader know where we are
lines.name: English

lines.value: and since the twos were non linear anyway i clipped each two chapter into a discrete packet stacked them and then shuffled them before reinserting them between the ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: it shouldn't have made any difference though i wouldn't have had the guts to try doing that without my experience with my other experimental books and the faith it had given me in the feelings i'd developed toward narrative the book's editor was confused by the two chapters and required zelazny to rearrange the order of a few of them before publication
lines.name: English

lines.value: the central theme of the novel is time travel using a highway that links all times and all possible histories
lines.name: English

lines.value: exits from the highway lead to different times and places
lines.name: English

lines.value: changing events in the past cause some exits further up the road in the future to become overgrown and inaccessible and new exits to appear leading to different alternative futures
lines.name: English

lines.value: the narrator and protagonist red dorakeen has vague memories of a place or time that is no longer accessible from the road
lines.name: English

lines.value: he runs guns to the greeks at marathon trying to recreate history as he remembers it in an attempt to open a new exit from the road to his half remembered place
lines.name: English

lines.value: the phrase last exit to babylon was the manuscript title of the book and appears on the cover art it was later used as a title for volume four in the collected stories of roger zelazny collection
lines.name: English

lines.value: all one chapters feature red dorakeen and all two chapters feature secondary characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are red's natural son randy newly introduced to the road and tired of his old life in ohio a bevy of would be assassins attempting to kill red some of whom are comic references to pulp characters or real people it is implied that ambrose bierce is writing a novel somewhere on the metaphysical highway and leila a woman whose fate is bound to red's in mysterious and unexplained ways
lines.name: English

lines.value: the one storyline is fairly linear but the two storyline jumps around in time and sequence first bringing in randy and leila without introduction then later showing randy's introduction to the road and meeting with leila who will has just abandoned red following an incident in the one timeline
lines.name: English

lines.value: everything comes clear in the final chapter however
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are a number of interesting humorous touches and allusions in the story
lines.name: English

lines.value: these include an ancient dragon who falls in love with a tyrannosaurus a futuristic warrior robot left behind by aliens because it is malfunctioning and has now taken up pottery a lost crusader who now works in a gas station located somewhere on the timeless road occasionally asking his customers about the current status of the holy land an ancient sumerian who buries artifacts later to be found by himself as archaeologist along with the brief appearances of pulp heroes such as doc savage and john sunlight as well as real historical figures including jack the ripper marquis de sade and an angry adolf hitler who is furiously searching for the place where he won
lines.name: English

lines.value: <references/>
lines.name: English

lines.value: a grazing antelope is any of the species of antelope that make up the subfamily hippotraginae of the family bovidae
lines.name: English

lines.value: as grazers rather than browsers the hippo in hippotraginae refers to the slightly horse like characteristics of body size and proportions long legs and a solid body with a relatively thick muscular neck
lines.name: English

lines.value: how to be good is a 2001 novel by the english writer nick hornby
lines.name: English

lines.value: it centers on characters katie carr a doctor and her husband david grant
lines.name: English

lines.value: the story begins when david stops being the angriest man in holloway and begins to be good with the help of his spiritual healer dj goodnews who also shows up briefly in hornby's a long way down
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pair go about this by nominally convincing people to give their spare bedrooms to the homeless but as their next scheme comes around reversal being good to people one has not been good to in the past this proves to be fruitless and thus david gives up his strivings and his plans for a book on how to be good appropriately named how to be good the protagonist katie briefly encounters a minor character named dick whose description and attitude towards music are reminiscent of the character of the same name from hornby's first novel high fidelity
lines.name: English

lines.value: bruce arena born september 21 1951 is an american soccer coach
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is a member of the national soccer hall of fame
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena has had a long and distinguished coaching career and is considered to be one of the most successful coaches in north american soccer history having won five college cup titles and five mls cup titles
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was head coach of the us at the 1996 summer olympics the 2002 fifa world cup and the 2006 fifa world cup head coach of the new york red bulls dc united and la galaxy in major league soccer and coached the university of virginia to several college soccer championships
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is the us soccer team's longest serving head coach
lines.name: English

lines.value: before beginning his coaching career arena was a goalkeeper for cornell university and earned one cap with the united states men's national soccer team making him the only us national team manager in the modern era to have formerly played for the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena was born in brooklyn new york to italian immigrant parents from calabria and grew up in the long island town of franklin square new york where he attended carey high school
lines.name: English

lines.value: while he excelled at several sports he was too small for american football so he joined the school's soccer team as a defender
lines.name: English

lines.value: he moved into the goal when the starting goalkeeper was suspended after hitting another school's player during a game
lines.name: English

lines.value: while in high school he also played a single season with local club hota sc of new york city's cosmopolitan soccer league
lines.name: English

lines.value: after graduation he began his collegiate athletic career playing both lacrosse and soccer at nassau community college a two year college near his home
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena was a 1970 and 1971 honorable mention all american lacrosse player and an all american soccer player
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was inducted into the national junior college hall of fame in 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: while at nassau he played soccer for head coach bill stevenson and goalkeeper coach shep messing a future new york cosmos goalkeeper
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of his two years with nassau arena transferred to cornell university in upstate new york where he was a 1972 honorable mention all american and a 1973 second team all american in lacrosse
lines.name: English

lines.value: he did not originally intend to play soccer but injuries to the school's first and second string goalkeepers led to the men's soccer coach dan wood to recruit arena into the team as its goalkeeper
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena backstopped the cornell big red soccer team to the 1972 ncaa soccer championship final four and earned most valuable defensive player honors for the tournament
lines.name: English

lines.value: after graduating from cornell new york cosmos drafted arena in the fifth round of the north american soccer league college draft
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cosmos released him before the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena then signed to play professional lacrosse for the montreal quebecois spending a single season with the team in 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: the national lacrosse league folded at the end of the 1975 season leaving arena unemployed
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the same time dan wood who had recruited arena to play for the cornell soccer team had been named the new head coach of the expansion tacoma tides which played in the american soccer league
lines.name: English

lines.value: wood contacted arena and convinced him to move to the pacific northwest to play for him
lines.name: English

lines.value: while arena was the second string goalkeeper behind starter jamil canal the move to tacoma was significant in that it introduced arena to coaching
lines.name: English

lines.value: that year in addition to playing for the tides arena coached the men's soccer team at the university of puget sound
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1973 he earned his only national team cap as a second half substitute for bob rigby in a 2 0 loss to israel
lines.name: English

lines.value: national team coach gordon bradley had called arena into the national team for an earlier game against haiti but arena could not get time off from his job teaching at a local junior high school
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to his single cap with the us soccer team arena also played for the national lacrosse team which won the 1974 world lacrosse championship and finished runner up in 1978
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1977 arena moved back to teach at cornell and act as the school's assistant lacrosse coach
lines.name: English

lines.value: while he was there the university of virginia uva advertised for two open coaching positions - head soccer coach and assistant lacrosse coach beginning the 1978 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena took that opportunity and would go on to coach both the uva lacrosse and soccer teams for seven years before becoming the school's dedicated soccer coach in 1985
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena was the head coach of the virginia program for eighteen years during which he won five national championships including 4 straight from 1991 94 and amassed a 295 58 32 record
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally he coached and developed many players at virginia who would go on to play significant roles in the united states national team including claudio reyna jeff agoos ben olsen john harkes and tony meola
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to coaching arena served as the acc soccer coaches chairman as well as two three year terms on the ncaa division i soccer committee from 1989 to 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: on january 3 1996 arena left uva to become the coach of dc united of major league soccer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1996 season would be both the team's and the league's inaugural season so arena needed to build a team from scratch just like the other 9 mls club managers
lines.name: English

lines.value: to make his position even more difficult he had agreed to coach the us u 23 national team at the 1996 summer olympics in atlanta where it went a disappointing 1-1-1
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the distraction of the olympics arena managed to form his team and lead united to an improbable comeback victory in the first mls cup at foxboro stadium
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to the mls title arena also took united to the 1996 us open cup championship
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena and united continued to experience success in 1997
lines.name: English

lines.value: the heavily favored team won its second mls cup at rfk stadium defeating the surprise western conference champion colorado rapids 2-1
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena's success led to his selection as the 1997 mls coach of the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: this year arena took united to the semifinals of the concacaf champions cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1998 arena took united to its third consecutive mls cup only to see his team fall to the expansion chicago fire led by his protege bob bradley
lines.name: English

lines.value: however while arena failed to add another mls championship to his resume he guided united to the concacaf champions cup title with a 1-0 victory over toluca on august 16 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: he followed that with a defeat of brazilian club vasco da gama to take the interamerican cup title
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena was also the 1997 and 1998 mls all star head coach
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena was hired by the us national team to replace steve sampson as head coach in october 1998 following the team's disastrous showing in the 1998 fifa world cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: his first game in charge was a friendly against australia in san jose california on november 6 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then forged the team into a successful international side and is undisputedly the most successful coach in united states history most international wins longest home shut out best world cup showing since 1930 reaching the quarterfinals at the 2002 world cup before a controversial defeat against germany and all time best international fifa ranking 4th place april 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena also won two gold cup championships in 2002 and 2005 with a third place finish in 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2002 world cup was the high point of arena's career as the us coach
lines.name: English

lines.value: heavy underdogs coming into the tournament they stunned the world by beating a respected portuguese team 3 2 in their opening game
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena was lauded afterwards for instilling in his players the confidence to play aggressively against an international powerhouse
lines.name: English

lines.value: a hard fought tie against host nation south korea was enough to qualify for the second round despite a poor loss against poland in the final group game
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena and the us met old nemesis mexico in the round of 16 and arena adapted his tactics to secure a 2 0 victory and a quarterfinal berth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the us switched from their usual 4 4 2 to a 3 5 2 and it paid dividends almost immediately when josh wolff who arena had brought in to fill out the formation set up brian mcbride for the winning goal early in the first half
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena switched the team back to a 4 4 2 for their quarterfinal against germany and the team continued to surprise many by dominating stretches of the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: however they went on to lose 1 0 on a michael ballack header
lines.name: English

lines.value: the us national squad fell short of expectations at the 2006 fifa world cup finishing last in group e with losses to the czech republic and ghana
lines.name: English

lines.value: the united states scored only twice in its three games a tie against eventual champion italy on an own goal by italian cristian zaccardo and a goal from clint dempsey against ghana
lines.name: English

lines.value: some including former team member and espn analyst eric wynalda have blamed the poor performance on questionable coaching decisions by arena including not playing clint dempsey and putting damarcus beasley on the right wing instead of his favored left against the czechs and using a defensive 4 5 1 in the must win match vs ghana which the us eventually lost
lines.name: English

lines.value: another questionable decision was made when claudio reyna became injured after the first goal when arena subbed in defensive midfielder ben olsen to replace reyna
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his time as national team head coach the united states rose in the fifa world rankings from nineteenth to fourth to the surprise even of us players
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena's 75 wins from 1998 to 2006 are by far the most in us history
lines.name: English

lines.value: nevertheless three weeks after the americans disappointing first round exit from the world cup in germany the us soccer federation announced that arena's contract would not be renewed when it expired at the end of 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: us soccer federation president sunil gulati explained arena's dismissal stating that the us was seeking a fresh approach arena was eventually replaced as national team manager by his close friend and former assistant at virginia and dc united bob bradley
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 14 2006 ussf announced they would not renew arena's contract with the us national team
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result he began to pursue other coaching opportunities
lines.name: English

lines.value: that led to his being hired by major league soccer team new york red bulls
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena's first match with the club came on august 12 2006 in a friendly against fc barcelona
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 5 2007 red bulls and arena decided mutually to part company
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his year and a half with the club he went 16 16 10
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had two years remaining on his contract with the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: on august 18 2008 los angeles galaxy hired arena to replace ruud gullit as head coach and alexi lalas as general manager
lines.name: English

lines.value: he inherited a team which had failed to make the playoffs since 2005 and would go on to finish the 2008 season at 8 13 9
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team finished thirteen out of fourteen teams and let in a league high 62 goals to 55 scored
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the off season arena reshaped the defense drafting omar gonzalez and a j delagarza who became fixtures on the back line and bringing in donovan ricketts as goalkeeper
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the team scored only 36 goals in 2009 they also let in only 31
lines.name: English

lines.value: this led to a 12 6 12 record and second place finish in the league standings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the galaxy went to the playoffs and arena was selected as the mls coach of the year award
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2011 major league soccer season went extremely well for bruce's galaxy
lines.name: English

lines.value: his club won the supporters shield for the second straight season became only the third team in league history to reach the 60 point plateau and won the 2011 mls cup in a 1 0 victory over the houston dynamo
lines.name: English

lines.value: los angeles also advanced to the elimination round of the concacaf champions league
lines.name: English

lines.value: the galaxy were however eliminated from the us open cup in the quarterfinal stage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the club was undefeated in competitive matches at the home depot center in 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2012 galaxy repeated winning the championship again over houston despite a slow start to begin the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: he would win a 3rd championship with the galaxy in 2014 over the new england revolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 22 2016 arena was appointed as coach of the united states national team for the second time replacing jurgen klinsmann after two disastrous losses in the first two matches of hex qualifying round for the 2018 world cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: on march 25 2017 arena led the usmnt to a trouncing 6 0 win over honduras followed by a 1 1 draw with panama
lines.name: English

lines.value: on june 9 arena led the usmnt to an important 2 0 win in a qualifying match against trinidad and tobago followed by the usmnt's 3rd ever wcq draw at estadio azteca against mexico
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july the us won the 2017 concacaf gold cup 2 1 over jamaica
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena's team fell 2 0 to costa rica on september 1 but he coached the team to an impressive 4 0 rout of panama on october 6 to get back into the qualifying 3rd place spot during the fifth round
lines.name: English

lines.value: on october 10 the us men's national team needed a draw against trinidad and tobago to qualify for the 2018 world cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: the us were heavy favorites coming in as trinidad and tobago had lost six straight games but the team fell into a 2 0 hole with an omar gonzalez own goal and an alvin jones goal
lines.name: English

lines.value: while christian pulisic scored a goal the us could not score again and lost to trinidad and tobago 2 1
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the loss along with both panama and honduras beating their opponents the us fell to fifth place in the concacaf region's final qualifying round and did not qualify for the fifa world cup for the first time since 1986
lines.name: English

lines.value: three days after the team failed to qualify arena resigned from his position as men's national team manager
lines.name: English

lines.value: he said we have no excuses we failed today
lines.name: English

lines.value: we should have walked of this field with at least a point
lines.name: English

lines.value: arena has resided in the los angeles area since taking over as la galaxy head coach having previously been based out of charlottesville virginia during most of his coaching career
lines.name: English

lines.value: his son kenny arena spent time with the us youth national team as well as in major league soccer before becoming a coach at both college and professional levels and currently serves as an assistant on his father's coaching staff with the national team
lines.name: English

lines.value: *1.record includes league cup playoffs and concacaf competitions
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his tenure as dc united head coach all shootout wins were put into their own separate column and all shootout losses were put under the loss column
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his tenure as united states head coach matches that end in a shootout are considered ties
lines.name: English
