lines.value: icos corporation trademark icos was an american biotechnology company and the largest biotechnology company in the us state of washington before it was sold to eli lilly and company in 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was founded in 1989 by david blech isaac blech robert nowinski and george rathmann a pioneer in the industry and chief executive officer ceo and co founder of amgen icos focused on the development of drugs to treat inflammatory disorders
lines.name: English

lines.value: during its 17-year history the company conducted clinical trials of twelve drugs three of which reached the last phase of clinical trials
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos also manufactured antibodies for other biotechnology companies
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos is famous for tadalafil cialis a drug used to treat erectile dysfunction
lines.name: English

lines.value: this drug was discovered by glaxosmithkline developed by icos and manufactured and marketed in partnership with eli lilly
lines.name: English

lines.value: boosted by a unique advertising campaign led by the grey worldwide agency sales from cialis allowed icos to become profitable in 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: cialis was the only drug developed by the company to be approved
lines.name: English

lines.value: leukarrest a drug to treat shock and pafase developed for sepsis were both tested in phase iii clinical trials but testing was discontinued after unpromising results during the trials
lines.name: English

lines.value: eli lilly acquired icos in january 2007 and most of icos's workers were laid off soon after
lines.name: English

lines.value: cmc biologics a danish contract manufacturer bought the remnants of icos and retained the remaining employees
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos was founded in 1989 by george rathmann robert nowinski and christopher henney each of whom had previously started another biotechnology company rathmann had created amgen nowinski had launched genetic systems later sold to bristol myers squibb and henney co founded immunex later sold to amgen
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos was formed with the goal of developing new drugs to treat the underlying causes of inflammatory diseases and halt the disease process in the early stages
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name icos comes from icosahedron a 20-sided polyhedron which is the shape of many viruses and was chosen because the founders originally thought retroviruses might be involved in inflammation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the founders raised $33 million in july 1990 from many investors including bill gates - who at the time was the largest shareholder with 10% of the equity
lines.name: English

lines.value: the company initially had temporary offices in downtown seattle but moved to bothell in september 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos went public on june 6 1991 raising $36 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: george rathmann seen as a guiding father to icos left the company in february 2000 and was replaced as ceo and chairman by paul clark a former executive at abbott laboratories
lines.name: English

lines.value: a former icos manager named short sighted leadership by clark as a factor in the failure of the company to develop any other successful drugs apart from cialis
lines.name: English

lines.value: sold as cialis and initially codenamed ic351 tadalafil is a drug prescribed for erectile dysfunction ed and approved for pulmonary arterial hypertension pah
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a phosphodiesterase type 5 pde5 inhibitor similar in function to sildenafil
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to ed and pah tadalafil has undergone clinical trials for the treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia and for female sexual dysfunction
lines.name: English

lines.value: tadalafil was initially formulated by glaxo wellcome now glaxosmithkline under a new drug development partnership between glaxo and icos that began in august 1991
lines.name: English

lines.value: the drug was originally researched as a treatment for cardiovascular diseases such as hypertension and angina but focus quickly shifted to ed with the success of another pde5 inhibitor sildenafil viagra which had been developed by pfizer
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos began research on tadalafil in 1993 and clinical trials started two years later
lines.name: English

lines.value: glaxo let the partnership with icos lapse in 1996 including the company's 50% share of profits from resulting drugs because the drugs in development were not in glaxo's core markets
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1998 icos formed a 50/50 joint venture with indianapolis based eli lilly lilly icos llc to develop and commercialize tadalafil as cialis
lines.name: English

lines.value: the release of cialis in the united states was delayed in april 2002 when the food and drug administration fda recommended that icos perform more studies improve labelling and address manufacturing issues
lines.name: English

lines.value: cialis was approved in europe in november 2002 and in the united states a year later
lines.name: English

lines.value: the drug was approved for once daily use for ed in europe in june 2007 and in the united states in january 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2006 cialis generated $971 million in sales leading icos to post its first ever quarterly profit in august
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 2009 tadalafil to be sold as adcirca by united therapeutics was approved in the united states for the treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension based on data from a pivotal study begun before the sale of icos to eli lilly
lines.name: English

lines.value: pfizer and lilly icos have filed many lawsuits against each other in various countries over cialis and viagra
lines.name: English

lines.value: pfizer was given a broad patent on pde5 inhibitors in britain in 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: lilly icos filed a complaint in a london court in september 1999 and the patent was overturned in november 2000 on the grounds that pfizer's patent was based on information already in the public domain when the patent was issued
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the united states pfizer filed suit against lilly icos soon after receiving a broad us patent for pde5 inhibitors in october 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: the united states patent and trademark office ordered a reexamination of the patent and as in britain the examiner found that pde5 inhibitors were not a new invention by pfizer voiding the patent
lines.name: English

lines.value: in canada pfizer moved to block sales of cialis five months after it was approved there arguing that there could be consumer backlash against pfizer should cialis be pulled from the market months later as a result of an ongoing patent lawsuit
lines.name: English

lines.value: a federal judge refused saying he could not imagine demonstrations in the street or storming of the barricades because one impotence medicine is made unavailable
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 2005 the fda began investigating reports of sudden blindness in users of sildenafil viagra
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fda said it had received reports of the condition a permanent blindness in one eye known as non arteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy in 38 users of sildenafil and 5 users of tadalafil or vardenafil levitra
lines.name: English

lines.value: lilly icos voluntarily amended the cialis label to warn of the condition
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fda was criticized for its handling of the matter as an fda safety officer had commented on unusual reports of blindness over 13 months before a journal article was published on the issue
lines.name: English

lines.value: united states senator chuck grassley wrote a letter to the fda detailing his criticism saying that the fda's office of new drugs ond had taken no action despite ond's knowledge of the blindness risks since january 2004 and general agreement among fda staff last spring that the label should be updated
lines.name: English

lines.value: grassley's letter also suggested that pfizer resisted adding the blindness warning to viagra's label
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july 2005 the fda said that viagra levitra and cialis labels would all carry warnings on the risk of sudden blindness though it was unclear whether the drugs were actually causing the blindness
lines.name: English

lines.value: lilly icos hired the grey worldwide agency in new york part of the grey global group to run the cialis advertising campaign
lines.name: English

lines.value: cialis advertisements were described as being gentler warmer and with a more relaxed feel than those of its rivals to reflect the longer duration of the drug
lines.name: English

lines.value: tadalafil has a half life of 17.5 hours compared to 3.5 for sildenafil and 4.5 for vardenafil iconic themes in cialis advertisements include couples in bathtubs and the slogan when the moment is right will you be ready cialis advertisements were unique among those of ed drugs in that they went beyond describing ed and mentioning the drug's benefits
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result cialis advertisements were also the first to describe side effects as the fda requires advertisements in support of a specific brand name to mention side effects ads for levitra and viagra did not mention the brand name of the drug therefore circumventing this fda requirement
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the first advertisements for cialis aired during the 2004 super bowl lilly icos paid more than $4 million for the one minute ad just weeks before the game the fda required more possible side effects including priapism to be listed in the advertisement
lines.name: English

lines.value: although many parents objected to the ad being aired during the super bowl janet jackson's halftime wardrobe malfunction overshadowed cialis
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 2006 a physician was added to the advertisements to describe side effects on screen and icos began running advertisements only where more than 90 percent of the audience was made up of adults effectively ending super bowl advertisements
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 lilly icos pfizer and glaxosmithkline spent a combined $373.1 million to advertise cialis viagra and levitra respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos developed several drugs whose purpose was to disrupt the process of inflammation in the body
lines.name: English

lines.value: the research program focused on the underlying causes of inflammation rather than specific disorders
lines.name: English

lines.value: the compounds developed by icos were tested in clinical trials in the areas of sepsis multiple sclerosis ischemic stroke heart attack pancreatitis pulmonary arterial hypertension chronic obstructive pulmonary disease interstitial cystitis psoriasis hemorrhagic shock sexual dysfunction benign prostatic hyperplasia rheumatoid arthritis emphysema chronic bronchitis and acute respiratory distress syndrome
lines.name: English

lines.value: rovelizumab trade named leukarrest and also known as hu23f2g was developed to treat patients suffering from hemorrhagic shock which is caused by massive blood loss
lines.name: English

lines.value: the drug is a monoclonal antibody that inhibits the recruitment of white blood cells to the site of inflammation
lines.name: English

lines.value: during testing few patients were given the drug because leukarrest had to be administered within four hours of the injury and informed consent was required patients were often unconscious and relatives had to be reached to give consent
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 1998 icos and many medical centers asked the fda to waive consent requirements in situations where the patient was at high risk of dying and relatives could not be reached
lines.name: English

lines.value: while some medical ethicists opposed waiving consent the fda approved the proposal in august 1998 for five medical centers
lines.name: English

lines.value: development of leukarrest was halted in april 2000 when interim data from phase iii clinical trials did not meet icos's goals of significantly reducing the chance of multiple organ failure and reducing the death rate from shock at 28 days
lines.name: English

lines.value: leukarrest was also tested unsuccessfully for treatment of heart attack multiple sclerosis and stroke
lines.name: English

lines.value: pafase also known as rpaf ah was developed to treat severe sepsis
lines.name: English

lines.value: pafase is the recombinant form of platelet activating factor acetylhydrolase paf-ah also known as lipoprotein associated phospholipase a2 an enzyme made naturally by macrophages and found in human blood
lines.name: English

lines.value: paf ah inactivates platelet activating factor a phospholipid that plays a role in the inflammation seen in sepsis
lines.name: English

lines.value: the enzyme was discovered in the mid 1980s by graduate student diana stafforini and researchers steve prescott guy zimmerman and tom mcintyre at the university of utah
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gene that codes for pafase was discovered by icos
lines.name: English

lines.value: early trials for sepsis showed that the drug reduced the death rate after 28 days and patients were less likely to develop severe respiratory problems
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos also tested pafase for acute respiratory distress syndrome ards
lines.name: English

lines.value: in phase ii trials for ards pafase reduced the death rate after 28 days and reduced the chance that the lungs of the patient would fail
lines.name: English

lines.value: however icos halted development in december 2002 when interim data from phase iii trials for sepsis showed that the drug did not help patients survive
lines.name: English

lines.value: scientists at northwestern university later studied pafase for necrotizing enterocolitis and there is ongoing research on the enzyme for atherosclerosis at the university of utah
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 2000 icos and texas biotechnology formed a 50/50 partnership to research endothelin receptor antagonists for use in the areas of pulmonary hypertension and chronic heart failure
lines.name: English

lines.value: two drugs sitaxentan sodium also spelled sitaxsentan and tbc3711 were tested in clinical trials under the partnership
lines.name: English

lines.value: sitaxentan was designed to treat pulmonary arterial hypertension and tbc3711 was designed to treat cardiovascular diseases such as hypertension
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 2003 icos sold its part of the 50/50 partnership including any share of sitaxentan and tbc3711 to texas biotechnology for $4 million at closing and another $6 million within 18 months
lines.name: English

lines.value: sitaxentan sodium was later approved in europe canada and australia and was marketed under the brand name thelin
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 thelin was voluntarily withdrawn from the market worldwide due to concerns about irreversible liver damage
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos tested many other drugs that were not approved
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos manufactured many antibodies for various companies
lines.name: English

lines.value: in august 2001 the company partnered with seattle genetics to manufacture a component of their top experimental antibody drug sgn 15
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 2001 icos signed a production agreement with gpc biotech to manufacture a class of gpc's antibodies that targeted b cell lymphomas
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 2002 icos signed an agreement with eos biotechnology under which icos would produce eos's most promising monoclonal antibody candidate and eos would have non exclusive rights to icos's chef1 enhanced mammalian protein production technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: eos's antibody inhibited angiogenesis the formation of new blood vessels and was being researched as a treatment for solid tumors
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 2003 icos partnered with protein design labs to manufacture their m200 antibody
lines.name: English

lines.value: after icos's experimental drugs failed in clinical trials eli lilly was in a prime position to purchase the company
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 2006 eli lilly announced that it had reached terms to acquire icos for $2.1 billion or $32 a share
lines.name: English

lines.value: after receiving pressure from large institutional shareholders as well as proxy advisory firm institutional shareholder services iss suggesting the deal should be rejected lilly increased its offer to $2.3 billion or $34 per share a 6% increase
lines.name: English

lines.value: again resistance was voiced by some large shareholders and iss advised shareholders against accepting the new offer which it still deemed insufficient
lines.name: English

lines.value: on january 25 2007 at a special meeting 77% of the shareholders voted in support of the acquisition
lines.name: English

lines.value: eli lilly closed the transaction to acquire icos for $2.3 billion on january 29 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result of the acquisition eli lilly gained complete ownership of cialis and promptly shut down icos operations and laid off icos personnel except for 127 employees working at the biologics facility
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos was the largest biotechnology company in the state of washington at the time of the acquisition and employed around 700 people
lines.name: English

lines.value: in december 2007 cmc biopharmaceuticals a/s a copenhagen based provider of contract biomanufacturing services bought the bothell biologics facility and retained the existing 127 employees
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to the layoff of icos employees other aspects of the acquisition were equally controversial such as assertions that icos was being sold too cheaply and that conflicts of interest existed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the latter related to icos senior executives who - despite poor stock performance in part from failed clinical development programs and an inability to successfully license drugs over the preceding years - were to be massively compensated upon a successful acquisition
lines.name: English

lines.value: senior executives at icos received cash payments worth a combined $67.8 million for selling the company to eli lilly
lines.name: English

lines.value: icos chairman chief executive and president paul clark received a golden parachute worth $23.2 million in severance pay cashed out stock options restricted stock awards and other bonuses for retention and closing the deal nine senior icos executives received similar packages each worth more than $1 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: thames high school is a public high school in thames waikato new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: established in 1880 it is the second oldest secondary school in the former auckland province
lines.name: English

lines.value: at all grade levels maori language courses are offered with emphasis on developing confidence in speaking maori and on an appreciation of maori culture and values
lines.name: English

lines.value: thames seniors have access to gateway a student work program designed to educate students about real life work
lines.name: English

lines.value: thames high school's distance learning programs include collaborations with the correspondence school the open polytechnic otago polytechnic and travel careers and training ltd
lines.name: English

lines.value: walter e mooney june 6 1925 - march 1 1990 was a mit educated engineer aircraft designer pilot and model aircraft designer who lived in san diego california
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was well known professionally for his full scale aircraft efforts for convair division of general dynamics but more popularly known for the many plans and articles published in the magazines model airplane news boys life and aero modeller in the 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was once featured as a daredevil glider pilot on the 1973 tv series thrill seekers
lines.name: English

lines.value: he designed the rohr two 175 experimental aircraft almost put in production to compete against the cessna 172 in 1971
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flying aces model club of washington has held a walt mooney memorial model airplane meet named in his honor

lines.value: krdo tv virtual channel 13 uhf digital channel 24 is an abc affiliated television station licensed to colorado springs colorado united states and also serving pueblo
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station is owned by pikes peak television a subsidiary of the news press & gazette company npg of st joseph missouri and is sister to low powered telemundo affiliate ktlo lp channel 46 which is simulcast on krdo tv's second digital subchannel and radio stations krdo am 1240 khz and krdo fm 105.5 mhz
lines.name: English

lines.value: the four stations share studios on south 8th street in colorado springs krdo tv's transmitter is located on cheyenne mountain
lines.name: English

lines.value: krdo tv is carried on channel 12 on comcast xfinity cable in colorado springs channel 13 is instead occupied by ktlo lp
lines.name: English

lines.value: krdo tv first went on the air on september 21 1953 as an nbc affiliate
lines.name: English

lines.value: at that time kktv channel 11 was a primary cbs affiliate with a secondary affiliation with abc and kcsj tv channel 5 now koaa tv was the nbc affiliate for nearby pueblo
lines.name: English

lines.value: as such during much of the 1950s southern colorado was served by two full time nbc affiliates and a cbs affiliate that also carried abc programming
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1960 the formerly separate colorado springs and pueblo tv markets melded into one single market serving the pikes peak region and surrounding areas
lines.name: English

lines.value: at that point each of the three commercial tv stations became exclusive network affiliates with kktv retaining cbs kcsj tv continuing with nbc and krdo tv becoming a full time abc affiliate
lines.name: English

lines.value: krdo was one of the few abc affiliates that didn't clear the dick cavett show during the late 1960s and early 1970s
lines.name: English

lines.value: krdo tv had been locally owned by pikes peak broadcasting company since the station signed on
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 2006 the company announced that it was selling krdo tv along with krdo radio and kjct in grand junction to the news press & gazette company
lines.name: English

lines.value: news press & gazette officially took over operations of krdo tv on june 26 2006 in honor of pikes peak broadcasting it changed the name of its colorado broadcast group to pikes peak television
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station's digital signal is multiplexed
lines.name: English

lines.value: krdo tv shut down its analog signal over vhf channel 13 on june 12 2009 the official date in which full power television stations in the united states transitioned from analog to digital broadcasts under federal mandate
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station's digital signal remained on its pre transition uhf channel 24
lines.name: English

lines.value: through the use of psip digital television receivers display the station's virtual channel as its former vhf analog channel 13
lines.name: English

lines.value: krdo tv's news operation was rebranded from news 13 to newschannel 13 on the same day that npg took over the station's operations
lines.name: English

lines.value: under npg krdo expanded its newscasts starting with 5 p.m and 6 p.m newscasts replacing the single early evening 5:30 p.m newscasts
lines.name: English

lines.value: it added weekend morning newscasts currently airing from 6 7 a.m and 8 9 a.m both on saturdays and sundays that started in the final week of december 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 2007 it started a midday newscast that airs from noon 1 p.m both were first anchored by former kktv anchor eric singer who would anchor krdo's 5 p.m and 6 p.m newscasts
lines.name: English

lines.value: singer now works at the gazette as a reporter and anchor on the newspaper's new media platforms
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 23 2008 krdo tv began broadcasting southern colorado's first local newscasts in high definition hd beginning with newschannel 13 at noon
lines.name: English

lines.value: on october 10 2011 krdo tv added an early evening newscast at 4:30 p.m the early evening newscast was moved up to 4:00 p.m during september 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: krdo has been very competitive with kktv and koaa in the local news ratings since news press & gazette bought the station in 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: :'this page is about jonas lie the painter
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the ns minister see jonas lie government minister for the writer see jonas lie writer jonas lie april 29 1880 january 18 1940 was a norwegian born american painter
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is best known for colorful paintings of coastlines of new england and city scenes of new york city
lines.name: English

lines.value: jonas lie was born in moss in ostfold county norway
lines.name: English

lines.value: his father sverre lie was a civil norwegian engineer and his mother helen augusta steele was an american from hartford connecticut
lines.name: English

lines.value: his father was a brother of thomasine lie who had married their cousin jonas lie the famous norwegian author whom the painter was named after
lines.name: English

lines.value: their home was a meeting place for famous people such as henrik ibsen bjornstjerne bjornson edvard grieg and georg brandes
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1892 his father died and 12-year-old jonas was sent to stay with his aunt and uncle thomasine and jonas lie in paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: having already received drawing instruction from christian skredsvig in norway he now attended a small private art school
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year he joined his mother and sisters in new york city
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1901 and the memorial exhibition in 1940 his work was shown all over america
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1905 lie exhibited 34 pictures in the pratt institute brooklyn museum of art
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1905 and 1938 lie had 57 one man shows each including from 12 to 45 paintings
lines.name: English

lines.value: he participated in important annual and biennial exhibitions at the national academy of design the pennsylvania academy of the fine arts the art institute of chicago and the corcoran gallery of art in washington as well as most of the world fairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: while living in panama in 1913 he painted scenes of the construction of panama canal which were later donated to us military academy at west point in memory of the west pointer who as chief engineer was most potent in channeling the isthmus general george w goethals
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1932 jonas lie was awarded the knight of order of st olav by the king of norway
lines.name: English

lines.value: jonas lie often depicted the sea channels and ships with dramatic perspective and powerful use of color
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became known for colorful impressionistic scenes of harbors & coves painted during the many summers he spent on the coasts of new england & canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: throughout his prolific career he painted brilliantly colored images of the rocky coves and harbors that identify the region's dramatic shoreline
lines.name: English

lines.value: lie painted a landscape mural in honor of his wife sonia in the sanctuary of the first unitarian society of plainfield new jersey in 1929
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is inscribed i will lift up mine eyes unto the hills lie was a member of various art organizations including the salmagundi club and was active in the national academy of design
lines.name: English

lines.value: paintings of jonas lie are on exhibit at art museums throughout the united states including at utah museum of fine arts cornell fine arts museum phoenix art museum san diego museum of art corcoran gallery of art museum of fine arts boston brooklyn museum of art metropolitan museum of art high museum of art the detroit institute of arts and at the memorial art gallery
lines.name: English

lines.value: *[http://www.hlchalfant.com/artists/jonas-lie biography of jonas lie by dina tolfsby curator of the norwegian american collection national library of norway
lines.name: English

lines.value: published by the norwegian chapter of the norwegian american historical association vol
lines.name: English

lines.value: * jonas lie coley gallery.com
lines.name: English

lines.value: five ships of the royal navy have been named hms albemarle after george monck 1st duke of albemarle sometimes the spelling albermarle is seen

lines.value: wigbolt baron ripperda 1535
lines.name: English

lines.value: &ndash 16 july 1573 ) was the city governor of haarlem when the city was under siege by the spanish army in the eighty years war
lines.name: English

lines.value: wigbolt ripperda was the son of baron focko ripperda van winsum and baroness clara van ewsum and born in winsum
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ripperda family was one of the oldest and most powerful noble families in the ommelanden nowadays known as the province of groningen in the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: focko and clara ripperda had four sons peter asinge onno wigbolt and johanna a daughter
lines.name: English

lines.value: wigbolt studied in geneva and orleans together with his brother onno
lines.name: English

lines.value: there he studied latin and other languages
lines.name: English

lines.value: in geneva where calvin was preaching he got into contact with protestantism the new religion that inspired the dutch revolt
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became a strong believer in protestantism
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he returned to winsum he was involved in the wave of iconoclasm in the netherlands the beeldenstorm
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 14 september 1566 wigbolt and his brothers as well as two other men broke into the church in winsum and destroyed the statues of saints and the altar
lines.name: English

lines.value: wigbolt joined the army of the prince of orange the geuzen and became hopman
lines.name: English

lines.value: until august 1572 he was commander of the guard of william van der marck lord of lumey who brought him to the city of haarlem
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became governor of haarlem after that
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 4 december a week before the siege started ripperda cleaned the sint bavokerk of all catholic symbols
lines.name: English

lines.value: when it became clear that a large spanish army under command of don fadrique was approaching the city he inspired the citizens and municipality of haarlem not to give in to the demands of the spanish king but to fight and defend the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city stayed loyal to the prince of orange and resisted the spanish army in a 7-months siege
lines.name: English

lines.value: after this long and bitter siege the city had to surrender because of a lack of food and supplies
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 12 july 1573 the city officially surrendered to don fadrique
lines.name: English

lines.value: ripperda was captured together with other soldiers and imprisoned in a church in haarlem
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 16 july at 11.00 o'clock he was transferred to the grote markt where he was beheaded
lines.name: English

lines.value: his brother asinge who was also in the city was smuggled out of the city by a spaniard
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the city was defeated the siege of haarlem had been so exhausting for the spanish army that in the siege of alkmaar they were defeated
lines.name: English

lines.value: his brother onno died on 17 june 1580
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of streets and buildings in haarlem and winsum are named after ripperda
lines.name: English

lines.value: the international republican institute iri describes itself as a nonprofit nonpartisan organization committed to advancing freedom and democracy worldwide by helping political parties to become more issue based and responsive assisting citizens to participate in government planning and working to increase the role of marginalized groups in the political process - including women and youth its critics say that it has helped to overthrow popularly elected governments such as the government of jean bertrand aristide in haiti and replaced them with unpopular dictatorships
lines.name: English

lines.value: founded in 1983 and initially known as the national republican institute for international affairs the iri's stated mission is to expand freedom throughout the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: its activities include assisting political parties and candidates develop their values and institutional structures good governance practices civil society development civic education women's and youth leadership development electoral reform and election monitoring and political expression in closed societies
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has been chaired by arizona senator john mccain since january 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: iri has dramatically increased its efforts to bring institutional structure to arab countries whose social and political fabric was frayed by the arab spring
lines.name: English

lines.value: iri controversially was helping organize haitian workers and farmers in haiti prior to the 2004 haitian coup d'etat organized conservative political parties in poland and has been involved in organizing women in egypt during and after the arab spring
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iri is a non partisan organization founded in 1983 after us president ronald reagan's 1982 speech before the british parliament in westminster in which he proposed a broad objective of helping countries build the infrastructure of democracy
lines.name: English

lines.value: quoting the un universal declaration of human rights he stated we must be staunch in our conviction that freedom is not the sole prerogative of a lucky few but the inalienable and universal right of all human beings the westminster speech led to the establishment of the national endowment for democracy by congress in 1983
lines.name: English

lines.value: the endowment is a mechanism to channel congressional funds to the iri and three other institutes the national democratic institute for international affairs the american center for international labor solidarity and the center for international private enterprise
lines.name: English

lines.value: these organizations provide technical assistance to political bodies worldwide
lines.name: English

lines.value: the majority of the iri's funding comes from the united states agency for international development usaid the us state department and the national endowment for democracy
lines.name: English

lines.value: at first iri focused on democratic institutions and processes in latin america but has expanded its focus worldwide since the end of the cold war
lines.name: English

lines.value: iri has conducted programs in more than 100 countries and is currently active in 70 countries
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iri operates as a political organization abroad providing training and assistance to favoured political parties
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a 501(c)(3 tax exempt organization it plays no part in domestic us politics
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the majority of its board staff and consultants are drawn from the republican party
lines.name: English

lines.value: its sister organization the national democratic institute for international affairs draws mainly from the democratic party
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1995 iri established the freedom award to honor individuals who have worked to advance freedom and democracy in their countries and around the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: iri works with the following organizations
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has pursued a nominally neutral agenda which puts emphasis on promoting the involvement of indigenous people in the electoral process
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iri is accused of training some of the leaders of the 2004 haitian coup d'etat as well as funding farmer's groups in the country in an opposition campaign in the months leading up the removal of jean bertrand aristide by a coalition of canada the us and france
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iri received funding for the haiti project from usaid for two years late 2002 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: iri ended all programming in haiti in summer 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: the now defunct website was displaying the iri logo together with the title haiti get involved from about 2003 until mid 2005 and to be offering news analysis reports documents and training manuals as well as information on the upcoming election and a list of political parties
lines.name: English

lines.value: canadian broadcasting corporation television premiered a documentary film about the iri's role in the coup haiti democracy undone on 29 january 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: freedom of information act documents show that the iri was involved in training and supporting pro coup opposition parties
lines.name: English

lines.value: iri was accused by former us ambassador brian dean curran of undermining his efforts to hold peaceful negotiations between aristide and his opposition after contested senatorial elections in 2000
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to curran stanley lucas then iri's representative in haiti advised opposition leaders not to compromise with aristide who would soon be driven from power
lines.name: English

lines.value: curran also alleged that lucas represented himself to the opposition as the true envoy of washington and his advice which was contrary to that of the state department as advice from the american government
lines.name: English

lines.value: iri responded to ambassador curran's allegations in a letter to the new york times stating mixed us signals helped tilt haiti toward chaos front page jan 29 found support for some of former ambassador brian dean curran's charges among only a few haitians most of them former associates of president jean bertrand aristide
lines.name: English

lines.value: all have obvious motivation to impugn the international republican institute's work and none presented any evidence to back their accusations otto reich who was the state department's top official on latin america under colin powell described a change in us policy toward haiti with the arrival of the bush administration
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to reich aristide fell somewhat out of favor with the change of us executive though powell continued to publicly profess us support for the democratically elected leader
lines.name: English

lines.value: curran's allegations were corroborated by luigi r einaudi of the organization of american states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cuban government accuses former congressional staffer caleb mccarry of orchestrating the 2004 haitian coup and attempting to provoke a coup d'etat in cuba
lines.name: English

lines.value: an anonymous state department source told a salon.com journalist that the funds mccarry allegedly used in haiti came from the iri
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iri has been accused of supporting the 2009 honduran coup d'etat
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iri refuses to term the event as such and calls it a constitutional crisis
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iri received $550000 from the national endowment for democracy in 2009 in order to promote and enhance the participation of think tanks in mexico and honduras as pressure groups to impel political parties to develop concrete positions on key issues and to support initiatives to implement political positions during the campaigns in 2009 following the coup
lines.name: English

lines.value: the iri claims credit for having united and organised a diverse range of center and center right wing political parties together to create the solidarity electoral action aws which was in government in poland together with its coalition partner the freedom union uw party from 1997 to 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: it claims having provided training in political campaigning communications training and research which helped organise and create the aws
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also claims that once the aws was in government it organised an advertising campaign for the polish government in order to stop the aws splitting up over internal tensions
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to an april 2011 new york times article the iri the national democratic institute for international affairs and other groups were credited for training activists in the middle east specifically egypt and tunisia who were advocating for reform in authoritarian regimes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the money spent on these programs was minute compared with efforts led by the pentagon
lines.name: English

lines.value: but as american officials and others look back at the uprisings of the arab spring they are seeing that the united states democracy building campaigns played a bigger role in fomenting protests than was previously known with key leaders of the movements having been trained by the americans in campaigning organizing through new media tools and monitoring elections
lines.name: English

lines.value: "a number of the groups and individuals directly involved in the revolts and reforms sweeping the region including the april 6 youth movement in egypt the bahrain center for human rights and grass roots activists like entsar qadhi a youth leader in yemen received training and financing from groups like the international republican institute the national democratic institute and freedom house a nonprofit human rights organization based in washington according to interviews in recent weeks and american diplomatic cables obtained by wikileaks a ministry of justice's report on foreign funding of ngos in egypt has revealed that iri in egypt has received funding of about 7 million dollars by usaid for the egyptian 2011 12 elections
lines.name: English

lines.value: the military rulers who gained control of the country following the january 2011 revolution consider this foreign funding interference in internal affairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: iri's current president mark green assumed leadership in february 2014
lines.name: English

lines.value: its former president lorne craner assumed leadership on august 2 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 2001 to 2004 craner served as assistant secretary for democracy human rights and labor at the us state department
lines.name: English

lines.value: baywatch nights is an american police and science fiction drama series that aired in syndication from 1995 to 1997
lines.name: English

lines.value: created by douglas schwartz david hasselhoff and gregory j bonann the series is a spin off from the television series baywatch
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original premise of the series was that during a midlife crisis sgt garner ellerbee gregory alan williams who was the resident police officer of baywatch since the beginning of the series decides to quit his job as a police officer and form a detective agency
lines.name: English

lines.value: mitch buchannon david hasselhoff his friend from baywatch joins to support him and they are in turn joined by a detective named ryan mcbride angie harmon
lines.name: English

lines.value: singer lou rawls who starred in the first season performed the series theme song after the sun goes down alongside david hasselhoff
lines.name: English

lines.value: rawls played the role of lou raymond owner of the nightclub where the detective agency rented their office
lines.name: English

lines.value: midway into the first season the series added two new cast members eddie cibrian and donna d'errico
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the second season facing slipping ratings which were never as good as the original series the producers decided to switch to a science fiction format inspired by the success of the x files
lines.name: English

lines.value: gregory alan williams left the series and was replaced by dorian gregory as diamont teague a paranormal expert
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new format did not help the series and it was canceled after the second season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the character donna marco was later carried over to the original baywatch series afterwards
lines.name: English

lines.value: shock entertainment released both seasons on dvd in region 4 australia on september 18 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: germa (), known in ancient times as garama is an archaeological site in libya
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was the capital of the garamantian kingdom
lines.name: English

lines.value: the garamantes were a berber people living in the fezzan in the northeastern sahara desert
lines.name: English

lines.value: garamantian power climaxed during the second and the third centuries ad often in conflict with the roman empire to the north
lines.name: English

lines.value: garama had a population of some four thousand and another six thousand living in villages within a 5 km radius
lines.name: English

lines.value: the garamantes often conducted raids across rome's african frontier the limes tripolitanus and retreat back to the safety of the desert
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 203 the roman emperor septimius severus launched a campaign deep into the sahara capturing garama but he abandoned it soon after
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city was conquered by uqba ibn nafi in 49 ah c
lines.name: English

lines.value: archaeological work at germa has most recently been conducted by prof david mattingly's fazzan project which has continued the work of charles daniels and mohammed ayoub
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fazzan project is about to publish the second of four planned volumes based on its work
lines.name: English

lines.value: gerald byrne 29 august 1938 - 28 november 2015 was an english footballer who spent his entire playing career at liverpool football club
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in liverpool byrne like jimmy melia joined liverpool straight from school as a 15-year-old in 1953
lines.name: English

lines.value: again like melia byrne impressed manager don welsh who offered the full back a professional contract the day after his 17th birthday on 30 august 1955
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was just over two years later that byrne made his debut charlton athletic thrashed the reds 5 1 in a league match at the valley on 28 september 1957 he had to wait a further 4 years for his first goal which came in the 52nd minute of a 3 1 2nd division win over brighton at anfield on 3 february 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: his debut was his only appearance during season 1957 58
lines.name: English

lines.value: bill shankly was appointed manager in december 1959 and at the season's end had a clear out of 24 players
lines.name: English

lines.value: notably byrne was retained as was roger hunt
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was not until the arrival of bill shankly that he really got his chance he featured in 38 league and cup matches as the reds finished third for the fifth time in a row in the second division
lines.name: English

lines.value: considering he only played seven times in the previous three seasons this was a major improvement in gerry's career in fact he was on the transfer list when shankly arrived soon to be removed
lines.name: English

lines.value: shankly again used byrne's grit and determination to its fullest he was an ever present as liverpool finally romped to the 2nd division title beating leyton orient into second spot by eight points
lines.name: English

lines.value: he played in 38 of liverpool's 42 league games their first year back in the big time and he also played in all seven of liverpool's cup ties during their run to the 1965 fa cup final a game in which byrne would write his name in liverpool folklore forever more
lines.name: English

lines.value: byrne played for liverpool in the 1965 fa cup final which took place on 1 may at wembley with a broken collarbone
lines.name: English

lines.value: he suffered the injury as early as the third minute but played on throughout the rest of the game and the whole of extra time as liverpool won the cup for the very first time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the break happened after byrne was challenged heftily by leeds united's captain bobby collins but with substitutes still not permitted by the authorities in 1965 he had little choice but to carry on playing
lines.name: English

lines.value: the game went to extra time and byrne despite the pain kept making his familiar marauding runs down the left flank in joining the attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: early on into the first period of extra time he reached the by line with the ball and pulled back a perfect cross for roger hunt to open the scoring
lines.name: English

lines.value: leeds got back into the game and equalised through billy bremner but liverpool were not to be denied as ian st john headed home the winner late on during the second period securing liverpools first ever fa cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: shankly spoke highly of gerry in an interview after the final saying it was a performance of raw courage from the boy
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aftermath of another high profile match led to calls again for the football association to allow a substitute to be selected by each team in competitive matches
lines.name: English

lines.value: in fa cup finals over the previous decade there had been a notable number of teams reduced to ten men or hampered considerably by hard challenges from opposition players
lines.name: English

lines.value: this included goalkeepers bert trautmann in 1955 and ray wood in 1957 suffering a broken neck and broken cheekbone respectively while two wingers in successive years were stretchered off with broken legs roy dwight in 1959 and dave whelan in 1960 and a full back left hobbling for three quarters of the game with a damaged ankle len chalmers in 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: byrne's injury was the latest to try to force the fa's hand and eventually two years later the first substitutes were allowed in the fa cup final
lines.name: English

lines.value: shankly pulled off a masterstroke just before the semi final of the european cup against inter milan
lines.name: English

lines.value: anfield was already buzzing in anticipation of the up and coming game when shankly sent out the injured pair of gerry byrne and his half back partner gordon milne with the piece of silverware the kopites had dreamt about for decades the fa cup the crowd erupted and it's said you could see the italian champions freeze on the spot it had the desired effect as liverpool ran out comfortable 3 1 winners
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the 2nd leg at the san siro was full of controversy as internazionale got a 3 0 win to end liverpool's dreams of a cup double
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1965 66 campaign was another triumphant one for byrne and the reds as he was an ever present in liverpool's second title win in three years
lines.name: English

lines.value: byrne along with winger ian callaghan and hunt were rewarded for their superb club form by being selected in alf ramsey's england squad for the 1966 world cup finals to be held on home soil
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1966 world cup final only the 11 players on the pitch at the end of the 4 2 win over west germany received medals
lines.name: English

lines.value: following a football association led campaign to persuade fifa to award medals to all the winners squad members byrne was presented with his medal by gordon brown at a ceremony at 10 downing street on 10 june 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: byrne won two international caps for england
lines.name: English

lines.value: he made his international debut on 6 april 1963 in a british home championship match against scotland at wembley
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scots won 2 1 in a game which saw fellow liverpool teammate jimmy melia make his england debut
lines.name: English

lines.value: his second and last cap came in a friendly match preceding the 1966 world cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: jimmy greaves scored four goals as england won 6 1 against norway
lines.name: English

lines.value: byrne stayed on at anfield until 1969 when injury ended his career
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was replaced by alec lindsay
lines.name: English

lines.value: he suffered from alzheimer's disease in later life and died in a nursing home in wrexham on 28 november 2015 at the age of 77
lines.name: English

lines.name: English
