lines.value: new hampshire route 175 nh 175 is a state highway in the us state of new hampshire
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highway runs north from an intersection in holderness with us route 3 and new hampshire route 25 to an intersection with us 3 in woodstock
lines.name: English

lines.value: nh 175 is a minor highway that parallels us 3 and interstate 93 through the valley of the pemigewasset river
lines.name: English

lines.value: nh 175 has a secondary spur road nh 175a which connects it to downtown plymouth
lines.name: English

lines.value: nh 175 begins at an intersection with us 3 and nh 25 daniel webster highway at little squam lake in the town of holderness
lines.name: English

lines.value: the state highway heads north and then west through a hilly area where it briefly passes through the town of ashland before returning to holderness
lines.name: English

lines.value: nh 175 enters the valley of the pemigewasset river and passes by the historic trinity church and near the holderness school and the chapel of the holy cross
lines.name: English

lines.value: north of the school and churches the highway meets the eastern end of its spur into plymouth and plymouth state university nh 175a
lines.name: English

lines.value: nh 175 continues north parallel to the river and i 93 and us 3 which follow the opposite right bank of the river into the town of campton
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highway crosses the beebe river and parallels the mad river to its bridge over the river immediately to the south of the highway's junction with nh 49
lines.name: English

lines.value: nh 175 passes through the town of thornton and its name becomes eastside road on entering the town of woodstock
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highway passes under i 93 has two crossings of the pemigewasset river and intersects tripoli road which has a diamond interchange with i 93 immediately to the east
lines.name: English

lines.value: nh 175 has an oblique grade crossing of the hobo railroad before crossing the river a third time on a truss bridge and reaching its northern terminus at us 3 daniel webster highway just south of the community of north woodstock
lines.name: English

lines.value: new hampshire route 175a nh 175a is a spur route of nh 175 in the towns of plymouth and holderness
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highway begins as the east leg of a roundabout in downtown plymouth which is dominated by the campus of plymouth state university
lines.name: English

lines.value: the north and south legs of the roundabout consist of main street which carries us 3 and nh 25 the west leg is town maintained high street
lines.name: English

lines.value: nh 175a has a grade crossing of a railroad and crosses over the pemigewasset river into holderness
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highway passes through the athletic complex of the university before reaching its four ramp partial cloverleaf interchange with i 93
lines.name: English

lines.value: east of i 93 nh 175a has its eastern terminus at nh 175
lines.name: English

lines.value: kay kavus (; ); sometimes kai kaus or kai kaus is a mythological shah of iran and a character in the shahnameh
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is the son of kay qobad and the father of prince seyavash
lines.name: English

lines.value: kavus rules iran for one hundred and fifty years during which he is frequently though increasingly grudgingly aided by the famous hero rostam
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is succeeded by his grandson kai khosrow
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flying throne of kay kavus was a legendary eagle propelled craft built by kay kavus used for flying the king all the way to china
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the shahnameh kavus had a flying craft made consisting of a throne to the corners of which were attached four long poles pointing upward
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was made of wood and gold and he attached specially trained eagles
lines.name: English

lines.value: pieces of meat were attached at the top of each pole and the ravenous eagles were chained to the feet
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the eagles tried to reach the meat they caused the throne to fly
lines.name: English

lines.value: the craft flew the king all the way to china where the eagles grew tired and the craft came down
lines.name: English

lines.value: rostam eventually had to rescue the king who miraculously survived the crash
lines.name: English

lines.value: *perses son of andromeda and perseus
lines.name: English

lines.value: * unmuseum on the flying throne of kay kavus
lines.name: English

lines.value: ang mo () or ang moh is a racial descriptor that is sometimes seen as an epithet used to refer to white people
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is used mainly in malaysia and singapore and sometimes in taiwan
lines.name: English

lines.value: it literally means red haired and originates from hokkien a variety of southern min
lines.name: English

lines.value: the usage is similar to the cantonese term gweilo ).other similar terms include ang mo kow (), ang mo kui (), ang mo lang ().
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the term has historically had some derogatory connotations it has entered common parlance as a neutral term in singapore and malaysia where it refers to a white person or when used as an adjective western culture in general
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earliest origin for the term ang mo could be traced to the contact between hokkien min nan speakers in southern fujian province of china with the portuguese people and dutch people during the 16th and 17th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 17th century dutch people failed in their attempt to force their way into fujian to trade in the 1620s during the sino dutch conflicts and were called ang mo by the locals
lines.name: English

lines.value: the spanish people and dutch people had colonized taiwan and the spanish built fort santo domingo in tamsui taiwan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dutch later drove the spanish out and seized the fort which also became known as city of the red haired () in taiwanese hokkien
lines.name: English

lines.value: dutch people were known in taiwan as ang mo lang red-haired people in taiwanese hokkien
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is most likely because red hair is a common trait among the dutch
lines.name: English

lines.value: this historical term ang mo lang continues to be used in the context of taiwanese history to refer to dutch people
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chinese characters for ang mo are the same as those in the historical japanese term which was used during the edo period 1603-1868 as an epithet for northwestern european white people
lines.name: English

lines.value: it primarily referred to dutch traders who were the only europeans allowed to trade with japan during its 200-year period of isolation
lines.name: English

lines.value: see for example ; ; ; ; ; portuguese and spanish traders were in contrast referred to as which is in turn cognate to the chinese nanman and means southern barbarians
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 19th century walter henry medhurst made a reference in his academic work a dictionary of the hok keen dialect of the chinese language that ang mo red haired generally applied to the english people
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the large migration of hokkien people to south east asia predominantly malaysia and singapore the term ang moh became more widespread and was used to refer to white people in general
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term ang mo is sometimes viewed as racist and derogatory
lines.name: English

lines.value: see for instance ; others however maintain it is acceptable making it in some contexts a reclaimed word
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite this ambiguity it is a widely used term
lines.name: English

lines.value: it appears for instance in singaporean newspapers such as the straits times and in television programs and films
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term was used in the film i not stupid in which when several employees in the marketing department of their company resented a particular white individual because they perceived that preference had been shown to him because of his race
lines.name: English

lines.value: in singapore and malaysia the term ang mo sai () is a derogatory term used within the chinese community for mocking other chinese who are not able to read chinese
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are lists of north american place name etymologies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bmw k100 is a family of four cylinder 987 cc motorcycles that were manufactured by bmw from 1983 to 1992
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the 1970s came to an end bmw faced three problems from developing its flat twin boxer engine further at the time bmw moto guzzi and harley davidson were the only major high end manufacturers that did not offer liquid cooled engines
lines.name: English

lines.value: competing brands notably of japanese manufacture were touting the superiority of their liquid cooled engines and had introduced low maintenance shaft drive technology in a growing number of their models
lines.name: English

lines.value: bmw needed to develop a clean burning four cylinder engine quickly
lines.name: English

lines.value: while a flat four engine would have been suited to their boxer tradition and experience it would also give the appearance that they were copying honda's gl1000 gold wing
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1977 josef fritzenwenger presented a prototype using a psa renault x type engine from a peugeot 104
lines.name: English

lines.value: the engine which was installed in the 104 at a 72 angle was laid flat in the frame with the crankshaft on the right running parallel to the centre line of the frame
lines.name: English

lines.value: this layout for which bmw submitted a patent application was well suited to bmw's traditional shaft drive needing only one 90 bevel drive to transmit power to the rear wheel
lines.name: English

lines.value: using shaft drive with the near vertical transverse engine preferred by the japanese manufacturers at the time would have needed two 90 bevel drives doubling the power lost to the inefficiency of these units
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new layout also kept the bike's centre of gravity low which improved the bike's handling and made space behind the front wheel available for the radiator
lines.name: English

lines.value: fritzwenger's concept was developed by a team led by stefan pachernegg based on criteria set out by r p michel and k v gevert
lines.name: English

lines.value: martin probst who had earlier worked with the development of bmw's formula two engine was responsible for engine testing and development
lines.name: English

lines.value: as an automobile manufacturer bmw had about twenty years of experience with liquid cooled overhead camshaft inline engines
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was carried over to the k100 engine which used a bosch le jetronic fuel injection similar to that being introduced on their second generation 3 series cars
lines.name: English

lines.value: replacing the bing carburettors traditionally used on bmw motorcycles the fuel injection system increased power broadened and smoothed the powerband and reduced fuel consumption partly by shutting off fuel under deceleration to 2000 rpm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the engine also featured a breakerless electronic ignition system
lines.name: English

lines.value: the engine was positioned with the crankshaft on the right hand side of the motorcycle and the cylinder head camshafts injectors and spark plugs on the left hand side
lines.name: English

lines.value: this improved access to the engine over that of a conventional design where the crankshaft would be at the bottom and the cylinder head and associated parts would be between the engine block and the upper frame
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bmw k75 is a standard motorcycle produced by bmw motorrad from 1985 to 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time of its introduction the k75 was bmw's least expensive motorcycle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three cylinder bmw k75 was developed alongside the k100 but was introduced a year after the k100 as a marketing strategy
lines.name: English

lines.value: the k75 engine had the same bore and stroke as the k100 yielding a displacement of 740 cc
lines.name: English

lines.value: its crankshaft had 120 between the throws and was counterbalanced by balance weights added to the water pump accessory shaft which ran at engine speed as is correct for a 120 straight three engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the balance shaft made the k75's engine smoother than the k100's engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: to increase the smaller engine's power the k75's engine was given longer valve timing the compression ratio was increased to 11.0:1 from the k100's 10.2:1 the combustion chambers were redesigned the intake manifold was shortened and the exhaust system was retuned
lines.name: English

lines.value: the us market engine specified to meet environmental protection agency epa requirements produced ; engines for all other markets produced
lines.name: English

lines.value: the front engine mounts on the k75 frame are placed further back than in the k100 frame and the downtubes are at a different angle otherwise the frames are identical
lines.name: English

lines.value: the k75 had the same wheelbase seat height and steering geometry as the k100
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to bmw 80 percent of the k75's parts are interchangeable with the k100's
lines.name: English

lines.value: the k75's radiator and fuel tank were smaller than those on the k100
lines.name: English

lines.value: a single sided hollow swingarm enclosing the drive shaft provides right side drive through the gearbox and to the rear wheel
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 3-into-1 all stainless steel exhaust exits on the left hand side
lines.name: English

lines.value: brakes are two piston brembo callipers onto undrilled discs
lines.name: English

lines.value: two different fork manufactures are used showa with an outer upper tube diameter of and fichtel and sachs measuring
lines.name: English

lines.value: the k series has additional refinements including aluminium fuel tanks adjustable headlights high capacity 460 watt alternators hella accessory plug in and self cancelling turn signal lights
lines.name: English

lines.value: the same team would later develop an improved four valve per cylinder head for the aerodynamic k1
lines.name: English

lines.value: in later models the standard swingarm was replaced with a paralever as on the k1
lines.name: English

lines.value: the le jetronic fuel injection system with separate ignition management was replaced by motronic engine management with the introduction of four valve cylinder heads with the 1990 k1 and the 1991 k100rs
lines.name: English

lines.value: anti lock brakes abs were developed for k100 and k75 motorcycles and were installed on later models which were among the first production motorcycles with this feature
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1993 the fork used on the k75s was replaced by a showa fork
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1994 the electrical system was given a larger 700 watt alternator and a smaller 19 ah battery
lines.name: English

lines.value: for 1995 anti lock braking was standard on the k75s
lines.name: English

lines.value: two different forks manufacturers were used showa with an outer upper tube diameter of and fichtel and sachs measuring
lines.name: English

lines.value: although sales were initially modest buyers eventually warmed to the multi cylinder bmws
lines.name: English

lines.value: the k100 was a relative sales success stemming the losses to the japanese and changing the media and public perception of bmw
lines.name: English

lines.value: the four cylinder engine suffered from secondary vibration but the three cylinder k75 with its balance shaft was far smoother
lines.name: English

lines.value: the engineers had anticipated this and had designed in excellent vibration isolation but it was the only technical glitch
lines.name: English

lines.value: the competition were never far behind in performance on launch updates were modest while engine performance was stepped up with the september 1988 launch of the radically aerodynamic bmw k1
lines.name: English

lines.value: jacques maroger (; 1884 1962 was a painter and the technical director of the louvre museum's laboratory in paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: he devoted his life to understanding the oil based media of the old masters
lines.name: English

lines.value: he emigrated to the united states in 1939 and became an influential teacher
lines.name: English

lines.value: his book the secret formulas and techniques of the masters has been criticized by some modern writers on painting who say that the painting medium maroger promoted is unsound
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1907 maroger began to study with louis anquetin and worked under his direction until anquetin's death in 1932
lines.name: English

lines.value: anquetin worked closely and exhibited with the artists vincent van gogh charles angrand emile bernard paul gauguin camille pissarro georges seurat paul signac and henri de toulouse lautrec
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was very active in the impressionist movement of the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: in his later years anquetin became very interested in the works of the flemish masters
lines.name: English

lines.value: as maroger's teacher anquetin provided guidance in the study of drawing anatomy and master painting techniques
lines.name: English

lines.value: maroger began to become famous around 1931 when the national academy of design in new york city reported maroger's painting discoveries
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1930 to 1939 maroger started to work at the louvre museum in paris as technical director of the louvre laboratory
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served as a professor at the louvre school a member of the conservation committee general secretary of the international experts and president of the restorers of france
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1937 he received the legion d'honneur and his pride at the honor is reflected in his self portrait of the time in which one can see his legion pin on his lapel
lines.name: English

lines.value: he emigrated to the united states in 1939 and became a lecturer at the parsons school of design in new york
lines.name: English

lines.value: his new york students reginald marsh john koch fairfield porter and frank mason adopted his old master painting techniques and taught it in turn to their own students
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1942 maroger became a professor at the maryland institute college of art in baltimore and established a school of painting
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the maryland institute he led a group of painters who came to be known as the baltimore realists including the painters earl hofmann thomas rowe joseph sheppard ann didusch schuler frank redelius john bannon evan keehn and melvin miller
lines.name: English

lines.value: maroger published the secret formulas and techniques of the masters in 1948
lines.name: English

lines.value: when maroger's book became available reginald marsh drew on maroger's book jacket an airplane dropping an atomic bomb on the maryland art institute a reference to the controversy maroger was causing in the local press over the abstract art versus realism debate
lines.name: English

lines.value: maroger's formula and techniques have been studied by many modern painters who wish to obtain the paint quality of the old masters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the secret formula that maroger devised during his lifetime included the main ingredient white lead
lines.name: English

lines.value: white lead when cooked into linseed oil acts as a drying agent accelerating the polymerization of the oil film
lines.name: English

lines.value: maroger claimed to have introduced to the modern day artist what the masters achieved centuries before in their paintings a way to ensure permanence and color quality in oils without sacrificing fluid and subtle paint handling
lines.name: English

lines.value: equipped with these formulas the artist could once again blend his paint easily without losing control of his brush
lines.name: English

lines.value: the paint stays where it is applied and does not run off the panel
lines.name: English

lines.value: it dries very fast so that he can paint on the same areas the very next day which speeds up painting
lines.name: English

lines.value: frank redelius one of maroger's proteges from the baltimore realists group wrote a book that updates builds upon and revises jacques maroger's research of the painting techniques and formulas of the old masters
lines.name: English

lines.value: redelius was assisting maroger with a revision of the secret formulas and techniques of the masters before maroger's death in 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: frank redelius book published in 2009 is titled the master keys a painter's treatise on the pictorial technique of oil painting
lines.name: English

lines.value: maroger has been criticized by some modern writers on painting because of his bold claims about having found the secret formulas of the masters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most commonly used of maroger's recipes today is in fact nothing other than a renamed version of the ages old megilp also known as macguilp meglip meguilp and a variety of other names
lines.name: English

lines.value: megilp maroger medium is simply the thixotropic gel resulting from the equal combination of mastic varnish and black oil
lines.name: English

lines.value: megilp and related media have been in use for centuries and such media were readily available from many artists colormen during the time of maroger's research
lines.name: English

lines.value: the archival quality of the medium itself is controversial in art circles in part because its documented use dates back less than a century
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is from michael skalka conservation administrator national gallery of art washington dc see the work of lance mayer and gay myers for more information on curry and maroger
lines.name: English

lines.value: this criticism can be misleading however
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the media involved in curry's work and other followers of maroger bear no resemblance whatsoever to the modern mastic varnish black oil recipe
lines.name: English

lines.value: maroger medium which is not made properly may contain a large amount of dirt and impurities from improperly filtered mastic varnish or the black oil may be overcooked both of which would contribute to darkening and weakening of the work
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition the overuse of megilp media or any medium for that matter tends to create weak paint films
lines.name: English

lines.value: conservation science has shown that the presence of natural resins like mastic in the paint film causes embrittlement darkening and continued solubility
lines.name: English

lines.value: see the work of leslie carlyle or joyce townsend for problems related to 18th-century painting that contain megilp
lines.name: English

lines.value: while maroger medium is usually mixed directly with oil paints its proportion should be kept to no more than 20% of the mixture
lines.name: English

lines.value: a useful technique is to rub a very thin film of maroger medium over the area to be painted and paint into that known as painting into the couch this lubricates the brush stroke
lines.name: English

lines.value: maroger medium or any other painting medium for that matter should never be used as a final picture varnish as maroger requires reaction by admixture with oil paint in order to dry
lines.name: English

lines.value: the reduced availability of lead combined with injunctions against lead use in household products and other factors has caused most major paint makers to discontinue the production of maroger's medium
lines.name: English

lines.value: many paint makers now offer faux maroger's media or faux megilps generally made by substituting different materials such as lime for genuine lead or as in the case of gamblin's neo megilp by creating a similar product out of specially thickened alkyd medium
lines.name: English

lines.value: these products produce effects similar to but not the same as those of real maroger medium which depends on specific chemical reactions between leaded oil mastic resin and turpentine the mastic varnish vehicle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the white gingerbread cottage that was maroger's home in baltimore is found on the east campus of loyola college in maryland and is used for drawing and painting courses
lines.name: English

lines.value: the building created in the style of a parisian studio is aptly called the maroger art studio
lines.name: English

lines.value: the coquimbo region (, ) is one of chile's 15 first order administrative divisions
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is some 400 km north of the capital santiago
lines.name: English

lines.value: the capital and largest city is la serena other important cities include the seaport coquimbo and the agricultural centre ovalle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the coquimbo region forms the narrowest part or waist of chile and is hence one of the country's more mountainous regions as the andes range runs closer to the sea than elsewhere
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region has notable marine species as well as taxa that are associated with the mountainous regions
lines.name: English

lines.value: with respect to marine organisms the upwelling areas encourage bioproductivity off of this pacific coast area of chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the southern mountainous areas of the coquimbo region the rare and endangered chilean wine palm is found whose habitat is threatened by human overpopulation in the region and associated deforestation for residential expansion and agriculture
lines.name: English

lines.value: the elqui valley is home to a number of astronomical observatories owing to the region's clear skies
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also home to a 600-meter-long dam the puclaro which confines the elqui river and produces a reservoir of some seven km in length
lines.name: English

lines.value: mining and agricultural activities account for the location of various places in the region around the transverse valleys and mineral deposits
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally this organization was structured according to the location of indian villages of the diaguitas
lines.name: English

lines.value: a high percentage 70-75% of inhabitants are of mestizo euro-amerindian background higher than any other region in chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: other indigenous peoples include the aymara atacameno mapuche and quechua whom were immigrants themselves from peru and bolivia
lines.name: English

lines.value: recent high population growth stresses the conurbation la serena coquimbo est
lines.name: English

lines.value: 300000 or 297253 inhabitants which concentrates half the regional population
lines.name: English

lines.value: in terms of population major cities are according to the 2002 census la serena 148815 coquimbo 148438 ovalle 66405 illapel 21826 vicuna 12910 salamanca 11615 and los vilos 10966
lines.name: English

lines.value: this region is a very popular travel destination
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale (; frequently abbreviated as ft lauderdale is a city in the us state of florida 28 mi north of miami
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the county seat of broward county
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the 2010 census the city had a population of 165521 in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a principal city of the miami metropolitan area which was home to an estimated 6012331 people in the 2015 census
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city is a popular tourist destination with an average year round temperature of and 3000 hours of sunshine per year
lines.name: English

lines.value: greater fort lauderdale encompassing all of broward county hosted 12 million visitors in 2012 including 2.8 million international visitors
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2012 the county collected $43.9 million from the 5% hotel tax it charges after hotels in the area recorded an occupancy rate for the year of 72.7 percent and an average daily rate of $114.48
lines.name: English

lines.value: the district has 561 hotels and motels comprising nearly 35000 rooms
lines.name: English

lines.value: forty six cruise ships sailed from port everglades in 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: greater fort lauderdale has over 4000 restaurants 63 golf courses 12 shopping malls 16 museums 132 nightclubs 278 parkland campsites and 100 marinas housing 45000 resident yachts
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale is named after a series of forts built by the united states during the second seminole war
lines.name: English

lines.value: the forts took their name from major william lauderdale 1782-1838 younger brother of lieutenant colonel james lauderdale
lines.name: English

lines.value: william lauderdale was the commander of the detachment of soldiers who built the first fort
lines.name: English

lines.value: however development of the city did not begin until 50 years after the forts were abandoned at the end of the conflict
lines.name: English

lines.value: three forts named fort lauderdale were constructed the first was at the fork of the new river the second was at tarpon bend on the new river between the present day colee hammock and rio vista neighborhoods and the third was near the site of the bahia mar marina
lines.name: English

lines.value: the area in which the city of fort lauderdale would later be founded was inhabited for more than two thousand years by the tequesta indians
lines.name: English

lines.value: contact with spanish explorers in the 16th century proved disastrous for the tequesta as the europeans unwittingly brought with them diseases such as smallpox to which the native populations possessed no resistance
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the tequesta disease coupled with continuing conflict with their calusa neighbors contributed greatly to their decline over the next two centuries
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1763 there were only a few tequesta left in florida and most of them were evacuated to cuba when the spanish ceded florida to the british in 1763 under the terms of the treaty of paris 1763 which ended the seven years war
lines.name: English

lines.value: although control of the area changed between spain united kingdom the united states and the confederate states of america it remained largely undeveloped until the 20th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fort lauderdale area was known as the new river settlement before the 20th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1830s there were approximately 70 settlers living along the new river
lines.name: English

lines.value: william cooley the local justice of the peace was a farmer and wrecker who traded with the seminole indians
lines.name: English

lines.value: on january 6 1836 while cooley was leading an attempt to salvage a wrecked ship a band of seminoles attacked his farm killing his wife and children and the children's tutor
lines.name: English

lines.value: the other farms in the settlement were not attacked but all the white residents in the area abandoned the settlement fleeing first to the cape florida lighthouse on key biscayne and then to key west
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first united states stockade named fort lauderdale was built in 1838 and subsequently was a site of fighting during the second seminole war
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fort was abandoned in 1842 after the end of the war and the area remained virtually unpopulated until the 1890s
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was not until frank stranahan arrived in the area in 1893 to operate a ferry across the new river and the florida east coast railroad's completion of a route through the area in 1896 that any organized development began
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city was incorporated in 1911 and in 1915 was designated the county seat of newly formed broward county
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale's first major development began in the 1920s during the florida land boom of the 1920s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1926 miami hurricane and the great depression of the 1930s caused a great deal of economic dislocation
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july 1935 an african american man named rubin stacy was accused of robbing a white woman at knife point
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was arrested and being transported to a miami jail when police were run off the road by a mob
lines.name: English

lines.value: a group of 100 white men proceeded to hang stacy from a tree near the scene of his alleged robbery
lines.name: English

lines.value: his body was riddled with some twenty bullets
lines.name: English

lines.value: the murder was subsequently used by the press in nazi germany to discredit us critiques of its own persecution of jews communists and catholics
lines.name: English

lines.value: when world war ii began fort lauderdale became a major us base with a naval air station to train pilots radar operators and fire control operators
lines.name: English

lines.value: a coast guard base at port everglades was also established
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 4 1961 african americans started a series of protests wade ins at beaches that were off limits to them to protest the failure of the county to build a road to the negro beach
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 11 1962 a verdict by ted cabot went against the city's policy of racial segregation of public beaches
lines.name: English

lines.value: today fort lauderdale is a major yachting center one of the nation's largest tourist destinations and the center of a metropolitan division with 1.8 million people
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the war ended service members returned to the area spurring an enormous population explosion which dwarfed the 1920s boom
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1960 census counted 83648 people in the city about 230% of the 1950 figure
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 1967 report estimated that the city was approximately 85% developed and the 1970 population figure was 139590
lines.name: English

lines.value: after 1970 as fort lauderdale became essentially built out growth in the area shifted to suburbs to the west
lines.name: English

lines.value: as cities such as coral springs miramar and pembroke pines experienced explosive growth fort lauderdale's population stagnated and the city actually shrank by almost 4000 people between 1980 when the city had 153279 people and 1990 when the population was 149377
lines.name: English

lines.value: a slight rebound brought the population back up to 152397 at the 2000 census
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 2000 fort lauderdale has gained slightly over 18000 residents through annexation of seven neighborhoods in unincorporated broward county
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the united states census bureau the city has a total area of of which is land and of which is water 9.87%
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale is known for its extensive network of canals there are of waterways within the city limits
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city of fort lauderdale is adjacent to the atlantic ocean includes of beaches and borders the following municipalities the northwestern section of fort lauderdale is separate from the remainder of the city connected only by the cypress creek canal as it flows under i 95
lines.name: English

lines.value: this section of fort lauderdale borders the cities of tamarac and oakland park on its south side
lines.name: English

lines.value: oakland park also borders fort lauderdale on the west side of its northeastern portion
lines.name: English

lines.value: the greater portion of fort lauderdale in the south is bordered along its north side by wilton manors
lines.name: English

lines.value: off the coast of fort lauderdale is the osborne reef an artificial reef made of discarded tires that has proven to be an ecological disaster
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dumping began in the 1960s with the intent to provide habitat for fish while disposing of trash from the land
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in the rugged and corrosive environment of the ocean nylon straps used to secure the tires wore out cables rusted and tires broke free
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tires posed a particular threat after breaking free from their restraints
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tires then migrated shoreward and ran into a living reef tract washed up on its slope and killed many things in their path
lines.name: English

lines.value: in recent years thousands of tires have also washed up on nearby beaches especially during hurricanes
lines.name: English

lines.value: local authorities are now working to remove the 700000 tires in cooperation with the us army navy and coast guard
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale has an official program for designating and recognizing neighborhoods
lines.name: English

lines.value: under the neighborhood organization recognition program more than 60 distinct neighborhoods have received official recognition from the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: an additional 25 30 neighborhoods exist without official recognition although the city's neighborhood map displays them as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale features a tropical rainforest climate koppen af closely bordering a tropical monsoon climate am with little seasonal variation in temperature
lines.name: English

lines.value: average monthly temperatures are always above and average monthly precipitation is above
lines.name: English

lines.value: this qualifies the city's climate as a tropical climate and the city does not have a true dry season
lines.name: English

lines.value: while some rain does fall in winter the majority of precipitation is received during the summer months see climate chart below
lines.name: English

lines.value: summers from may through october are hot humid and wet with average high temperatures of and lows of
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this period more than half of summer days may bring afternoon or evening thunderstorms
lines.name: English

lines.value: the record high temperature of was recorded on june 22 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: winters from november through april are warm and mostly dry with average high temperatures of and lows of
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the city experiences occasional cold fronts during this period bringing high temperatures in the 60s f 16-21 c and lows in the 40s f 4-10 c lasting only for a day or so
lines.name: English

lines.value: rare frosts occur every few decades
lines.name: English

lines.value: only once in reported history have snow flurries been reported in the air or trace amounts on the ground - on january 19 1977
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the dry season winter brush fires can be a concern in many years
lines.name: English

lines.value: annual average precipitation is with most of it occurring during the wet season from may through october
lines.name: English

lines.value: however rainfall occurs in all months even during the drier months from november through april mainly as short lived heavy afternoon thunderstorms
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale has an average of 143 rain days and 250 sunshine days annually
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hurricane season is between june 1 and november 30 with major hurricanes most likely to affect the city or state in september and october
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most recent storms to directly affect the city were hurricane katrina and hurricane wilma both of which struck the city in 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: other direct hits were hurricane cleo in 1964 hurricane king in 1950 and the 1947 fort lauderdale hurricane
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: 39.4% of all households were made up of individuals and 11.1% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older 4.8% male and 6.3% female the average household size was 2.17 and the average family size was 3.00
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: for every 100 females there were 111.8 males

lines.value: for every 100 females age 18 and over there were 113.1 males
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2010 the median income for a household in the city was $49818 and the median income for a family was $59238
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: the per capita income for the city was $35828
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 13.1% of families and 18.2% of the population were below the poverty line including 30.3% of those under age 18 and 12.5% of those aged 65 or over
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 21.3% of the city's population was foreign born
lines.name: English

lines.value: of foreign born residents 69.6% were born in latin america and 15.3% were born in europe with smaller percentages from north america africa asia and oceania
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2000 fort lauderdale had the twenty sixth highest percentage of haitian residents in the us at 6.9% of the city's population and the 127th highest percentage of cuban residents at 1.7% of the city's residents
lines.name: English

lines.value: like south florida in general fort lauderdale has many residents who can speak languages other than english although its proportion is lower than the county average
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2000 75.63% of the population spoke only english at home while 24.37% spoke other first languages
lines.name: English

lines.value: speakers of spanish were 9.43% french creole mostly haitian creole 7.52% french 2.04% portuguese 1.02% italian 0.82% and german at 0.80%
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city along with adjacent small cities oakland park and wilton manors is known for its large lgbt community and has one of the highest ratios of gay men and lesbians with gay men being more largely present in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city is also known as a popular vacation spot for gays and lesbians with many lgbt or lgbt friendly hotels and guesthouses
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale hosts the stonewall library & archives and in neighboring wilton manors there is a large lgbt community center the pride center and the world aids museum and educational center
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale's economy has diversified over time
lines.name: English

lines.value: from the 1940s through the 1980s the city was known as a spring break destination for college students
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the college crowd has since dwindled with the city now attracting wealthier tourists
lines.name: English

lines.value: cruise ships and nautical recreation provide the basis for much of the revenue raised by tourism
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a convention center located west of the beach and southeast of downtown with of space including a main exhibit hall
lines.name: English

lines.value: approximately 30% of the city's 10 million annual visitors attend conventions at the center
lines.name: English

lines.value: the downtown area especially around las olas boulevard first underwent redevelopment starting in 2002 and now hosts many new hotels and high rise condominium developments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the downtown area is the largest in broward county although there are other cities in the county with commercial centers
lines.name: English

lines.value: office buildings and highrises include las olas river house las olas grand 110 tower formerly autonation tower bank of america plaza one financial plaza broward financial center one east broward boulevard barnett bank plaza pnc center new river center one corporate center suntrust centre 101 tower and southtrust tower
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fort lauderdale metropolitan area foreclosures increased 127.4% from 2006 to 2007 or one filing per 48 households in the quarter
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale ranks fourth in the list of top 10 metropolitan areas ranked by foreclosure filings per household for the third quarter of 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale is a major manufacturing and maintenance center for yachts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the boating industry is responsible for over 109000 jobs in the county
lines.name: English

lines.value: with its many canals and proximity to the bahamas and caribbean it is also a popular yachting vacation stop and home port for 42000 boats and approximately 100 marinas and boatyards
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally the annual fort lauderdale international boat show the world's largest boat show brings over 125000 people to the city each year
lines.name: English

lines.value: companies based in the fort lauderdale area include autonation citrix systems dhl express spirit airlines and national beverage corporation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the largest employers in the county are tenet healthcare which employs 5000 people american express which employs 4200 firstservice residential which employs 3900 motorola which employs 3000 and maxim integrated products which employs 2000
lines.name: English

lines.value: gulfstream international airlines a commuter airline is headquartered in nearby dania beach
lines.name: English

lines.value: an online trading academy center is also located in the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale was recently listed as 2017's third best city out of 150 us cities by wallethub for summer jobs and the 24th best city to start a career in
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale has a commission manager form of government
lines.name: English

lines.value: city policy is set by a city commission of five elected members the mayor and four district commission members
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1998 the municipal code was amended to limit the mayoral term
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mayor of fort lauderdale now serves a three year term and cannot serve more than three consecutive terms
lines.name: English

lines.value: the current mayor is john p jack seiler
lines.name: English

lines.value: he succeeds the longest serving mayor jim naugle 1991-2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: administrative functions are performed by a city manager who is appointed by the city commission
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale fire rescue department provides fire and emergency medical services
lines.name: English

lines.value: the united states postal service operates post offices in fort lauderdale
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fort lauderdale main post office is located at 1900 west oakland park boulevard in the city of oakland park
lines.name: English

lines.value: post offices within the city limits include alridge colee coral ridge gateway station melrose vista and southside station
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to 2000 census data 79.0% of the city's population aged 25 or older were high school graduates slightly below the national figure of 80.4%
lines.name: English

lines.value: 27.9% held at least a baccalaureate slightly higher than the national figure of 24.4%
lines.name: English

lines.value: broward county public schools operates 23 public schools in fort lauderdale
lines.name: English

lines.value: 2007 florida comprehensive assessment test fcat results for fort lauderdale's public schools were mixed while ten of sixteen elementary schools and one of four middle schools received a or b grades sunland park elementary school and arthur ashe middle school received failing grades
lines.name: English

lines.value: boyd anderson high school which is located in lauderdale lakes but whose attendance zone includes part of fort lauderdale also received a failing grade
lines.name: English

lines.value: none of the three failing schools have failed twice in a four year period thus triggering the opportunity scholarship program school choice provisions of the florida's education plan
lines.name: English

lines.value: nine institutions of higher learning have main or satellite campuses in the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: local bus transportation is provided by broward county transit bct the county bus system
lines.name: English

lines.value: bct provides for connections with the bus systems in other parts of the metropolitan area metrobus in dade county and palm tran in palm beach county
lines.name: English

lines.value: tri rail a commuter rail system connects the major cities and airports of south florida
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 2006 broward county voters rejected a one cent per hundred sales tax increase intended to fund transportation projects such as light rail and expansion of the bus system
lines.name: English

lines.value: four railroads serve fort lauderdale
lines.name: English

lines.value: florida east coast railroad fec and csx transportation are freight lines amtrak provides passenger service to other cities on the atlantic coast via the fort lauderdale station and tri rail provides commuter service between palm beach county broward county including two stations in fort lauderdale and miami dade county
lines.name: English

lines.value: all aboard florida is constructing a new station in downtown fort lauderdale for its brightline rail service connecting miami and orlando florida
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wave streetcar a new electric streetcar system costing $125 million is being planned for the downtown
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of the construction funding will come from federal $62.5 million state $37 million and city taxpayers $10.5 million with approximately $15 million from assessments on properties located within the downtown development authority
lines.name: English

lines.value: broward county bct has committed to operating the system for the first 10 years at an expected annual cost of $2 million and has guaranteed funding to cover any shortfall in ridership revenues
lines.name: English

lines.value: the construction cost of $50 million per mile is considerably higher than other recently built streetcar projects in part due to the challenges of building an electric transit system over the 3rd avenue drawbridge
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale hollywood international airport near dania beach florida is the city's main airport and is the fastest growing major airport in the country
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is in part attributable to service by low cost carriers such as spirit airlines jetblue airways southwest airlines and virgin america resulting in lower airfares than nearby miami international airport
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale hollywood is an emerging international gateway for the caribbean and latin america
lines.name: English

lines.value: miami international airport and palm beach international airport also serve the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale is home to port everglades the nation's third busiest cruise port
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is florida's deepest port and is an integral petroleum receiving point
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale is served by a regular international passenger ferry service to freeport grand bahama island bahamas operated by balearia bahamas express
lines.name: English

lines.value: broward county is served by three major interstate highways i-75 i 95 i 595 and us highways such as us 1 us 27 and us 441
lines.name: English

lines.value: the interchange between i 95 and i 595/sr 862 is known as the rainbow interchange
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also served by florida's turnpike and state highway 869 also known as the sawgrass expressway
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale is served by broward general medical center and imperial point medical center which are operated by broward health the third largest hospital consortium in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: broward general is a 716-bed acute care facility which is designated as a level i trauma center
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also home to chris evert children's hospital and a heart center of excellence
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hospital serves as a major training site for medical students from nova southeastern university's college of osteopathic medicine as well as nursing and paramedic programs from throughout the area
lines.name: English

lines.value: imperial point medical center is a 204-bed facility with a hyperbaric medicine program
lines.name: English

lines.value: holy cross hospital a 571-bed hospital operated by the sisters of mercy was named by healthgrades as one of the 50 best hospitals in the country for 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale is served by english language newspapers south florida sun sentinel and the miami herald spanish language newspapers el sentinel el nuevo herald and an alternative newspaper new times broward palm beach
lines.name: English

lines.value: as is true of many parts of florida the city's population has a strong seasonal variation as snowbirds from the northern united states canada and europe spend the winter and early spring in florida
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city is known for its beaches bars nightclubs and history as a spring break location back in the 1960s and 1970s for tens of thousands of college students
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the city has actively discouraged college students from visiting the area since the mid 1980s passing strict laws aimed at preventing the mayhem that occurred in the 1970s and 1980s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city had an estimated 350000 college visitors for spring break 1985 by 1989 that number had declined to about 20000
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the 1990s fort lauderdale has increasingly become a location that caters to those seeking the resort lifestyle seasonally or year round and is often a host city to many professional venues concerts and art shows
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort lauderdale's arts and entertainment district otherwise known as the riverwalk arts & entertainment district runs east west along las olas boulevard from the beach to the heart of downtown
lines.name: English

lines.value: the district is anchored in the west by the broward center for the performing arts and runs through the city to the intersection of las olas and a1a
lines.name: English

lines.value: colubridae from latin coluber snake is a family of snakes
lines.name: English

lines.value: with 304 genera and 1938 species it is the largest snake family and include about two thirds of all known living snake species
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earliest species of the family date back to the oligocene epoch
lines.name: English

lines.value: colubrid species are found on every continent except antarctica
lines.name: English

lines.value: while most colubrids are not venomous or have venom that is not known to be harmful to humans and are mostly harmless a few groups such as genus boiga can produce medically significant bites while the boomslang the twig snakes and the asian genus rhabdophis have caused human fatalities
lines.name: English

lines.value: some colubrids are described as opisthoglyphous meaning they have elongated grooved teeth located in the back of the upper jaw
lines.name: English

lines.value: the opisthoglyphous dentition appears at least twice in the history of snakes
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are unlike those of vipers and elapids which are located in the front
lines.name: English

lines.value: the colubridae as traditionally defined are not a natural group as many are more closely related to other groups such as elapids than to each other
lines.name: English

lines.value: this family has classically been a garbage bin taxon for snakes that do not fit elsewhere
lines.name: English

lines.value: additional research will be necessary to sort out the relations within this group
lines.name: English

lines.value: subfamily boodontinae some of which now treated as subfamily grayiinae of the new colubridae others moved to family lamprophiidae as subfamilies lamprophiinae and pseudaspidinae subfamily dipsadinae which some authors rank as family dipsadidae with subfamilies dipsadinae and xenodontinae subfamily natricinae which some authors rank as family natricidae about 30 genera subfamily psammophiinae now a subfamily of lamprophiidae subfamily xenoderminae now family xenodermidae sometimes incorrectly spelled xenodermatidae incertae sedis
lines.name: English

lines.value: pixilation from pixilated is a stop motion technique where live actors are used as a frame by frame subject in an animated film by repeatedly posing while one or more frame is taken and changing pose slightly before the next frame or frames
lines.name: English

lines.value: the actor becomes a kind of living stop motion puppet
lines.name: English

lines.value: this technique is often used as a way to blend live actors with animated ones in a movie such as in the secret adventures of tom thumb by the bolex brothers
lines.name: English

lines.value: early examples of this technique are el hotel electrico from 1908 and emile cohl's 1911 movie jobard ne peut pas voir les femmes travailler jobard cannot see the women working
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term is widely credited to grant munro although some say it was mclaren and he made an experimental movie named pixillation available in his dvd collection cut up - the films of grant munro
lines.name: English

lines.value: consolation prizes by phoenix long gone by fat city reprise heard em say by kanye west her morning elegance by oren lavie hello again by the cars in your arms by kina grannis paralyzed by the used point of no return by nu shooz road to nowhere by talking heads sledgehammer by peter gabriel shopping trolley by beth orton the box by orbital the end of the world by the cure the hardest button to button by the white stripes there there by radiohead time won't let me go by the bravery vermilion by slipknot sex machine by the fat boys last dance by george clinton strawberry swing by coldplay every teardrop is a waterfall by coldplay fix by jean paul de roover les tartines by sttellla now you see her by crash test dummies be near me by abc ma che discorsi by daniele silvestri end love by ok go lame claim to fame by weird al yankovic all the way to heaven by doug e fresh and the get fresh crew is that it by katrina & the waves quebec band les colocs and michel gondry used pixilation in many of their music videos
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pixilation technique was also used for the opening of claymation will vinton's 1978 17-minute documentary about his animation studio's production techniques the first time the famous trademarked claymation term was used now a term synonymous with all clay animation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the czech animator jan svankmajer uses pixilation in most of his work most notably food
lines.name: English

lines.value: jan kounen's gisele kerozene 1989 a short film that shows witches riding around a city on broomsticks is another influential example of this technique
lines.name: English

lines.value: a recent example of the technique is the stephen malkmus video clip baby c'mon pixilation is also used in andrew huang's short video fluxis
lines.name: English

lines.value: an effect similar to pixilation can be achieved by dropping occasional frames from a conventionally recorded movie
lines.name: English

lines.value: while obviously easier than the stop frame technique this does not achieve the same quality
