lines.value: a snowmobile also known as a motor sled motor sledge or snowmachine is a motorized vehicle designed for winter travel and recreation on snow
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is designed to be operated on snow and ice and does not require a road or trail but most are driven on open terrain or trails
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiling is a sport that many people have taken on as a serious hobby
lines.name: English

lines.value: older snowmobiles could generally accommodate two people however most snowmobiles manufactured in the last twenty five years have been designed for a single rider
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiles built with the ability to carry two riders are referred to as 2-up snowmobiles or touring models and make up an extremely small share of the market
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiles do not have any enclosures except for a windshield and their engines normally drive a continuous track at the rear
lines.name: English

lines.value: skis at the front provide directional control
lines.name: English

lines.value: early snowmobiles used rubber tracks but modern snowmobiles tracks are typically made of a kevlar composite
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally snowmobiles were powered by two stroke gasoline internal combustion engines and since the mid 2000s four stroke engines have also entered the market
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second half of the 20th century saw the rise of recreational snowmobiling whose riders are called snowmobilers or sledders
lines.name: English

lines.value: recreational riding is known as snowcross racing trail riding freestyle mountain climbing boondocking carving ditchbanging and grass drags
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the summertime snowmobilers can drag race on grass asphalt strips or even across water see snowmobile skipping
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiles are sometimes modified to compete in long distance off road races
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1911 a 24 year old harold j kalenze pronounced collins patented the vehicle propeller in brandon manitoba canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1915 ray h muscott of waters michigan received the canadian patent for his motor sleigh or traineau automobile and on june 27 1916 he received the first united states patent for a snow vehicle using the now recognized format of rear track(s and front skis
lines.name: English

lines.value: many individuals later modified ford model ts with the undercarriage replaced by tracks and skis following this design
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were popular for rural mail delivery for a time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the common name for these conversion of cars and small trucks was snowflyers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the challenges of cross country transportation in the winter led to the invention of the snowmobile an all terrain vehicle specifically designed for travel across deep snow where other vehicles floundered
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 20th century rapidly evolving designs produced machines that were two person tracked vehicles powered by gas engines that enabled them to tow a sled or travel initially at low to moderate speeds depending on snow conditions terrain and obstacles protruding above the snow like brush and trees
lines.name: English

lines.value: where early designs had 10 hp two stroke engines there has been a move toward newer style two and four stroke gasoline engines some with over
lines.name: English

lines.value: the origin of the snowmobile is not the work of any one inventor but more a process of advances in engines for the propulsion of vehicles and supporting devices over snow
lines.name: English

lines.value: it parallels the development of the automobile and later aviation often inventors using the same components for a different use
lines.name: English

lines.value: wisconsinites experimented with over snow vehicles before 1900 experimenting with bicycles equipped with runners and gripping fins steam propelled sleighs and later model t fords converted with rear tractor treads and skis in front
lines.name: English

lines.value: a patent 554.482 for the sled propeller design without a model was submitted on sept 5 1895 by inventors william j culman and william b follis of brule wisconsin
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the first races held near three lakes in 1926 104 of these snowbuggies started
lines.name: English

lines.value: carl eliason of sayner developed the prototype of the modern snowmobile in the 1920s when he mounted a two cylinder motorcycle engine on a long sled steered it with skis under the front and propelled it with single endless track
lines.name: English

lines.value: eliason made 40 snowmobiles patented in 1927
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon receiving an order for 200 from finland he sold his patent to the fwd company of clintonville
lines.name: English

lines.value: they made 300 for military use then transferred the patent to a canadian subsidiary
lines.name: English

lines.value: the american motor sleigh was a short lived novelty vehicle produced in boston in 1905
lines.name: English

lines.value: designed for travel on snow it consisted of a sleigh body mounted on a framework that held an engine a drive shaft system and runners
lines.name: English

lines.value: although considered an interesting novelty sales were low and production ceased in 1906
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aerosani propeller driven and running on skis was built in 1909 1910 by russian inventor igor sikorsky of helicopter fame
lines.name: English

lines.value: aerosanis were used by the soviet red army during the winter war and world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is some dispute over whether aerosanis count as snowmobiles because they were not propelled by tracks
lines.name: English

lines.value: adolphe kegresse designed an original caterpillar tracks system called the kegresse track while working for tsar nicholas ii of russia between 1906 and 1916
lines.name: English

lines.value: these used a flexible belt rather than interlocking metal segments and could be fitted to a conventional car or truck to turn it into a half track suitable for use over soft ground including snow
lines.name: English

lines.value: conventional front wheels and steering were used but the wheel could be fitted with skis as seen in the upper right image
lines.name: English

lines.value: he applied it to several cars in the royal garage including rolls royce cars and packard trucks
lines.name: English

lines.value: although this was not a snowmobile it is an ancestor of the modern concept
lines.name: English

lines.value: the relatively dry snow conditions of the united states midwest suited the converted ford model ts and other like vehicles but they were not suitable for humid snow areas such as southern quebec and new england
lines.name: English

lines.value: this led joseph armand bombardier from the small town of valcourt quebec to invent a different caterpillar track system suitable for all kinds of snow conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: bombardier had already made some metal tracked vehicles since 1928 but his new revolutionary track traction system a toothed wheel covered in rubber and a rubber and cotton track that wraps around the back wheels was his first major invention
lines.name: English

lines.value: he started production of the b 7 an enclosed seven passenger snowmobile in 1937 and introduced the b 12 a twelve passenger model in 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: the b 7 had a v 8 flathead engine from ford motor company
lines.name: English

lines.value: the b 12 had a flathead in line six cylinder engine from chrysler industrial and 2817 units were produced until 1951
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was used in many applications such as ambulances canada post vehicles winter school buses forestry machines and even army vehicles in world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: bombardier had always dreamed of a smaller version more like the size of a motor scooter
lines.name: English

lines.value: numerous people had ideas for a smaller personal snowmobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1914 o m erickson and art olsen of the pn bushnell company in aberdeen south dakota built an open two seater motor bob out of an indian motorcycle modified with a cowl cover side by side seating and a set of sled runners fore and aft
lines.name: English

lines.value: while it did not have the tracks of a true snowmobile its appearance was otherwise similar to the modern version and is one of the earliest examples of a personal motorized snow vehicle
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1951 dr fritz riemerschmid devised what he called a snow scooter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the machine had a track mounted beneath a snowboard like base on top of which were an enclosed engine with motorcycle like seat and fuel tank
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vehicle was steered via a steering wheel and cables linked to two small skis on outriggers either side of the vehicle
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the mid 1950s a united states firm built a snowmobile the arctic area of alaska that had the drive train reversed of today's snowmobiles with two front wheels—the larger one behind the smaller one—with tires driving an endless loop track
lines.name: English

lines.value: little is known about this snowmobile meant to haul cargo and trade goods to isolated settlements
lines.name: English

lines.value: edgar and allen hetteen and david johnson of roseau minnesota were among the first to build a practical snowmobile in 1955 1956 but the early machines were heavy () and slow ().
lines.name: English

lines.value: their company hetteen hoist & derrick co became polaris industries
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was only in 1960 when engines became lighter and smaller than before that joseph armand bombardier invented what we now know as the modern snowmobile in its open cockpit one or two person form and started selling it under the brand name ski doo through his company bombardier inc now manufactured by bombardier recreational products
lines.name: English

lines.value: competitors copied and improved his design in the 1970s there were over a hundred snowmobile manufacturers
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1970 to 1973 two million machines were sold peaking at 500000 sold in 1971
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the snowmobile companies were small and the biggest manufacturers were often attempts by motorcycle makers and outboard motor makers to branch off in a new market
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of these companies went bankrupt or were acquired by larger companies during the 1973 oil crisis and succeeding recessions
lines.name: English

lines.value: sales rebounded to 260000 in 1997 but gradually decreased afterwards influenced by warmer winters and the use during all four seasons of small one or two person atvs
lines.name: English

lines.value: alpina snowmobiles are manufactured in vicenza italy by alpina s.r.l a manufacturer of various on snow implements that had been building dual track snowmobiles since 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are two manufacturers of dual track snowmobiles
lines.name: English

lines.value: one is alpina and the other is a russian sled called buran bombardier discontinued manufacturing its dual track model the elite in 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: ;models alpina manufactures one basic dual track snowmobile design
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2002 the sherpa was introduced and is the model name for the four stroke machine
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to introducing the sherpa alpina offered a two stroke series designated the superclass
lines.name: English

lines.value: the four stroke sherpa is currently the top machine in production
lines.name: English

lines.value: a new version of the superclass has been released in 2017 with a lot of innovations and a new four stroke engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sherpa and superclass series shared the same basic dual track platform twin tracks with dual skis up front
lines.name: English

lines.value: power for the sherpa is supplied by a 1.6l in line four cylinder gasoline automotive engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new superclass power is provided by a 1.2l 3-cylinder four stroke gasoline engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: ;features the sherpa and superclass are designed as working snowmobiles for carrying supplies pulling cargo sleds pulling trail grooming implements carrying several passengers and negotiating deep snow
lines.name: English

lines.value: engine and transmission combination are designed to deliver optimum power to pull or carry large loads while top end speeds are kept below depending on the model
lines.name: English

lines.value: the large footprint of the dual tracks and dual skis allows the sherpa and superclass to float on top of deep snow and not sink in and get stuck
lines.name: English

lines.value: , the snowmobile market has been shared between the four large north american makers bombardier recreational products brp arctic cat yamaha and polaris and some specialized makers like the quebec based ad boivin manufacturer of the snow hawk and the european alpina snowmobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: higher powered modern snowmobiles can achieve speeds in excess of
lines.name: English

lines.value: drag racing snowmobiles can reach speeds in excess of
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiles are widely used in arctic territories for travel
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the small arctic population means a correspondingly small market
lines.name: English

lines.value: most snowmobiles are sold for recreational purposes in places where snow cover is stable during winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the number of snowmobiles in europe and other parts of the world is low but growing
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiles designed to perform various work tasks have been available for many years with dual tracks from such manufacturers as aktiv sweden who made the grizzly ockelbo sweden who made the 8000 and bombardier who made the alpine and later the alpine ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: currently there are two manufacturers of dual track snowmobiles russia's buran and the italian alpina snowmobiles under the name sherpa and superclass
lines.name: English

lines.value: an odd version of snowmobile is the swedish larven made by the lenko company of ostersund from the 1960s until the end of the 1980s
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was a very small and basic design with just an engine in the rear and a track
lines.name: English

lines.value: the driver sat on it and steered using skis on his feet
lines.name: English

lines.value: all modern snowmobiles are powered by either a four or two stroke internal combustion engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: historically snowmobiles have always used two stroke engines because of their reduced complexity weight and cost compared to a similarly powered four stroke
lines.name: English

lines.value: however four stroke powered snowmobiles have been gaining popularity steadily in the last fifteen or so years with manufacturer yamaha producing four stroke snowmobiles only
lines.name: English

lines.value: the whistler blackcomb ski resort is testing electric snowmobiles with lower noise and shorter range and similar vehicles exist
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first snowmobiles made do with as little as 5 hp engines but engine sizes and efficiency have improved drastically
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early 1990s the biggest engines available typically 600cc-800cc displacement range produced around
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2010 several snowmobiles are available with engines sizes up to 1200 cc producing 150+ hp as well as several models with up to 1000 cc engines producing closer to
lines.name: English

lines.value: recently some models are turbo charged resulting in dramatic increase of engine horsepower
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiles are capable of moving across steep hillsides without sliding down slope if the rider transfers their weight towards the uphill side a process called side hilling
lines.name: English

lines.value: mountain sleds permit access in remote areas with deep snow which was nearly impossible a few decades ago
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is mainly due to alterations enhancements and additions of original trail model designs such as weight weight distribution track length paddle depth and power
lines.name: English

lines.value: technology and design advances in mountain snowmobiles have improved since 2003 with ski doo's introduction of the rev framework platform
lines.name: English

lines.value: most two stroke mountain snowmobiles have a top engine size of 800 cc producing around although some 1000 cc factory machines have been produced
lines.name: English

lines.value: these may not be as popular as many 800 cc models outperform them because of weight and an increase of unneeded power
lines.name: English

lines.value: cornices and other kinds of jumps are sought after for aerial maneuvers
lines.name: English

lines.value: riders often search for non tracked virgin terrain and are known to trailblaze or boondock deep into remote territory where there is absolutely no visible path to follow
lines.name: English

lines.value: however this type of trailblazing is dangerous as contact with buried rocks logs and frozen ground can cause extensive damage and injuries
lines.name: English

lines.value: riders look for large open fields of fresh snow where they can carve
lines.name: English

lines.value: some riders use extensively modified snowmobiles customized with aftermarket accessories like handle bar risers handguards custom lightweight hoods windshields and seats running board supports studs and numerous other modifications that increase power and maneuverability
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of these customizations can now be purchased straight off the showroom floor on stock models
lines.name: English

lines.value: trail snowmobiles improved in the past 15 years as well many of them borrowed from endeavors to produce winning mountain sleds
lines.name: English

lines.value: heavy muscle sleds can produce speeds in excess of due to powerful engines up to 1200 cc stock and custom engines exceeding 1200 cc short tracks and good traction on groomed trails
lines.name: English

lines.value: sno cross oriented snowmobiles often have an engine size cap of 440 or 600 cc but lighter machines with redesigned stances formats and weight control have produced extremely fast and quickly accelerating race sleds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the environmental impact of snowmobiles has been the subject of much debate
lines.name: English

lines.value: governments have been reacting slowly to noise and air pollution partly because of lobbying from manufacturers and snowmobilers
lines.name: English

lines.value: for instance in 1999 the canadian government adopted the canadian environmental protection act 1999 but the set of rules governing pollution emissions for off road vehicles was only released in january 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: in another example of regulation only four stroke snowmobiles are allowed in yellowstone national park since a bylaw was recently passed to minimize co 2 emissions and noise
lines.name: English

lines.value: in yellowstone snowmobiles account for 80% of total hydrocarbon emissions and 50% of carbon monoxide emissions in the winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is just less than 2% and 1% respectively of the overall annual pollution within the park
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiles are only allowed to be ridden on the unplowed roads used in the summer and riding off the roads is prohibited
lines.name: English

lines.value: this accounts for less than 1% 0.002% of the park area
lines.name: English

lines.value: most snowmobiles are still powered by two stroke engines although alpina and yamaha have been using four strokes since 2002 and 2003 respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in the last decade several manufacturers have been successful in designing less polluting motors and putting most of them in production
lines.name: English

lines.value: yamaha and arctic cat were the first to mass produce four stroke models which are significantly less polluting than the early two stroke machines
lines.name: English

lines.value: alpina offers only four stroke efi engines equipped with a catalytic converter and dual oxygen probe
lines.name: English

lines.value: bombardier's e tec two stroke motors emit 85% less pollutants than previous carbureted two strokes
lines.name: English

lines.value: polaris has developed a fuel injection technology called cleanfire injection on their two strokes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the industry is also working on a direct injected clean two strokes that is better in terms of no x emissions
lines.name: English

lines.value: independent researchers undergraduates and graduate students participate in contests to lessen the impact of emissions from snowmobiles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the clean snow mobile challenge is held yearly at michigan technological university regrouping the entries from universities from across united states and canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the participants in recent years have been the ecole polytechnique de montreal with a quasiturbine engine and students from ecole de technologie superieure of the uqam with a less polluting two stroke engine using e85 and direct injection
lines.name: English

lines.value: maximum noise restrictions have been enacted by law for both production of snowmobiles and aftermarket components
lines.name: English

lines.value: for instance in quebec canada noise levels must be 78 decibels or less at 20 meters from a snowmobile path
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2009 snowmobiles produce 90% less noise than in the 1960s but there are still numerous complaints
lines.name: English

lines.value: efforts to reduce noise focus on suppressing mechanical noise of the suspension components and tracks
lines.name: English

lines.value: arctic cat in 2005 introduced silent track technology on touring models such as the t660 turbo bearcat and some m series sleds
lines.name: English

lines.value: ski doo has since then also used comparative silent track technology on some models
lines.name: English

lines.value: the use of aftermarket exhaust systems cans or silencers is controversial
lines.name: English

lines.value: these replace the stock muffler with a less restrictive system that is usually claimed to increase power output of the engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: however these aftermarket exhausts are often much louder than those from the factory with only some being slightly quieter than a completely open unbaffled system
lines.name: English

lines.value: most if not all local snowmobile clubs that maintain and groom trail systems do not recommend them because of noise
lines.name: English

lines.value: local and state authorities have set up checkpoints on high traffic trails checking for excessively loud systems and issuing citations
lines.name: English

lines.value: typically these systems are installed on two stroke powered machines giving the distinctive braap sound however in recent years aftermarket companies have released silencers for four stroke models as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the invention of snowmobiles isolated communities of northern north america have always had a demand for them
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the early snowmobiles designs were not economical or functional enough for the harsh environment of northern north america
lines.name: English

lines.value: joseph armand bombardier started producing the ski doo in 1959 at the request of a priest
lines.name: English

lines.value: the priest had asked bombardier to make an economical and reliable means of winter travel
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ski doo greatly changed life in northern north america's isolated communities where ski doo replaced sled dogs by the end of the 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ski doo also greatly improved communication between isolated communities
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobiles are also called snow machines in some areas of alaska
lines.name: English

lines.value: in northern north america historically isolated communities depended on dog sledding and snowshoeing as their primary method of transportation for hunting during the winter months
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ski doo allowed trappers to travel greater distances faster allowing them to expand their hunting grounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: prospectors mining companies foresters backcountry cabin owners the royal canadian mounted police and canadian army also found snowmobiles very effective because they were the most economical method of transportation of small loads
lines.name: English

lines.value: joseph armand bombardier's tests of ski dog proved that snowmobiling was fun and snowmobiling became a new form of outdoor recreation
lines.name: English

lines.value: people who once sat dormant throughout winter were now given the opportunity in more outdoor activities
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the international snowmobile manufacturers association snowmobilers in canada and the united states spend over $28 billion on snowmobiling each year
lines.name: English

lines.value: this includes expenditures on equipment clothing accessories snowmobiling vacations lodging fuel and food maintenance and others
lines.name: English

lines.value: often this is the only source of income for some smaller towns such as bralorne british columbia that rely solely on tourism during the summer and winter months
lines.name: English

lines.value: once a booming gold mining town bralorne is now a very small town with a population of 60 and it is relatively inaccessible by car in the winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the economy relies on visits from snowmobilers who contribute to the economy by spending money on gas food and hotels
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result of their inherent maneuverability acceleration and high speed abilities both skill and physical strength are required to operate a snowmobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: snowmobile injuries and fatalities are high compared to those caused by on road motor vehicle traffic
lines.name: English

lines.value: losing control of a snowmobile could easily cause extensive damage injury or death
lines.name: English

lines.value: one such cause of snowmobile accidents is loss of control from a loose grip
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the rider falls off the loss of control can easily result in the snowmobile colliding with a nearby object such as a rock or tree
lines.name: English

lines.value: most snowmobiles are fitted with a cord connected to a kill switch which would stop the snowmobile if the rider falls off however not all riders use this device every time they operate a snowmobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: swerving off of the path may result in rolling the snowmobile or crashing into an obstacle
lines.name: English

lines.value: in unfamiliar areas riders may crash into suspended barbed wire or haywire fences at high speeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: each year a number of serious or fatal accidents are caused by these factors
lines.name: English

lines.value: each year riders are killed by hitting other snowmobiles automobiles pedestrians rocks trees or fences or falling through thin ice
lines.name: English

lines.value: on average 10 people a year have died in such crashes in minnesota alone with alcohol a contributing factor in many cases
lines.name: English

lines.value: in saskatchewan 16 out of 21 deaths in snowmobile collisions between 1996 and 2000 were caused by the effects of alcohol
lines.name: English

lines.value: wrestler lindsey durlacher died in 2011 following surgery for a broken sternum he sustained in a snowmobile accident
lines.name: English

lines.value: fatal collisions with trains can also occur when a snowmobile operator engages in the illegal practice of rail riding riding between railroad track rails over snow covered sleepers
lines.name: English

lines.value: inability to hear the sound of an oncoming train over the engine noise of a snowmobile makes this activity extremely dangerous
lines.name: English

lines.value: collision with large animals such as moose and deer which may venture onto a snowmobile trail is another major cause of snowmobile accidents
lines.name: English

lines.value: most often such encounters occur at night or in low visibility conditions when the animal could not be seen in time to prevent a collision
lines.name: English

lines.value: also even when successful a sudden maneuver to miss hitting the animal could still result in the operator losing control of the snowmobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: a large number of snowmobile deaths in alaska are caused by drowning
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of the cold weather in many parts of alaska the rivers and lakes are generally frozen over during certain times of the year in winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: people who ride early or late in the season run the risk of falling through weak ice and heavy winter clothing can make it extremely difficult to escape the frozen water
lines.name: English

lines.value: while a snowmobile is heavy it also distributes its weight at a larger area than a standing person so a driver who has stopped his vehicle out on the ice of a frozen lake can go through the ice just by stepping off the snowmobile
lines.name: English

lines.value: the next leading cause of injury and death is avalanches which can result from the practice of highmarking or driving a snowmobile as far up a hill as it can go
lines.name: English

lines.value: risks can be reduced through education proper training appropriate gear and attention to published avalanche warnings
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some areas of western us organizations provide avalanche training some of which is free
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is recommended that snowmobile riders wear a helmet and a snowmobile suit
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sarangi ( hindi  punjabi  nepali  ) is a bowed short necked string instrument from india as well as nepal and pakistan which is used in hindustani classical music
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the most popular musical instrument in the western part of nepal and is said to most resemble the sound of the human voice - able to imitate vocal ornaments such as gamaks shakes and meends sliding movements
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to some musicians the word sarangi is a combination of two words seh'(persian equivalent of three and rangi persian equivalent of coloured corrupted as sarangi
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term seh rangi represents the three melody strings
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the most common folk etymology is that sarangi is derived from sol rang a hundred colours indicating its adaptability to many styles of vocal music its flexible tunability and its ability to produce a large palette of tonal colour and emotional nuance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the repertoire of sarangi players is traditionally very closely related to vocal music
lines.name: English

lines.value: nevertheless a concert with a solo sarangi as the main item will sometimes include a full scale raag presentation with an extensive alap the unmeasured improvisatory development of the raga in increasing intensity alap-jor-jhala and several compositions in increasing tempo called bandish
lines.name: English

lines.value: as such it could be seen as being on a par with other instrumental styles such as sitar sarod and bansuri
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is rare to find a sarangi player who does not know the words of many classical compositions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the words are usually mentally present during the performance and a performance almost always adheres to the conventions of vocal performances including the organisational structure the types of elaboration the tempo the relationship between sound and silence and the presentation of khyal and thumri compositions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vocal quality of sarangi is in a separate category from for instance the so called gayaki ang of sitar which attempts to imitate the nuances of khyal while overall conforming to the structures and usually keeping to the gat compositions of instrumental music
lines.name: English

lines.value: a gat is a composition set to a cyclic rhythm the nepali sarang i is also a traditional stringed musical instrument of nepal commonly played by the gaine or gandarbha ethnic group but the form and repertoire of sarangi is more towards the folk music as compared to the heavy and classical form of the repertoire in india
lines.name: English

lines.value: carved from a single block of tun red cedar wood the sarangi has a box like shape with three hollow chambers pet stomach chaati chest and magaj brain
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is usually around 2 ft long and around 6 in wide though it can vary as there are smaller as well as larger variant sarangis as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lower resonance chamber or pet is covered with parchment made out of goat skin on which a strip of thick leather is placed around the waist and nailed on the back of the chamber which supports the elephant shaped bridge that is made of camel or buffalo bone usually made of ivory or barasingha bone originally but now that is rare due to the ban in india
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bridge in turn supports the huge pressure of approximately 35 37 sympathetic steel or brass strings and three main gut strings that pass through it
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three main playing strings - the comparatively thicker gut strings - are bowed with a heavy horsehair bow and stopped not with the finger tips but with the nails cuticles and surrounding flesh
lines.name: English

lines.value: talcum powder is applied to the fingers as a lubricant
lines.name: English

lines.value: the neck has ivory bone platforms on which the fingers slide
lines.name: English

lines.value: the remaining strings are resonance strings or tarabs see sympathetic strings numbering up to around 35 37 divided into 4 choirs having two sets of pegs one on the right and one on the top
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the inside is a chromatically tuned row of 15 tarabs and on the right a diatonic row of 9 tarabs each encompassing a full octave plus 1 3 extra notes above or below that
lines.name: English

lines.value: both these sets of tarabs pass from the main bridge to the right side set of pegs through small holes in the chaati supported by hollow ivory bone beads
lines.name: English

lines.value: between these inner tarabs and on the either side of the main playing strings lie two more sets of longer tarabs with 5 6 strings on the right set and 6 7 strings on the left set
lines.name: English

lines.value: they pass from the main bridge over to two small flat and wide table like bridges through the additional bridge towards the second peg set on top of the instrument
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are tuned to the important tones swaras of the raga
lines.name: English

lines.value: a properly tuned sarangi will hum and cry and will sound like melodious meowing with tones played on any of the main strings eliciting echo like resonances
lines.name: English

lines.value: a few sarangis use strings manufactured from the intestines of goats - these harken back to the days when rich musicians could afford such strings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the john llewellyn rhys prize was a literary prize awarded annually for the best work of literature fiction non fiction poetry drama by an author from the commonwealth aged 35 or under written in english and published in the united kingdom
lines.name: English

lines.value: established in 1942 it was the second oldest literary award in the uk
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 2011 the award has been suspended due to funding problems
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last award was in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: the prize was initiated in 1942 by jane oliver in memory of her husband john llewellyn rhys a young author who was killed on 5 august 1940 while serving as a bomber pilot in the royal air force
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1987 to 2003 the prize was funded by the mail on sunday
lines.name: English

lines.value: the newspaper withdrew in 2003 after the 2002 prize was awarded to mary laven
lines.name: English

lines.value: subsequently the prize was sponsored by booktrust an independent educational charity but in june 2011 the award was suspended due to funding problems
lines.name: English

lines.value: booktrust said that it strongly intended to bring the award back with a bang as soon as possible as it looked for outside funding sources
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 the winner received 5000 while the runners up each received 500
lines.name: English

lines.value: source 1942 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: source 2007 2010 *note the 2002 prize was initially awarded to hari kunzru for his book the impressionist on 20 november 2003 but the author decided to decline the award due to its sponsorship by the mail on sunday
lines.name: English

lines.value: * john llewellyn rhys prize official site at booktrust
lines.name: English

lines.value: retrieved 29 january 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: equatoria is a region of southern south sudan along the upper reaches of the white nile
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally a province of egypt it also contained most of northern parts of present day uganda including lake albert
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was an idealistic effort to create a model state in the interior of africa that never consisted of more than a handful of adventurers and soldiers in isolated outposts
lines.name: English

lines.value: equatoria was established by samuel baker in 1870
lines.name: English

lines.value: charles george gordon took over as governor in 1874 followed by emin pasha in 1878
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mahdist revolt put an end to equatoria as an egyptian outpost in 1889
lines.name: English

lines.value: later british governors included martin willoughby parr
lines.name: English

lines.value: important settlements in equatoria included lado gondokoro dufile and wadelai
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last two are in the part of equatoria that is now in uganda
lines.name: English

lines.value: under anglo egyptian sudan most of equatoria became one of the eight original provinces
lines.name: English

lines.value: the state of bahr el ghazal was split from equatoria in 1948
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1976 equatoria was further split into the states of east and west equatoria
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region has been troubled with violence during both the first and second sudanese civil wars as well as the anti ugandan insurgencies based in sudan such as the lord's resistance army and west nile bank front
lines.name: English

lines.value: the people of equatoria are traditionally peasants or nomads belonging to numerous ethnic groups
lines.name: English

lines.value: they live in the counties of budi ezo juba kajo keji kapoeta magwi maridi lainya mundri terekeka tombura torit yambio and yei
lines.name: English

lines.value: equatoria is inhabited by the ethnolinguistic groups listed below
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following tribes occupy the three states of greater equatoria acholi avokaya baka balanda bari didinga kakwa keliko kuku lango lokoya narim lopit lugbwara lulubo madi makaraka moru mundari mundu nyangbwara otuho pari pojulu tenet toposa and azande avukaya mundu
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of these tribes like bari pojulu kuku kakwa mundari and nyangbwara share a common language but their accents and some adjectives and nouns do vary the same applies to keliko moru and madi
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to the many years of the civil war the culture is heavily influenced by the countries neighboring south sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: many south sudanese fled to ethiopia kenya uganda the democratic republic of congo and central african republic where they interacted with the nationals and learnt their languages and culture
lines.name: English

lines.value: for most of those who remained in the country or went north to sudan and egypt they greatly assimilated arabic culture
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also worth noting that most south sudanese kept the core of their culture even while in exile and diaspora
lines.name: English

lines.value: traditional culture is highly upheld and a great focus is given to knowing one's origin and dialect
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the common languages spoken are arabi juba and english kiswahili is being introduced to the population to improve the country's relations with its east african neighbors
lines.name: English

lines.value: many music artists from equatoria use english kiswahili arabi juba arabic creole their language or dialect or a mix of all
lines.name: English

lines.value: popular artists sing afro beat r&b and zouk
lines.name: English

lines.value: dynamiq is popular for his reggae
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 19th century egypt had control of sudan and established the equatoria province to further control its interests over the nile river
lines.name: English

lines.value: equatoria was established by british explorer sir samuel baker in 1870
lines.name: English

lines.value: baker was sent by egyptian authorities to establish trading posts along the white nile and gondokoro gondu kuru means difficult to dig in bari a trading center located on the east bank of the white nile in southern sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: gondokoro was an important center since it was located within a few kilometres from the cutoff point of navigability of the nile from khartoum
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is presently located near the city of juba in equatoria
lines.name: English

lines.value: baker's attempt to create additional trading posts and control equatoria was unsuccessful because villages surrounding gondokoro were frequently bypassed by arab invaders who wanted to impose their culture and way of life on the people
lines.name: English

lines.value: king gbudwe who ruled western part of equatoria at the time as azande local ruler despised the arab culture and way of life and encouraged the tribes to resist the invaders and protect their african culture and their way of life
lines.name: English

lines.value: the invaders were met with such stiff resistance from equatorian tribes such as the azande bari lokoya otuho and pari
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of baker's service as governor british general charles george gordon was appointed governor of sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: gordon took over in 1874 and administered the region until 1876
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was more successful in creating additional trading posts in the area
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1876 gordon's views clashed with those of the egyptian governor of khartoum forcing him to go back to london
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1878 gordon was succeeded by the chief medical officer of the equatoria province mehemet emin popularly known as emin pasha
lines.name: English

lines.value: emin made his headquarters at lado now in south sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: emin pasha had little influence over the area because the khartoum governor was uninterested in his development proposals for the equatoria region
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1881 muhammad ahmad abdullah a muslim religious leader proclaimed himself the mahdi expected one and began a holy war to unify the tribes of western and central sudan including equatoria
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1883 the mahdists had cut off outside communications
lines.name: English

lines.value: however emin pasha managed to request assistance from britain via buganda
lines.name: English

lines.value: the british sent a relief expedition called the advance in february 1887 to rescue emin
lines.name: English

lines.value: the advance navigated up the congo river and then through the ituri forest one of the most difficult forest routes in africa resulting in the loss of two thirds of the expedition's personnel
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the advance succeeded in reaching emin pasha by february of the following year the mahdists had already overrun the bulk of the province and emin had already been deposed as governor by his officers in august 1887
lines.name: English

lines.value: the advance reached the coast with emin by the end of the year by which point the mahdists were firmly in control of equatoria
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1898 the mahdist state was overthrown by the anglo egyptian force led by british field marshal lord kitchener
lines.name: English

lines.value: sudan was proclaimed a condominium under british egyptian administration and equatoria was administered by the british
lines.name: English

lines.value: equatoria received little attention from the british prior to world war i equatoria was closed to outside influences and developed along indigenous lines
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result the region remained isolated and underdeveloped
lines.name: English

lines.value: limited social services to the region were provided by christian missionaries who opened schools and medical clinics
lines.name: English

lines.value: the education provided by the missionaries was mainly limited to learning english language and arithmetic
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february 1953 the united kingdom and egypt reached an agreement providing for sudanese self government and self determination
lines.name: English

lines.value: on january 1 1956 sudan gained independence from the british and egyptian governments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new state was under the control of the arab led khartoum government
lines.name: English

lines.value: the arab khartoum government had promised southerners full participation in the political system however after independence the khartoum government reneged on its promises
lines.name: English

lines.value: southerners were denied participation in free elections and marginalized from political power
lines.name: English

lines.value: the government actions created resentment in the south that led to a mutiny by a group of equatorians sparking the 21 year civil war 1955-1972 1983 to 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: equatorians played an instrumental role in the struggle for autonomy in south sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the origins of sudan's civil war dates back to 1955 a year before independence when it became clear the arabs were going to take over the national government in khartoum
lines.name: English

lines.value: equatorians had a military unit called equatoria corps formed during the anglo egyptian administration
lines.name: English

lines.value: on august 18 1955 members of the equatoria corps mutinied at torit eastern equatoria
lines.name: English

lines.value: the khartoum government sent military forces to quell the rebellion and many mutineers of the equatoria corps went into hiding rather than surrender to the sudanese government
lines.name: English

lines.value: this marked the beginning of the first civil war in southern sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rebellion that emerged from the equatoria corps was later called anya nya and the leaders were separatists who demanded the creation of a separate south sudan nation free from arab domination
lines.name: English

lines.value: the equatorian leaders of the anya nya and founders of the struggle were saturlino olire from acholi obbo who was the first man said to have fired a bullet and launched the start of the first civil war in torit fr
lines.name: English

lines.value: saturnino lohure from otuho aggrey jaden from pojulu joseph ohide from otuho marko rume from kuku ezboni mondiri from moru albino tombe from lokoya tafeng lodongi from otuho lazaru mutek from otuho benjamin loki from pojulu elia lupe from kakwa elia kuzee from zande;timon boro from moru dominic dabi manango from zande alison monani magaya from zande isaiah paul from zande dominic kassiano dombo from zande and many others
lines.name: English

lines.value: the khartoum government sent its forces to arrest the rebels and capture anyone who supported their cause
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the early 1960s civilians believed to be anya nya sympathizers were arrested and shipped to kodok concentration camp where they were tortured and killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the first detainees and survivors of the horrific torture at kodok include emmanuel lukudu and philip lomodong lako
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1969 the equatorian rebels found support among foreign governments and were able to obtained weapons and supplies
lines.name: English

lines.value: anya nya recruits were trained in israel where they also got some of their weapons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the anya nya rebels received financial assistance from southern sudanese and southern exiles from the middle east western europe and north america
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the late 1960s the war had resulted in the deaths of half a million people and several hundred thousand southerners escaped to hide in the forests or to refugee camps in neighboring countries
lines.name: English

lines.value: anya nya controlled the southern countryside while the government forces controlled the major towns in the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: the anya nya rebels were small in number and scattered all over the region making their operations ineffective
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is estimated that anya nya rebels ranged from 5000 to 10000 in number
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 25 1969 col gaafar muhammed nimeiri led a military coup and overthrew gen ibrahim abboud's regime
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1971 joseph lagu from the madi ethnic group became the leader of the southern forces opposed to khartoum government and founded the south sudan liberation movement sslm
lines.name: English

lines.value: anya nya leaders united and rallied behind lagu
lines.name: English

lines.value: lagu also got support for his movement from exiled southern politicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: with lagu's leadership the sslm created a governing infrastructure throughout many areas in southern sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1972 nimeri held negotiations with the anya nya at addis ababa ethiopia
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the talks the anya nya demanded a separate southern government and an army to defend the south
lines.name: English

lines.value: ethiopia's emperor haile selassie moderated the talks and helped the two sides reach an agreement
lines.name: English

lines.value: the result was the addis ababa agreement
lines.name: English

lines.value: the addis ababa accords granted autonomy for the south with three provinces equatoria bar al ghazal and upper nile
lines.name: English

lines.value: the south would have a regional president appointed by the national president to oversee all aspects of government in the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: the national government would maintain authority over defense foreign affairs currency and finance and economic and social planning and interregional concerns
lines.name: English

lines.value: the members of the anya nya would be incorporated into the sudanese army and have equal status with the northern forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: the accord declared arabic as sudan s official language and english as the south's principal language for administration and schooling
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite opposition from sslm leaders on the terms of the agreement joseph lagu approved the agreement and both sides agreed to a cease fire
lines.name: English

lines.value: the addis ababa accords were signed on march 27 1972 and the sudanese celebrated that day as national unity day
lines.name: English

lines.value: this agreement resulted in a hiatus in the sudanese civil war from 1972-1983
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1983 president gaafar nimeiry abolished parliament and embarked on an islamization campaign throughout sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: he outlawed political parties and enacted sharia law in the penal code
lines.name: English

lines.value: under sharia law non muslim southerners were forced to obey islamic laws and traditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: nimeiri's policies revived southern opposition and military insurgency in the south
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1985 abdel rahman swar al dahab led a coup and overthrew nimeiri's regime
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1986 sadiq al mahdi was elected president of sudan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new regime began negotiations led by col john garang de mabior leader of the spla but failed to reach an agreement to end the southern insurgency
lines.name: English

lines.value: civil war has continued since then but international pressure has led spla and the khartoum government to reach an agreement to end the 21-year civil war
lines.name: English

lines.value: benazir bhutto international airport (, ) is the second largest airport by air traffic in pakistan serving the capital islamabad and its twin city rawalpindi in the province of punjab
lines.name: English

lines.value: previously known as the islamabad international airport it was renamed after the late pakistani leader benazir bhutto in june 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport handled 4767860 passengers between 2015-16 compared to 3803060 in 2012-13
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport will be replaced by the new islamabad international airport on may 3 2018
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport is not located in islamabad but is instead in the area of chaklala in neighbouring rawalpindi
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the fiscal year 2008 2009 over 3136664 passengers used benazir bhutto international airport and 34025 aircraft movements were registered
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport serves as a hub for the flag carrier pakistan international airlines
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also the hub of shaheen air international and a focus city of airblue
lines.name: English

lines.value: the government recently launched a rs
lines.name: English

lines.value: 399 million project to renovate and expand the airport including the taxi way link adjacent to the lone runway of the airport
lines.name: English

lines.value: the renovation was completed by march 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: a new airport is currently under construction in fateh jang attock district approximately 20 km west of the twin cities
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is being built to replace the existing benazir bhutto international airport in response to increasing air traffic and passenger load
lines.name: English

lines.value: once completed it will be the first greenfield airport in pakistan and the first to support the landing of airbus a380
lines.name: English

lines.value: build on an area of 3289 acres the project consists of 90 check in counters and a parking facility for 2000 vehicles and will cater to upward of 10 million people every year in its first phase and up to 25 million in the second phase
lines.name: English

lines.value: the terminal includes 15 gates with ten remote gates a four star hotel duty free shops two runways six taxiways food court and 42 immigration counters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport is connected to islamabad via the kashmir highway and rawalpindi via the gt road
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 26 km six lane highway is underconstruction to further expand the connectivity of the airport
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rawalpindi islamabad metrobus is also being expanded to connect the airport with the metropolitan area
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport is expected to open for commercial flight operations on 3 may 2018
lines.name: English

lines.value: benazir bhutto international airport is a civil and military airport which handles vips as well as public scheduled operations for many airlines
lines.name: English

lines.value: foreign diplomats high level government officials as well as military officials are welcomed at this airport
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport is only able to handle eleven wide body aircraft at one time with additional five parking places for general aviation aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: it can not accommodate large aircraft such as the airbus a380 or the boeing 747-8
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport does not have any air bridges installed so buses transport the passengers from the airport terminal to the aircraft where air stairs are used
lines.name: English

lines.value: *notes : air china's flight from islamabad to beijing continues on to karachi
lines.name: English

lines.value: however air china does not have eighth freedom rights to carry passengers solely from islamabad to karachi
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the airport was built on an airbase the pakistan air force has taken ownership of the apron and old terminal building of the airfield in a similar fashion to when lahore's allama iqbal international airport moved it's terminals
lines.name: English

lines.value: the runway is expected to remain in use by the paf in the near future and vips and other dignitaries will continue to use the airbase instead of islamabad international airport
lines.name: English

lines.value: the native posix thread library nptl is an implementation of the posix threads specification for the linux operating system
lines.name: English

lines.value: before the 2.6 version of the linux kernel processes were the schedulable entities and there were no special facilities for threads
lines.name: English

lines.value: however it did have a system call - clone - which creates a copy of the calling process where the copy shares the address space of the caller
lines.name: English

lines.value: the linuxthreads project used this system call to provide kernel level threads most of the previous thread implementations in linux worked entirely in userland
lines.name: English

lines.value: unfortunately it only partially complied with posix particularly in the areas of signal handling scheduling and inter process synchronization primitives
lines.name: English

lines.value: to improve upon linuxthreads it was clear that some kernel support and a new threading library would be required
lines.name: English

lines.value: two competing projects were started to address the requirement ngpt next generation posix threads worked on by a team which included developers from ibm and nptl by developers at red hat
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ngpt team collaborated closely with the nptl team and combined the best features of both implementations into nptl
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ngpt project was subsequently abandoned in mid 2003 after merging its best features into nptl
lines.name: English

lines.value: nptl was first released in red hat linux 9
lines.name: English

lines.value: old style linux posix threading is known for having trouble with threads that refuse to yield to the system occasionally because it does not take the opportunity to preempt them when it arises something that windows was known to do better at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: red hat claimed that nptl fixed this problem in an article on the java website about java on red hat linux 9
lines.name: English

lines.value: nptl has been part of red hat enterprise linux since version 3 and in the linux kernel since version 2.6
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is now a fully integrated part of the gnu c library
lines.name: English

lines.value: there exists a tracing tool for nptl called posix thread trace tool ( ptt
lines.name: English

lines.value: and an open posix test suite ( opts was written for testing the nptl library against the posix standard
lines.name: English

lines.value: nptl uses a similar approach to linuxthreads in that the primary abstraction known by the kernel is still a process and new threads are created with the clone( system call called from the nptl library
lines.name: English

lines.value: however nptl requires specialized kernel support to implement for example the contended case of synchronisation primitives which might require threads to sleep and wake again
lines.name: English

lines.value: the primitive used for this is known as a futex
lines.name: English

lines.value: nptl is a so called 1x1 threads library in that threads created by the user via the library function are in 1-1 correspondence with schedulable entities in the kernel tasks in the linux case
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is the simplest possible threading implementation
lines.name: English

lines.value: an alternative to nptl's 1x1 model is the mxn model
lines.name: English

lines.value: jozef marian chelmonski november 7 1849 &ndash april 6 1914 was a polish painter of the realist school with roots in the historical and social context of the late romantic period in partitioned poland
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is famous for monumental paintings now at the sukiennice national art gallery in krakow and at the mnw in warsaw
lines.name: English

lines.value: chelmonski was born in the village of boczki near lowicz in central congress poland under the russian military control
lines.name: English

lines.value: his first drawing teacher was his father a small leaseholder and administrator of boczki village
lines.name: English

lines.value: after finishing high school in warsaw jozef studied in warsaw drawing class 1867–1871 and took private lessons from wojciech gerson
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1871 to 1874 chelmonski lived in munich
lines.name: English

lines.value: he worked with polish painters assembled around jozef brandt and maksymilian gierymski
lines.name: English

lines.value: there he also studied for a few months at the academy of h anschutz and a strahuber
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1872 and 1874 chelmonski visited the polish territories poland as an independent country did not exist during this time tatra mountains and ukraine
lines.name: English

lines.value: his first paintings were done under the influence of gerson
lines.name: English

lines.value: the works that followed were landscapes and villages
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1875 chelmonski went to paris where he had many important exhibitions and became known to the art scene
lines.name: English

lines.value: with many orders the artistic level of his paintings decreased
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1878 to 1887 chelmonski visited poland vienna and venice
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1887 he returned to poland and in 1889 settled in the village of kuklowka zarzeczna
lines.name: English

lines.value: contact with his homeland and nature are qualities revealed in his artworks
lines.name: English

lines.value: from that time are the best liked or the most beloved of chelmonski's paintings are paintings such as partridge on the snow the storks or before thunderstorm
lines.name: English

lines.value: chelmonski represented the trend in art called polish patriotic painting
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died in kuklowka near grodzisk mazowiecki in 1914
lines.name: English

lines.value: william bill rancic (; born may 16 1971 is an american entrepreneur who was the first candidate hired by the trump organization at the conclusion of the first season of donald trump's reality television show the apprentice
lines.name: English

lines.value: he starred in the reality show giuliana and bill with his wife giuliana rancic and hosted america now with leeza gibbons
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2014 he starred as host of the food network's new cooking competition show kitchen casino
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic is a motivational speaker and a chicago real estate developer
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic was instrumental in helping found fabfitfun a woman's website focused on health beauty and fashion
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic was born in chicago and grew up in the suburb of orland park illinois in a family of irish and croatian heritage
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic attended st michael's school orland park and graduated from carl sandburg high school
lines.name: English

lines.value: he earned a bs from loyola university chicago
lines.name: English

lines.value: his mother is gail rancic his father edward rancic died of cancer in 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has three sisters beth katie and karen
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic was one of the job applicants in the apprentice 1 during the spring of 2004 as one of 16 contestants
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic was hired at the conclusion of the 14-week job interview after donald trump selected him over finalist kwame jackson
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic was the first reality tv star to be hired on national television
lines.name: English

lines.value: he elected to take charge of the construction of the trump tower chicago in his native chicago illinois on the site of the demolished chicago sun times building
lines.name: English

lines.value: his other option was to oversee and manage a new trump national golf course and resort in los angeles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trump national course was a potential site for season 6 of the show
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the final challenge against competitor kwame jackson trump gave rancic the task of running a celebrity golf outing at trump national golf club westchester in briarcliff manor ny while jackson was tasked to manage a jessica simpson concert
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the final board meeting jackson remarked that running a golf outing was the easier of the two tasks which brought a disagreement from trump vp carolyn kepcher who was managing a golf course when trump hired her
lines.name: English

lines.value: trump hired rancic
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally rancic said that after his one year contract as being donald trump's apprentice expired he would leave the job and start his own company
lines.name: English

lines.value: he instead opted to remain part of the trump organization and in some seasons filled in as a judge when regular judge george h ross was away on business
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2007 rancic co hosted ivillage's in the loop with ivillage a tv show and webcast produced by nbc universal
lines.name: English

lines.value: nbc commissioned a set at the universal orlando resort in florida
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2008 rancic began as host for the a&e reality show we mean business in which small business owners undergo business make overs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2008 rancic and his wife tv host giuliana rancic nee depandi started a joint television production company you and i productions which produces reality and scripted programming for television
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 rancic started hosting a news program called america now which is broadcast across the united states on stations owned by raycom media
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year america now was brought back for a second season with leeza gibbons joining bill rancic
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally the show was on every weekend but when leeza gibbons joined the show it moved to a monday through friday timeslot
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2012 rancic became a television spokesperson for the product rogaine appearing in national commercials detailing his experience with hair loss
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 2014 rancic began hosting the food network competitive cooking series kitchen casino where chefs participate in three casino themed challenges in an attempt to win up to $30000
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2016 rancic published his first novel first light
lines.name: English

lines.value: in december 2006 he became engaged to giuliana depandi and the couple wed in september 2007 in chiesa di santa sofia capri
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 23 2012 giuliana and bill announced on the today show that they were expecting their first child via gestational carrier
lines.name: English

lines.value: in august 2012 the couple welcomed a son in denver colorado
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic owned a condo on the magnificent mile in chicago which he sold less than 20 months after purchasing the unit on the 50th floor of the park tower building
lines.name: English

lines.value: rancic had owned a home in hinsdale illinois which prominently featured on his reality show
lines.name: English

lines.value: he sold it in february 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also owns a villa on the croatian island of korcula
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf417 is a stacked linear barcode symbol format used in a variety of applications primarily transport identification cards and inventory management
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf stands for portable data file
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 417 signifies that each pattern in the code consists of 4 bars and spaces and that each pattern is 17 units long
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pdf417 symbology was invented by dr ynjiun p wang at symbol technologies in 1991
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is iso standard 15438
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf417 is used in many applications by both commercial and government organizations
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf417 is one of the formats along with data matrix that can be used to print postage accepted by the united states postal service
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf417 is also selected by the airline industry's bar coded boarding pass standard bcbp as the 2d bar code symbolism for paper boarding passes
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf417 is the standard selected by the department of homeland security as the machine readable zone technology for realid compliant driver licenses and state issued identification cards
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to features typical of two dimensional bar codes pdf417's capabilities include ::manufacturers of bar code equipment and users of bar code technology require publicly available standard symbology specifications to which they can refer when developing equipment and application standards
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the intent and understanding of iso/iec that the symbology presented in this international standard is entirely in the public domain and free of all user restrictions licences and fees
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pdf417 bar code also called a symbol consists of 3 to 90 rows each of which is like a small linear bar code
lines.name: English

lines.value: each row has
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf417 uses a base 929 encoding
lines.name: English

lines.value: each codeword represents a number from 0 to 928
lines.name: English

lines.value: the codewords are represented by patterns of dark bar and light space regions
lines.name: English

lines.value: each of these patterns contains four bars and four spaces where the 4 in the name comes from
lines.name: English

lines.value: the total width is 17 times the width of the narrowest allowed vertical bar the x dimension this is where the 17 in the name comes from
lines.name: English

lines.value: each pattern starts with a bar and ends with a space
lines.name: English

lines.value: the row height must be at least 3 times the minimum width y &ge 3 x there are three distinct bar–space patterns used to represent each codeword
lines.name: English

lines.value: these patterns are organized into three groups known as clusters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the clusters are labeled 0 3 and 6
lines.name: English

lines.value: no bar–space pattern is used in more than one cluster
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rows of the symbol cycle through the three clusters so row 1 uses patterns from cluster 0 row 2 uses cluster 3 row 3 uses cluster 6 and row 4 again uses cluster 0
lines.name: English

lines.value: which cluster can be determined by an equation where e i is the i th edge to next same edge distance
lines.name: English

lines.value: odd indices are the leading edge of a bar to the leading edge of the next bar even indices are for the trailing edges
lines.name: English

lines.value: one purpose of the three clusters is to determine which row mod 3 the codeword is in
lines.name: English

lines.value: the clusters allow portions of the symbol to be read using a single scan line that may be skewed from the horizontal
lines.name: English

lines.value: for instance the scan might start on row 6 at the start of the row but end on row 10
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the beginning of the scan the scanner sees the constant start pattern and then it sees symbols in cluster 6
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the skewed scan straddles rows 6 and 7 then the scanner sees noise
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the scan is on row 7 the scanner sees symbols in cluster 0
lines.name: English

lines.value: consequently the scanner knows the direction of the skew
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the time the scanner reaches the right it is on row 10 so it sees cluster 0 patterns
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scanner will also see a constant stop pattern
lines.name: English

lines.value: of the 929 available code words 900 are used for data and 29 for special functions such as shifting between major modes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three major modes encode different types of data in different ways and can be mixed as necessary within a single bar code
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the pdf417 symbol is created from 2 to 512 error detection and correction codewords are added
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf417 uses reed–solomon error correction
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the symbol is scanned the maximum number of corrections that can be made is equal to the number of codewords added but the standard recommends that two codewords be held back to ensure reliability of the corrected information
lines.name: English

lines.value: pdf417 is a stacked barcode that can be read with a simple linear scan being swept over the symbol
lines.name: English

lines.value: those linear scans need the left and right columns with the start and stop code words
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally the scan needs to know what row it is scanning so each row of the symbol must also encode its row number
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore the reader's line scan won't scan just a row it will typically start scanning one row but then cross over to a neighbor and possibly continuing on to cross successive rows
lines.name: English

lines.value: in order to minimize the effect of these crossings the pdf417 modules are tall and narrow &mdash the height is typically three times the width
lines.name: English

lines.value: also each code word must indicate which row it belongs to so crossovers when they occur can be detected
lines.name: English

lines.value: the code words are also designed to be delta decodable so some code words are redundant
lines.name: English

lines.value: each pdf data code word represents about 10 bits of information log 2 900 &asymp 9.8 but the printed code word character is 17 modules wide
lines.name: English

lines.value: including a height of 3 modules a pdf417 code word takes 51 square modules to represent 10 bits
lines.name: English

lines.value: that area does not count other overhead such as the start stop row format and ecc information
lines.name: English

lines.value: other 2d codes such as datamatrix and qr are decoded with image sensors instead of uncoordinated linear scans
lines.name: English

lines.value: those codes still need recognition and alignment patterns but they do not need to be as prominent
lines.name: English

lines.value: an 8 bit code word will take 8 square modules ignoring recognition alignment format and ecc information
lines.name: English

lines.value: in practice a pdf417 symbol takes about four times the area of a datamatrix or qr code
lines.name: English
