lines.value: king street old town is an island platformed washington metro station in alexandria virginia united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station opened on december 17 1983 and is operated by the washington metropolitan area transit authority wmata
lines.name: English

lines.value: providing service for both the blue and yellow lines this is the southernmost transfer station for the blue and yellow lines as the two lines converge just south of the station
lines.name: English

lines.value: during inclement weather crystal city is commonly used as an unofficial transfer point being the southernmost underground station common to both lines
lines.name: English

lines.value: king street was originally served only by the yellow line until the blue line was extended from national airport to van dorn street in 1991
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station is located at king street and commonwealth avenue
lines.name: English

lines.value: entrances to the station are located on king street and on the diagonal road side of the station
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station is above ground and access to the platform is provided by one pair of escalators one staircase and one elevator
lines.name: English

lines.value: king street is the second fastest growing station on the washington metro behind gallery place
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the past ten years its ridership has increased 11%
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally scheduled to open in summer 1982 its opening was delayed due to both unavailability of new subway cars and the lack of a test track
lines.name: English

lines.value: construction of the station was complete by summer 1982 and in september 1983 metro announced the station would open that december as the new cars would be ready for service
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station opened on december 17 1983
lines.name: English

lines.value: its opening coincided with the completion of of rail between national airport and huntington and the opening of the braddock road eisenhower avenue and huntington stations
lines.name: English

lines.value: an expansion to the station added a second entrance and mezzanine across commonwealth avenue from the existing mezzanine with the new entrance located on cameron street across from the nearby hilton hotel
lines.name: English

lines.value: the expansion also includes a new canopy over the north end of the platform designed to match the original canopy
lines.name: English

lines.value: a gap was left between the two canopies to preserve the view of the george washington masonic memorial from old town
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station was named king street from its 1983 opening until november 3 2011 when the station was given its present name as part of a preparation for service changes planned for 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station is adjacent to alexandria union station together with which it serves old town alexandria and as a transit hub for the city as a whole
lines.name: English

lines.value: plans are in place to build a tunnel to allow a direct connection between the heavy rail station and the metro station presently transfers must be made by exiting either station and walking along a narrow sidewalk on king street
lines.name: English

lines.value: both metrobus and dash provide service to the station
lines.name: English

lines.value: a free daily trolley service provides direct access to old town and the waterfront making many stops along king street
lines.name: English

lines.value: car sharing is also available
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station is about 12 blocks one mile or 1.6 kilometers from the intersection of king and washington streets it is about 17 blocks from the waterfront
lines.name: English

lines.value: carlos ramon mendoza born november 4 1974 is a new york yankees coach in major league baseball
lines.name: English

lines.value: mendoza previously played parts of two seasons in the majors with the new york mets 1997 and colorado rockies 2000 primarily as an outfielder
lines.name: English

lines.value: listed at 5.11 1.80 m 160 lb 72 k mendoza batted and threw left handed
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was born in ciudad bolivar venezuela
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a two season mlb career mendoza hit .182 with one run batted in and no home runs in 28 games played
lines.name: English

lines.value: in between mendoza played winterball with the navegantes del magallanes and caribes de oriente clubs of the venezuelan league from 1994 through 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition he represented his country in the 1999 caribbean series tournament where he led all hitters with a.529 average and was included in the all star team
lines.name: English

lines.value: mendoza entered the yankees minor league system for the 2009 season as a member of the staten island yankees coaching staff before joining the charleston riverdogs in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 2011 campaign he served as the manager of the gulf coast league yankees
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then returned to the riverdogs as their manager from 2012 2017

lines.value: afterwards mendoza gained a promotion as an infield coach for the yankees before the 2018 mlb season

lines.value: avtozavodskaya (, lit auto factory is a station on the zamoskvoretskaya line of the moscow metro
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is named for the nearby zavod imeni likhacheva where zis and zil limousines were built
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station was opened in 1943 a few months before novokuznetskaya and paveletskaya
lines.name: English

lines.value: the architect was alexey dushkin
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1943 to 1969 when kakhovskaya opened it was the southern terminus of the line
lines.name: English

lines.value: the station was named zavod imeni stalina when it opened in 1943 after the factory at the site
lines.name: English

lines.value: as part of destalinization the factory's name changed to zavod imeni likhacheva in 1956 and the station became avtozavodskaya
lines.name: English

lines.value: parts of the former factory have been demolished to accommodate the construction of a residential complex however the name remains in place
lines.name: English

lines.value: both the tall pillars and walls are faced with pinkish oraktuoy marble
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally avtozavodskaya is decorated with eight mosaics depicting events of the great patriotic war
lines.name: English

lines.value: on february 6 2004 a suicide bomber set off an explosion between avtozavodskaya and paveletskaya in which 41 people were killed and 250 were injured

lines.value: tom kilburn 11 august 1921 - 17 january 2001 was an english mathematician and computer scientist
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the course of a productive 30-year career he was involved in the development of five computers of great historical significance
lines.name: English

lines.value: with freddie williams he worked on the williams kilburn tube and the world's first stored program computer the small scale experimental machine ssem while working at the university of manchester
lines.name: English

lines.value: his work propelled manchester and britain into the forefront of the emerging field of computer science
lines.name: English

lines.value: a graduate of sidney sussex college cambridge kilburn worked on radar at the telecommunications research establishment tre in malvern under frederic calland williams during the second world war
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the war ended he was recruited by williams to work on the development of computers at the university of manchester
lines.name: English

lines.value: he led the development of a succession of innovative manchester computers that incorporated a host of ground breaking innovations and developments including the ferranti mark 1 the world's first commercial computer and the atlas one of the first time sharing multiprocessing computers that incorporated job scheduling spooling interrupts pipelining and paging
lines.name: English

lines.value: tom kilburn was born in dewsbury yorkshire on 11 august 1921 the only son of john william kilburn a wool mill clerk who later became a company secretary and his wife ivy mortimer
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1932 to 1940 he attended the wheelwright grammar school for boys where the headmaster encouraged his aptitude for mathematics
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also played sports notably running
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1940 kilburn entered sidney sussex college cambridge with a state scholarship a county major scholarship and a minor open scholarship where he studied mathematics
lines.name: English

lines.value: although many university dons were absent performing war work at places like bletchley park and the university of cambridge maintained a vigorous mathematical community and kilburn became the sidney sussex college representative in the new pythagoreans a clique with the cambridge university mathematical society that also numbered gordon welchman and geoff tootill among its members
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to the outbreak of the second world war courses were compressed to two years and he graduated in 1942 with first class honours in part i of the mathematical tripos and preliminary examinations for part ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: on graduation kilburn was recruited by cp snow
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was given a quick course in electronics and was posted to the telecommunications research establishment tre in malvern where he worked on radar in group 19 under frederic calland williams
lines.name: English

lines.value: the group was responsible for designing and debugging electronic circuitry
lines.name: English

lines.value: although williams was initially disappointed at being given someone with so little practical experience kilburn became a valued member of the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 14 august 1943 he married irene marsden a shop assistant
lines.name: English

lines.value: they went on to raise a son john and a daughter anne
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilburn's wartime work inspired his enthusiasm for some form of electronic computer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the principal technical barrier to such a development at that time was the lack of any practical means of storage for data and instructions
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july 1946 kilburn and williams collaboratively developed a storage device based on a cathode ray tube crt called the williams kilburn tube
lines.name: English

lines.value: a patent was filed in 1946
lines.name: English

lines.value: initially they used it to store a single bit
lines.name: English

lines.value: the crt image soon faded so they devised a scheme by which it was read and refreshed continually effectively making the data storage permanent
lines.name: English

lines.value: by december 1947 they were able to store 2048 bits on one diameter crt
lines.name: English

lines.value: in december 1946 williams took up the edward stocks massey chair of electrotechnics at the university of manchester and recruited kilburn on secondment from malvern
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two developed their storage technology and in 1948 kilburn put it to a practical test in constructing the small scale experimental machine ssem which became the first stored program computer to run a program on 21 june 1948
lines.name: English

lines.value: he received the degree of phd in 1948 for his work at manchester writing his thesis on a storage system for use with binary digital computing machines under williams supervision
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilburn anticipated a return to malvern but williams persuaded him to stay to work on the university's collaborative project developing the ferranti mark 1 the world's first commercial computer
lines.name: English

lines.value: max newman withdrew from the project believing that the development of computers required engineers and not mathematicians at this point but williams preferred to return to electrotechnics leaving kilburn in charge
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was assisted by alan turing who arrived at manchester in 1948
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mark i incorporated innovations such as index registers and combined crts with magnetic drum storage
lines.name: English

lines.value: nine mark i computers were sold by between 1951 and 1957
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the next three decades kilburn led the development of a succession of innovative manchester computers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first commenced in 1951 was a development of the mark i known as the megacycle machine or meg that replaced the vacuum tube diodes with solid state ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: this permitted an order of magnitude increase in the clock rate
lines.name: English

lines.value: to add further speed kilburn provided for 10-bit parallel crt memory
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was also one of the first computers if not the first to have floating point arithmetic
lines.name: English

lines.value: meg operated for the first time in 1954 and nineteen were sold by ferranti six of them to customers overseas
lines.name: English

lines.value: while kilburn led one design team working on meg he led another with dick grimsdale and douglas webb on a research project examining what he believed would be the next step forward in computer design the use of transistors
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 48-bit machine they completed in november 1953 was the world's first transistor computer with 550 diodes and 92 transistors and was manufactured by stc
lines.name: English

lines.value: an improved version completed in april 1955 had 1300 diodes and 200 transistors and was sold by metropolitan vickers as the metrovick 950
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilburn's next project known as atlas aimed to create a fast computer by making maximum use of existing and new technologies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the project was backed by ferranti and a 300000 grant from the national research development corporation
lines.name: English

lines.value: it incorporated numerous technologies and techniques such as multiprogramming job scheduling spooling interrupts pipelining interleaved storage autonomous transfer units virtual storage and paging - though none of these techniques had been invented when the project started in 1956 other innovations included read only memory and a compiler compiler
lines.name: English

lines.value: the greatest innovation was virtual memory which allowed the drum storage to be treated as if it were core
lines.name: English

lines.value: three of them were built and installed at manchester university the university of london and the rutherford laboratory
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilburn became a professor of computing engineering in the department of electrical engineering at manchester in 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was instrumental in forming the school of computer science in 1964 becoming the first head of the department and served as dean of the faculty of science from 1970 to 1972 and pro vice chancellor of the university from 1976 to 1979
lines.name: English

lines.value: his final computer project was the mu5 which was designed to facilitate the running of programs in high level programming languages
lines.name: English

lines.value: an analysis of code written for the atlas gave an insight into the frequency of different operands and control structures
lines.name: English

lines.value: the project was assisted by a 630000 science research council src grant awarded over five years
lines.name: English

lines.value: the design heavily influenced the successful icl 2900 series
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the years kilburn received numerous awards and accolades
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was elected a fellow of the royal society frs in 1965 a distinguished fellow of the british computer society in 1974 and a fellow of the computer history museum for his contributions to early computer design including random access digital storage virtual memory and multiprogramming in 2000
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was created a commander of the most excellent order of the british empire cbe in 1973 and was awarded an honorary doctorate of science from the university of bath in 1979
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilburn received the ieee computer society w wallace mcdowell award in 1971 for his achievement in designing and building some of the first - as well as some of the most powerful - computers in the world the british computer society it award in 1973 the royal medal of the royal society in 1978 the ieee computer society computer pioneer award in 1982 the eckert mauchly award in 1983 and the mountbatten medal
lines.name: English

lines.value: a building at the university of manchester which houses the school of computer science is named the kilburn building in his honour
lines.name: English

lines.value: his nomination for the royal society reads
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilburn habitually holidayed with his family in blackpool but was always back in time for manchester united f.c.'s first match of the football season
lines.name: English

lines.value: he claimed that watching manchester united win the 1968 european cup at wembley was the best day of his life
lines.name: English

lines.value: he took early retirement in 1981 to care for his ailing wife who was suffering from chronic bronchitis but she died on 3 august 1981 two weeks before his retirement
lines.name: English

lines.value: after his wife's death kilburn lived alone in the modest house they had shared in manchester
lines.name: English

lines.value: he did not own a personal computer
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1998 he unveiled a fully functional replica of the baby at the manchester museum of science and industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died at trafford general hospital in davyhulme of pneumonia following abdominal surgery on 17 january 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: nik cohn also written nick cohn is a british rock journalist born in london in 1946
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohn was brought up in derry in northern ireland the son of historian norman cohn and russian writer vera broido
lines.name: English

lines.value: an incomer to the tight knit town he spent most of his time at the local record shop and the walk there from his home on campus at magee university college inspired one of his earliest stories delinquent in derry
lines.name: English

lines.value: he left the city to attend the royal grammar school in newcastle upon tyne in england then moved to london
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohn is considered by some critics to be a father of rock criticism thanks to his time on the observer's early rock column entitled the brief and his first major book awopbopaloobop alopbamboom first published in 1969
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohn has since published articles novels and music books regularly
lines.name: English

lines.value: when reviewing a rough mix of the who's rock opera tommy he told the group members that the album was less than spectacular
lines.name: English

lines.value: knowing that cohn was a fan of pinball pete townshend suggested that the album's deaf dumb and blind title character could also be an exceptional pinball player
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohn's opinion of the album immediately improved and townshend subsequently wrote pinball wizard to be added to the album
lines.name: English

lines.value: during one stay in america in the late 1980s he shared a flat with wrestler chris candido
lines.name: English

lines.value: certain aspects of cohn's personality were taken on by candido in his no gimmicks required persona in ecw
lines.name: English

lines.value: he wrote the 1976 new york magazine article tribal rites of the new saturday night which was the source material for the movie saturday night fever
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1996 cohn revealed the article to have been a complete fabrication based only on clubgoers he knew from his native england
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early 1980s he was indicted on drug trafficking charges for importing $4 million worth of indian heroin
lines.name: English

lines.value: in exchange for testimony he was given five years probation and fined $5000
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohn was a columnist for the guardian in the mid to late 1990s as he researched his book on the underbelly of england yes we have no adventures in the other england
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is also a regular contributor to granta
lines.name: English

lines.value: carolyn jean cheeks kilpatrick born june 25 1945 is an american politician who was us representative for from 1997 to 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is a member of the democratic party
lines.name: English

lines.value: in august 2010 she lost the democratic primary election
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was replaced by hansen clarke in january 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 13th district which is entirely contained within wayne county runs along the detroit river which is also the canada us border from the northern county line to the southern line it includes grosse pointe half of detroit and portions of downriver
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilpatrick is also the mother of former detroit mayor kwame kilpatrick
lines.name: English

lines.value: born carolyn jean cheeks in detroit michigan she graduated from the detroit high school of commerce
lines.name: English

lines.value: she then attended ferris state university in big rapids from 1968 to 1970 and received a bs from western michigan university kalamazoo in 1972
lines.name: English

lines.value: she earned a ms from the university of michigan in 1977
lines.name: English

lines.value: she worked as a high school teacher and was later a member of the michigan state house of representatives from 1979 to 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 6 2006 the congressional black caucus unanimously chose kilpatrick as its chairwoman for the 110th congress 2007-8
lines.name: English

lines.value: on september 29 2008 she voted against the emergency economic stabilization act of 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1996 kilpatrick challenged three term incumbent barbara rose collins in the 1996 democratic primary for what was then the 15th district
lines.name: English

lines.value: she defeated collins by a shocking margin taking 51.6 percent of the vote to collins 30.6 percent
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was tantamount to election in this heavily democratic black majority district
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was reelected six times never dropping below 80 percent of the vote
lines.name: English

lines.value: her district was renumbered as the 13th district after the 2000 census
lines.name: English

lines.value: she faced no major party opposition in 2004 and was completely unopposed in 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: her first serious opposition came during the 2008 primary the real contest in this district when she was challenged by both former state representative mary waters and state senator martha scott in the democratic primary
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilpatrick's campaign was plagued by the controversy surrounding her son and his involvement in a text messaging sex scandal
lines.name: English

lines.value: however on the august 5 primary election kilpatrick narrowly won with 39.1 percent of the vote compared to waters 36 percent and scott's 24 percent
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 she was again challenged in the democratic primary
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike in 2008 her opposition coalesced around state senator hansen clarke who defeated her in the august 3 primary
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is the final curtain the ending of the kilpatrick dynasty said detroit political consultant eric foster of foster mccollum white and assoc
lines.name: English

lines.value: npr and cbs news both noted that throughout her reelection campaign she was dogged by questions about her son kwame kilpatrick who is in prison on numerous corruption charges
lines.name: English

lines.value: michigan live reported that her election defeat could in part be attributed to the kwame kilpatrick scandals
lines.name: English

lines.value: kilpatrick was married to bernard nathaniel kilpatrick with whom she has daughter ayanna and son kwame kilpatrick former mayor of detroit
lines.name: English

lines.value: she has six grandsons including two sets of twins
lines.name: English

lines.value: both her former husband and son were on trial under an 89-page felony indictment
lines.name: English

lines.value: on march 11 2013 her son was found guilty on 24 of 30 federal charges and her former spouse was found guilty on 1 of 4 federal charges
lines.name: English

lines.value: the royal tank regiment rtr is the oldest tank unit in the world being formed by the british army in 1916 during the great war
lines.name: English

lines.value: today it is the armoured regiment of the british army's 1st armoured infantry brigade
lines.name: English

lines.value: formerly known as the tank corps and the royal tank corps it is part of the royal armoured corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: the formation of the royal tank regiment followed the invention of the tank
lines.name: English

lines.value: tanks were first used at the battle of flers courcelette in september 1916 during the battle of the somme in the first world war
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were at first considered artillery and crews received artillery pay
lines.name: English

lines.value: at that time the six tank companies were grouped as the heavy section of the machine gun corps mgc
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 1916 the eight companies then in existence were each expanded to form battalions still identified by the letters a to h and designated the heavy branch mgc another seven battalions i to o were formed by january 1918 when all the battalion were changed to numbered units
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 28 july 1917 the heavy branch was separated from the rest of the corps by royal warrant and given official status as the tank corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: the formation of new battalions continued and by december 1918 26 had been created though only 25 battalions were equipped with tanks as the 17th had converted to armoured cars in april 1918
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first commander of the tank corps was hugh elles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the corps saw much action at the battle of cambrai in november 1917
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the war the tank corps was trimmed down to a central depot and four battalions the 2nd 3rd 4th and 5th battalions
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 18 october 1923 it was officially given the title royal making it the royal tank corps rtc by colonel in chief king george v it was at this time that the motto fear naught the black beret and the unit badge were adopted
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1933 the 6th battalion rtc was formed in egypt by combining the personnel of the 3rd and 5th regular army armoured car companies
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1934 the 1st light battalion rtc was formed in england with personnel drawn from the 2nd 3rd & 5th battalions
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the preparations for war in the late 1930s two more regular army battalions were formed the 7th in 1937 and the 8th in 1938
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the latter half of 1938 six ta infantry battalions were converted to tank battalions with a further six created in 1939 following the duplication of the ta
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the early 1920s the tank corps was augmented by 20 armoured car companies twelve regular army created using mgc elements and eight territorial army ta created by the reduction and conversion of yeomanry regiments
lines.name: English

lines.value: eight of the regular army companies were later converted into independent light tank companies all twelve companies had been disbanded by the outbreak of the second world war
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 4 april 1939 the royal tank corps was renamed the royal tank regiment and became a wing of the newly created royal armoured corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eight yeomanry armoured car companies of the rtr were activated and transferred to the royal armoured corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: before the second world war royal tank corps recruits were required to be at least 5 feet 4 inches tall
lines.name: English

lines.value: they initially enlisted for six years with the colours and a further six years with the reserve
lines.name: English

lines.value: they trained at the royal tank corps depot at bovington camp dorset for about eight months
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the outbreak of war the regiment consisted of 20 battalions 8 regular and 12 territorial
lines.name: English

lines.value: the regiment's numerous units took part in countless battles in the second world war including the battle of dunkirk el alamein italian campaign burma campaign and d day landings of 6 june 1944
lines.name: English

lines.value: field marshal sir bernard law montgomery would frequently wear the regiment's beret with his field marshal's badge sewn on next to the regimental cap badge as it was more practical whilst travelling on a tank than either a formal peaked hat or the australian slouch hat he previously wore
lines.name: English

lines.value: after service in the korean war the rtr was reduced through various amalgamations firstly in 1959-60 on 2 august 2014 1rtr and 2rtr amalgamated at bulford and for the first time in its history the royal tank regiment became a single battalion regiment
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new regiment is titled the royal tank regiment
lines.name: English

lines.value: the royal tank regiment has continued to see action including missions in bosnia and herzegovina and kosovo
lines.name: English

lines.value: elements of 1rtr were deployed to afghanistan in 2002 and both regiments were involved in the invasion of iraq with the 2rtr battlegroup involved in taking basra
lines.name: English

lines.value: both regiments continued deployments to iraq and afghanistan with the final tour to afghanistan taking place in 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: the regiment is equipped with challenger 2 tanks and based at tidworth and slated to be part of the reaction force coming under 1st armoured infantry brigade
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike the other type 56 challenger 2 regiments the rtr has an integrated cbrn reconnaissance squadron operating the fuchs reconnaissance vehicle
lines.name: English

lines.value: following amalgamation the regiment comprises six squadrons
lines.name: English

lines.value: colonels commandant have been
lines.name: English

lines.value: the official regimental motto is fear naught
lines.name: English

lines.value: the regimental colours are brown red and green
lines.name: English

lines.value: when it was first formed the tank corps had no distinctive colours
lines.name: English

lines.value: nothing was done about it until just before the battle of cambrai in 1917 when general elles wanting some distinguishing mark for his tank went into a shop to buy material for a flag
lines.name: English

lines.value: although stocks were small the general bought some lengths of silk brown red and green
lines.name: English

lines.value: the silk was sewn together and was flown from his tank hilda in which he led the tank corps into battle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the colours typified the struggle of the corps from mud through blood to the green fields beyond
lines.name: English

lines.value: this most apt interpretation of the colours was suggested by colonel fuller
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flag is flown with the green uppermost
lines.name: English

lines.value: the uniform of the royal tank regiment is unique in many ways to the rest of the royal armoured corps and british army
lines.name: English

lines.value: much of the uniform and equipment of soldiers during the first world war was quite impractical for use inside a tank
lines.name: English

lines.value: in particular the vision apertures in a tank were so small that it was necessary to keep the eyes very close to them in order to get even a limited vision
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus any headdress with a peak was entirely unsuitable
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 1918 general elles and colonel fuller were discussing the future of the tank corps and its uniform and general elles tried on a beret of the 70th chasseurs alpins which was billeted nearby
lines.name: English

lines.value: a black beret was selected as it would not show oil stains
lines.name: English

lines.value: no change in uniform was possible during the war but after a prolonged argument with the war office the black beret was approved by king george v on 5 march 1924
lines.name: English

lines.value: the black beret remained the exclusive headdress of the royal tank corps until its practical value was recognised by others and its use extended to the majority of the royal armoured corps in 1940
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the introduction of the blue beret in 1949 the royal tank regiment reclaimed its right to the exclusive use of the black beret which may not be worn by any other regiment or corps with the exception of the berkshire and westminster dragoons squadrons of the royal yeomanry
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sleeve badge of a first world war mk 1 tank preceded the formation of the royal tank corps when it was worn by the heavy branch of the machine gun corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: authorised on 7 may 1917 it is still worn today
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the first world war walking sticks were often carried by officers
lines.name: English

lines.value: such sticks came to have a new and more important use with the introduction of tanks which often became bogged on battlefields particularly in flanders
lines.name: English

lines.value: officers of the tank corps used these sticks to probe the ground in front of their tanks testing for firmness as they went forward
lines.name: English

lines.value: often the commanders led their tanks into action on foot
lines.name: English

lines.value: to commemorate this officers of the regiment carry ash plant sticks instead of the short cane customary to other arms
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wearing of black overalls is a custom reserved to the regiment by material regulations for the army volume 3 pamphlet no 4 code 13251
lines.name: English

lines.value: it stems from the royal review held at aldershot in the presence of king george v on 13 july 1935 on which occasion black overalls were worn on parade by all ranks of the royal tanks corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: the practice lapsed during the second world war but was reintroduced in the 1950s
lines.name: English

lines.value: a book club is a group of people who meet to discuss a book or books that they have read and express their opinions likes dislikes etc it is more often called simply a book club a term that is also used to describe a book sales club which can cause confusion
lines.name: English

lines.value: other frequently used terms to describe a book discussion club include reading group book group and book discussion group
lines.name: English

lines.value: book discussion clubs may meet in private homes libraries bookstores online forums pubs and in cafes or restaurants over meals or drinks
lines.name: English

lines.value: a practice also associated with book discussion common reading program or common read involves institutions encouraging their members to discuss select books in group settings common reading programs are largely associated with educational institutions encouraging their students to hold book discussion meetings
lines.name: English

lines.value: a single title club is one in which people discuss a particular title that every person in the group has read at the same time often with each member buying a personal copy
lines.name: English

lines.value: clearly the club must somehow decide ahead of time what that title will be
lines.name: English

lines.value: some groups may decide to choose new release titles whilst others may choose older ones or a mixture of the two
lines.name: English

lines.value: if it is a book discussion club that meets at a library then each member may borrow a copy of the book from the library over a given timeframe in order for a later discussion
lines.name: English

lines.value: there may be a few problems with these clubs
lines.name: English

lines.value: some members may regard them as opportunities to meet people for social contact and general conversation partially veering off onto a wide variety of non literary topics while others wish to engage in serious literary analysis focused on the book in question and related works with little non literary interaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally some members may suggest a book not because they are interested in it from a literary point of view but because they think it will offer them an opportunity to make points of personal interest to them or fit an external agenda
lines.name: English

lines.value: also different expectations and education skill levels may lead to conflicts and disappointments in clubs of this kind
lines.name: English

lines.value: the characteristics of a multi title club are such that each member may be reading different titles from each other at any given time and they may share a reading list for a period of time
lines.name: English

lines.value: what distinguishes this from any group of unrelated people reading different things from each other is that each title is expected to be read by the next member in a serial fashion
lines.name: English

lines.value: open loans suggest that the books in question are free to be loaned among the population with the expectation of getting them back eventually
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead of one member deciding what everyone will read with all the cost implications of acquiring that title these clubs usually involve circulating books they already own
lines.name: English

lines.value: each book is introduced with a short precis
lines.name: English

lines.value: this offers members the advantage of previewing a work before committing to read
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has the effect of narrowing the focus of the dialogue so that book and reader are more quickly and more accurately matched up
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sequential nature of the process implies that within a short time three to five people may have read the same title which is the perfect amount for a worthy conversation
lines.name: English

lines.value: catch and release imply that actual ownership of the book transfers each iteration with no expectation of the book returning to the original owner
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mechanism of transfer may include a personal face to face hand off sending the items through the mail or most remarkably leaving the book in a public place with the expectation that unknown future readers will find it there
lines.name: English

lines.value: all three methods are utilized with bookcrossing
lines.name: English

lines.value: participants use a website and a system of unique identification numbers to track released items as they migrate through a worldwide community
lines.name: English

lines.value: the interaction is largely web centric but it does not exclude face to face gatherings each of which can take on the traits of other book discussion clubs
lines.name: English

lines.value: many public libraries lead book clubs as a library program on a regular basis
lines.name: English

lines.value: a librarian usually leads a discussion after participants read the book
lines.name: English

lines.value: copies of the book are available to either be checked out or signed out for the group meeting
lines.name: English

lines.value: if leading a book discussion group outside of the facility often libraries offer book discussion kits where several titles of a book are able to be loaned out of the library to a single patron
lines.name: English

lines.value: also the lending period is typically longer than for the average book
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kits also contains a suggested reading guide with discussion questions
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is a convenience as everyone in the group is not forced to buy a copy of the book
lines.name: English

lines.value: librarians also aid in the procurement of items needed for private book club meetings
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are able to withhold multiple copies of a publication and extend loan periods
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are also able to facilitate club meetings digitally through discussion boards or video meetings
lines.name: English

lines.value: many librarians note the positive influence of google+ hangouts and skype to host meetings for long distance club members and for times in which all members could not attend the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: librarians have helped non traditional book clubs find footing within their community
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the challenge that not all members of a club can regularly meet at an appointed place and time a new form of book clubs has emerged online
lines.name: English

lines.value: online clubs exist in the shape of internet forums yahoo groups e mail mailing lists dedicated websites such as goodreads.com apps such as novellic and even telephone conference calls
lines.name: English

lines.value: also in the category of social networks these online clubs are made up of members of a variety of reading interests and often approach book discussion in different ways e.g academic discussion pleasure reading discussion personal connection and reaction to books members read
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2012 a new book club format referred to as author led book clubs was introduced by business book club " 12 books author led book clubs include the author of the current book as part of the discussion it often concludes the discussion with a live conference call or webinar
lines.name: English

lines.value: a broadcast club is one in which a television radio or podcast show features a regular segment that presents a discussion of a book
lines.name: English

lines.value: the segment is announced in advance so that viewers or listeners may read the book prior to the broadcast discussion
lines.name: English

lines.value: some notable broadcast book discussion clubs include
lines.name: English

lines.value: given the busy lifestyles of today another variation on the traditional book club is the book reading club
lines.name: English

lines.value: in such a club the group agrees on a specific book and each week or whatever frequency one person in the group reads the book out loud while the rest of the group listens
lines.name: English

lines.value: the group can either allow interruptions for comments and questions from the members at any time or agree to allow such input at chapter or section endings
lines.name: English

lines.value: such a club makes reading a shared experience and frees the busy members from the homework of having read the book before coming to the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also creates a lively environment for commenting on the specifics of the books as it is read and can lead to very enriching exchanges
lines.name: English

lines.value: a given book may continue for several sittings depending on the pace of reading frequency of meetings and the extent of comments and discussion
lines.name: English

lines.value: members can take turns reading to share the reading responsibility
lines.name: English

lines.value: another variation on the concept could be jointly listening to an audio book with pauses for comments
lines.name: English

lines.value: once a book is completed members recommend their choices of the new books and vote on which book to proceed with next
lines.name: English

lines.value: sylvia sidney born sophia kosow august 8 1910 - july 1 1999 was an american actress of stage screen and film with a career spanning over 70 years who first rose to prominence in dozens of leading roles in the 1930s
lines.name: English

lines.value: sidney later on came to be best known for her role as the maitlands afterlife case worker juno in tim burton's 1988 hit comedy film beetlejuice
lines.name: English

lines.value: she won a saturn award as best supporting actress for her performance
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was also nominated for the academy award for best supporting actress for her performance in summer wishes winter dreams 1973
lines.name: English

lines.value: sidney born sophia kosow in the bronx was the daughter of rebecca nee saperstein a romanian jew and victor kosow a russian jewish immigrant who worked as a clothing salesman
lines.name: English

lines.value: her parents divorced by 1915 and she was adopted by her stepfather sigmund sidney a dentist
lines.name: English

lines.value: her mother became a dressmaker and renamed herself beatrice sidney
lines.name: English

lines.value: now using the surname sidney she became an actress at the age of fifteen as a way of overcoming shyness
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a student of the theater guild's school for acting sidney appeared in several of their productions during the 1920s and earned praise from theater critics
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1926 she was seen by a hollywood talent scout and made her first film appearance later that year
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the depression sidney appeared in a string of films often playing the girlfriend or the sister of a gangster
lines.name: English

lines.value: she appeared opposite such heavyweight screen idols as spencer tracy henry fonda joel mccrea fredric march george raft and cary grant
lines.name: English

lines.value: among her films from this period were an american tragedy city streets and street scene all 1931 alfred hitchcock's sabotage and fritz lang's fury both 1936 you only live once dead end both 1937 and the trail of the lonesome pine an early three strip technicolor film
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was during this period that she developed a reputation for being difficult to work with
lines.name: English

lines.value: her career diminished somewhat during the 1940s
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1949 exhibitors voted her box office poison
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1952 she played the role of fantine in les miserables and her performance was widely praised and allowed her opportunities to develop as a character actress
lines.name: English

lines.value: she appeared three times on cbs's playhouse 90 anthology series
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 16 1957 she appeared as lulu morgan mother of singer helen morgan in the helen morgan story
lines.name: English

lines.value: four months later sidney joined her former co star bergen again on the premiere of the short lived nbc variety show the polly bergen show
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also worked in television during the 1960s on such programs as route 66 the defenders and my three sons
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1973 sidney received an academy award nomination for her supporting role in summer wishes winter dreams
lines.name: English

lines.value: as an elderly woman sidney continued to play supporting screen roles and was identifiable by her husky voice the result of a lifetime cigarette smoking habit
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was the formidable miss coral in the film version of i never promised you a rose garden and later was cast as aidan quinn's grandmother in the television production of an early frost for which she won a golden globe award
lines.name: English

lines.value: she played aunt marion in and had key roles in beetlejuice directed by longtime sidney fan tim burton as juno for which she won a saturn award and used people which co starred jessica tandy marcello mastroianni marcia gay harden kathy bates and shirley maclaine
lines.name: English

lines.value: her final role was in another film by burton mars attacks in which she played an elderly woman whose beloved slim whitman records help stop an alien invasion from mars when played over a loudspeaker they cause the martians heads to explode
lines.name: English

lines.value: on television she appeared in the pilot episode of wkrp in cincinnati as the imperious owner of the radio station on thirtysomething as melissa's tough grandmother rose and at the beginning of each episode as the crotchety travel clerk on the short lived late 1990s revival of fantasy island
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also was featured on such shows as starsky and hutch the love boat magnum pi and trapper john md her broadway career spanned five decades from her debut performance as a graduate of the theatre guild school in june 1926 at age 15 in the three act fantasy prunella to the tennessee williams play vieux carre in 1977
lines.name: English

lines.value: other stage credits included the fourposter enter laughing and barefoot in the park
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1982 sidney was awarded the george eastman award by george eastman house for distinguished contribution to the art of film
lines.name: English

lines.value: sidney was married three times
lines.name: English

lines.value: she first married publisher bennett cerf on october 1 1935 but the couple divorced six months later on april 9 1936
lines.name: English

lines.value: she later married actor and acting teacher luther adler in 1938 by whom she had her only child a son jacob jody 1939 1987 who died of lou gehrig's disease
lines.name: English

lines.value: adler and sidney divorced in 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: during her marriage to luther adler she was a sister in law to acclaimed stage actress and drama teacher stella adler
lines.name: English

lines.value: on march 5 1947 she married radio producer and announcer carlton alsop they divorced on march 22 1951
lines.name: English

lines.value: sidney died on july 1 1999 from oesophageal cancer at the lenox hill hospital in new york city after a career spanning more than 70 years and a lifetime smoking habit
lines.name: English

lines.value: she died a month before her 89th birthday
lines.name: English

lines.value: before her death she underwent chemotherapy which proved unsuccessful
lines.name: English

lines.value: her remains were cremated
lines.name: English

lines.value: * miller sally sylvia a memoir of hollywood star sylvia sidney synergy book service september 15 2004

lines.value: hugo fv coveliers born 21 february 1947 is a retired belgian politician and lawyer
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a member of the belgian chamber of people's representatives between 1985 and 1995 and from 1993 to 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 2003 he has been a member of the belgian senate
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a parliamentary chairman for the vld in both chambers from 1999 to 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: coveliers started his career with the people's union volksunie a flemish nationalist party but changed to the flemish liberals and democrats vld in 1992 together with some other frustrated party members
lines.name: English

lines.value: within the vld he was part of the conservative wing and he was open to the idea of working with the vlaams belang flemish interest and its precursor vlaams blok flemish bloc
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 coveliers was co founder of the antwerp section of the conservative libertarian organization nova civitas
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also in that time feuded openly with vld party chairman karel de gucht
lines.name: English

lines.value: this resulted in coveliers being ejected from the party on 8 february 2005 and starting his own political party vlott in the fall of 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: this party is willing to work together with the vlaams belang vb and formed a cartel with it for the antwerp city elections in october 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also became the subject of the first known googlebomb in belgium
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the dismissal of jean marie dedecker from the vld coveliers dedecker and boudewijn bouckaert and other nova civitas members started negotiations to form a new right wing liberal party
lines.name: English

lines.value: coveliers and members of vlott stood on the vb list for the 2007 general election however
lines.name: English

lines.value: coveliers withdrew from active politics early 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: a singularity is a weather phenomenon likely to occur with reasonable regularity around a specific approximate calendar date outside of more general seasonal weather patterns e.g that may day is usually warmer than new year's day in northern locales
lines.name: English

lines.value: the existence of singularities is disputed some considering them due to seeing patterns in noise and statistical artifacts from small samples
lines.name: English

lines.value: in north america the most significant purported singularities are january thaw warmer weather around january 25 and indian summer warmer weather in mid autumn
lines.name: English

lines.value: more fanciful ones include the british tradition that rain on st swithun's day 15 july will be followed by forty days and nights of rain and similar folk beliefs around groundhog day
lines.name: English

lines.value: although folk tales such as st swithun's day generally have little credibility some of these events have a more solid basis
lines.name: English

lines.value: early scientific investigation involved the creation of calendars of singularities based on temperature and rainfall anomalies
lines.name: English

lines.value: later and more successful work by hubert lamb of the climatic research unit was based on air circulation patterns
lines.name: English

lines.value: lamb's work analysed daily frequency of airflow categories between 1898 and 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: similar work was carried out by flohn and hess in central europe based on analysis of air flows from 1881 to 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 1955 study by liverpool observatory and tidal institute analysed maximum daily temperatures at a single location from 1900 to 1953
lines.name: English

lines.value: this found problems when attempting to demonstrate the statistical significance of apparent temperature anomalies
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1950s eg bowen suggested that some rainfall calendaricities might be explicable in terms of meteoric particles from cometary orbits acting as ice nuclei in terrestrial clouds his theory received support from a number of sources however such work has now fallen out of favour due to modern dynamic modelling techniques although articles are still being written reflecting an interest in the topic
lines.name: English

lines.value: * singularities developed for the british isles
lines.name: English

lines.value: the center for adoption policy cap is a new york based 501(c)(3 organization
lines.name: English

lines.value: its mission is to provide research analysis advice and education to practitioners and the public about current legislation and practices governing domestic and inter country adoption in the united states europe asia latin america and africa
lines.name: English

lines.value: cap is an independent entity
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is not affiliated with any agency or entity involved in the placement of children
lines.name: English

lines.value: zosuquidar also ly 335979 is an experimental antineoplastic drug
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 it was announced that a phase iii trial for the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia aml and myelodysplastic syndrome did not meet its primary endpoint and eli lilly discontinued its development
lines.name: English

lines.value: zosquidir inhibits p glycoproteins
lines.name: English

lines.value: other drugs with this mechanism include tariquidar and laniquidar
lines.name: English

lines.value: p glycoproteins are trans membrane proteins that pump foreign substances out of cells in an atp dependent fashion
lines.name: English

lines.value: cancers overexpressing p glycoproteins are able to pump out therapeutic molecules before they are able to reach their target effectively making the cancer multi drug resistant
lines.name: English

lines.value: zosuquidar inhibits p glycoproteins inhibiting the efflux pump and restoring sensitivity to chemotherapeutic agents
lines.name: English

lines.value: zosuqidar was initially characterized by syntex corporation which was acquired by roche in 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: roche licensed the drug to eli lilly in 1997
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was granted orphan drug status by the fda in 2006 for aml
lines.name: English

lines.value: michael de la pole 2nd earl of suffolk 1367 &ndash 17 september 1415 was an english nobleman who supported henry iv reigned 1399-1413 against richard ii reigned 1377-1399 during the turmoils of the late 14th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died during the siege of harfleur in 1415
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a son of michael de la pole 1st earl of suffolk and katherine wingfield daughter of sir john wingfield
lines.name: English

lines.value: his father fled abroad amid accusations of treason during the merciless parliament in 1388 forfeiting the title of earl of suffolk and the family estates
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the next decade the younger michael de la pole made vigorous attempts to recover these lands and obtained most of them piecemeal between 1389 and 1392 following his father's death
lines.name: English

lines.value: however his close association with the lords appellant particularly the earl of warwick and the duke of gloucester prejudiced richard ii against him
lines.name: English

lines.value: he finally obtained the restoration of the earldom in january 1398
lines.name: English

lines.value: while he obeyed the summons of the duke of york to defend the kingdom against henry bolingbroke in july 1399 suffolk did not object to the disbandment of york's army and consented to the deposition of richard ii in the summer of 1399
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the first parliament of henry iv technically upheld the forfeitures of the merciless parliament henry iv immediately restored de la pole's estates and title in recognition of his support
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he would spend the remainder of his life trying to obtain possession of the remaining estates which had not been restored
lines.name: English

lines.value: he played a relatively small role in national politics although he regularly attended parliament
lines.name: English

lines.value: he took part in the campaign in scotland in 1400 in naval operations around 1405 and served as the senior english diplomat at the council of pisa 1409
lines.name: English

lines.value: suffolk also acted as a lieutenant of the duke of clarence during his campaign of 1412 1413
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he devoted most of his energies to reestablishing de la pole influence in east anglia
lines.name: English

lines.value: he took the role of a justice of the peace in norfolk and suffolk from 1399 and assembled a considerable following among the local gentry
lines.name: English

lines.value: he completed his father's building plans at wingfield suffolk and enlarged the local church
lines.name: English

lines.value: suffolk brought 40 men at arms and 120 archers with him on the 1415 campaign of henry v in france
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died of dysentery at harfleur and was succeeded by his eldest son michael who later died at agincourt
lines.name: English

lines.value: michael married katherine de stafford daughter of hugh de stafford 2nd earl of stafford
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were parents to at least eight children
lines.name: English

lines.value: luis alfonso rodriguez lopez-cepero born april 15 1978 known by his stage name luis fonsi is a puerto rican singer and songwriter best known for his 2017 worldwide hit song despacito featuring puerto rican rapper daddy yankee which won a total of four latin grammy awards
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song was remixed by justin bieber three months after its release
lines.name: English

lines.value: fonsi's latest song is echame la culpa a duet with demi lovato
lines.name: English

lines.value: fonsi was born on april 15 1978 in san juan puerto rico the oldest child of alfonso rodriguez and delia tata lopez-cepero
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has two younger siblings jean rodriguez who also is a singer and tatiana rodriguez
lines.name: English

lines.value: growing up fonsi imitated the stars of the popular group menudo and joined the san juan children's choir
lines.name: English

lines.value: he attended dr phillips high school in orlando florida and participated in a group called big guys they sang at school parties and local festivals
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the members of the group joey fatone later joined *nsync
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1995 fonsi enrolled at florida state university to study music
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also joined the school's choir the florida state university singers and sang with the city of birmingham symphony orchestra
lines.name: English

lines.value: fonsi attended florida state university school of music on a full scholarship majoring in vocal performance
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also joined the university's choir which let him to travel and perform throughout the world and recorded demo tapes in miami
lines.name: English

lines.value: soon after he was offered a recording contract by universal music latin
lines.name: English

lines.value: puerto baquerizo moreno () is the capital of galapagos province ecuador
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is located on the southwestern coast of san cristobal the easternmost island in the archipelago and is the capital of san cristobal canton
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was founded by general villamil playas in the mid 19th century and takes its name from president alfredo baquerizo moreno 1859–1951
lines.name: English

lines.value: today fishing is the main activity of the locals but tourism is on the increase along the waterfront with numerous hotels and shops
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town has a cathedral a post office police station a hospital and a branch of the universidad san francisco de quito
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also contains the centro de interpretacion of the galapagos national park which was established in 1988 and a natural history museum
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is served by san cristobal airport which connects to mainland ecuador
lines.name: English

lines.value: general villamil founded the town in the mid 19th century but it takes its name from alfredo baquerizo moreno 1859–1951 the first president to visit during his presidency in 1916
lines.name: English

lines.value: the governor of galapagos resides in the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: the governor's residence is a prominent grey stone edifice which also houses the naval headquarters and is west northwest of the church
lines.name: English

lines.value: puerto baquerizo moreno is the oldest settlement in the galapagos islands
lines.name: English

lines.value: the el progreso agricultural centre located about 8 km from the town was established in 1879 as a hacienda progreso
lines.name: English

lines.value: it had a large sugar refinery which was operated under harsh conditions and two assassinations occurred there
lines.name: English

lines.value: other manufacturing included leather and oil products
lines.name: English

lines.value: the albatross foundation usa or fundacion ecologica albatros is a ngo established in 1993 at the initiative of the people of the town with the objective of educating the young people of the country in the importance of preserving and conserving the island's environment and ecosystems
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the 2010 census the town had a population of 6672 inhabitants next to that of puerto ayora
lines.name: English

lines.value: puerto baquerizo moreno is the capital and administrative centre of ecuador's galapagos province
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is located on the southwestern coast of san cristobal and the town is also nicknamed cristobal by the local people after the island
lines.name: English

lines.value: its average elevation is 6 m the central part of the town including the road to el progreso has paved roads
lines.name: English

lines.value: the headquarters of the navy and the national police are located in the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a post office police station and hospital
lines.name: English

lines.value: a branch campus of universidad san francisco de quito is situated in the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a small beach in the town which is exclusively reserved for the sea lions that inhabit the area and are revered by the local people
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are two more beaches to the north of the town the playa mann and playa carola which are open to the public
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sea lions can be seen lounging on the decks of the anchored boats and have taken over park benches
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is situated at the foot of the cerro san joaquin mountain which has an elevation of 896 m making it the highest mountain on san cristobal
lines.name: English

lines.value: cerro de las tijeretas frigatebird hill is located 1 mile southeast of the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: the walk to it passes through a thickly vegetated area consisting of aromatic palo santo trees
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hill is well known for the two species of black frigatebirds which often visit
lines.name: English

lines.value: the summit provides views of the shipping vessels in bahia naufragio shipwreck bay
lines.name: English

lines.value: tongo reef is located to the west of the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is popular for surfing from december to february during the warm wet season
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a well protected cove known as puerto grande on the northwestern part of the town which has a white sandy beach where swimming is permitted
lines.name: English

lines.value: tijeretas cove which is approached along a trail is popular for snorkelling
lines.name: English

lines.value: puerto baquerizo moreno has a steppe or low latitude semi arid hot climate of koppen climate classification bsh
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite being an equatorial region the temperatures in the town and the surrounding area never reach the heights expected for such an equatorial location
lines.name: English

lines.value: temperatures remain similar year round fluctuating only several degrees from january means to july means
lines.name: English

lines.value: however two seasons predominate the warm dry climate from january to march and the cooler dry season that lasts from june to november and brings continuous fog like rain known as garua mild to warm temperatures and mainly overcast skies
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are also constant winds that increase the chill factor
lines.name: English

lines.value: as san cristobal and other islands of the archipelago fall under the dry zone of the equatorial pacific they experience lesser rainfall compared to area in the northern and southern regions
lines.name: English

lines.value: on an average
lines.name: English

lines.value: the entire archipelago receives less than 75 cm of rainfall per year
lines.name: English

lines.value: and the annual rainfall also varies substantially from year to year
lines.name: English

lines.value: at puerto baquerizo moreno records indicate that while rainfall in 1950 was only for the year during the el nino year of 1953 it received a total rainfall of
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wet season lasts roughly from december to march and brings an abundance of bright sunshine along with sporadically brief yet often intense tropical thunderstorms
lines.name: English

lines.value: annual average precipitation amounts to approximately 86% of which falls in the five month wet season period spanning december till may
lines.name: English

lines.value: precipitation falls on an average of 107 days a year precipitation  0.004 0.1 mm
lines.name: English

lines.value: all of these characteristics are because of the presence of the cold humboldt current that flows north from peru and chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: under the effects of this current the ocean waters of the islands remain cold
lines.name: English

lines.value: the humboldt current is succeeded by the warm el nino current which is a phenomenon that is reported to influence climatic condition in the whole of south pacific and sometimes globally.the mean monthly temperature is 24 c and the average monthly variation is
lines.name: English

lines.value: the daily average maximum temperature is 30 c from february to april
lines.name: English

lines.value: the daily average minimum temperature is 18 c in september
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are 2343 sunshine hours in an average year
lines.name: English

lines.value: lava fields and desert plants are profuse in the environs of the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: the invasive species of plants which grow profusely around the highlands at the periphery of the town are quinine tree cuban cedar and tall elephant grass
lines.name: English

lines.value: fishing is a major economic activity of the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2014 some 520 fishermen operate from the port with 212 fishing vessels of varying sizes
lines.name: English

lines.value: agriculture is practised marginally as there is little water on the island and the community feels that plying their boats for tourism is more economical
lines.name: English

lines.value: drinking water supply to the town is piped from a lake near el progreso which also provides irrigation to lands in its vicinity
lines.name: English

lines.value: the electricity supply is continuous
lines.name: English

lines.value: tourism is now on the rise on the coast of the town and has brought its related infrastructure such as hotels restaurants souvenir shops and tourists offices
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are several important landmarks in the town such as the centro de interpretacion of the galapagos national park the la inmaculada cathedral and a museum
lines.name: English

lines.value: a charles darwin research substation was established in the town in 1998 and includes five administrative units dealing with marine biology entomology environmental education communication and agriculture
lines.name: English

lines.value: cine naval located within the naval station but open to the public is the only cinema in the town and every year in july holds a cinema festival of ecuadorian and latin american films under the auspices of the spanish government
lines.name: English

lines.value: the centro de interpretacion national park visitor centre is a branch of the galapagos national park
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was established in 1988 in the northern part of the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: it contains exhibits related to the biodiversity and anthropology of the islands
lines.name: English

lines.value: educational presentations are interactive audio and video which pertain to ecology and are presented in english and spanish
lines.name: English

lines.value: the exhibits deal with the well recorded history of the archipelago its ecology flora and fauna
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main hall also features rotating exhibitions in addition to cultural events and workshops on dance and painting
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are many cacti and local flora on the land surrounding the centre which can be viewed along the board walks
lines.name: English

lines.value: the centre also has a unique display of a rebuilt ship's hold filled with upturned giant tortoises which represents the way in which they were transported by pirates and whalers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the immaculate conception cathedral puerto baquerizo moreno is a roman catholic church
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the head of bay
lines.name: English

lines.value: it features murals which depict stories from the new testament in a setting with indigenous animals and plants
lines.name: English

lines.value: the small natural history museum museo de ciencias naturales has a statue of charles darwin at the entrance
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is located in the heart of the town to the east of the parque la carolina next to the franciscan mission
lines.name: English

lines.value: it contains exhibits of many animals plants and minerals of the galapagos
lines.name: English

lines.value: of note is a giant tortoise which is said to be more than 80 years old an exhibit of a predecessor species of iguana the flightless cormorant and the galapagos tortoise - three drawings for each of these fauna are on display
lines.name: English

lines.value: san cristobal airport is the local airport and connects to the mainland
lines.name: English

lines.value: an airbus a319 jet operates daily from guayaquil on the mainland and currently there are additional flights operating
lines.name: English

lines.value: the port is situated in bahia naufragio shipwreck bay to the southwest of the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: boat companies conduct tours for tourists
lines.name: English

lines.value: buses and taxis operate in the town

lines.value: di nu hua is a chinese fictional story about princess changping of ming dynasty and her husband lover zhou shixian
lines.name: English

lines.value: first original version was a kunqu script written in qing dynasty while the second version was a first cantonese opera from early 1900s later found in japan and shanghai
lines.name: English

lines.value: little information is available from this early 1900s version
lines.name: English

lines.value: the contemporary popular version not meant to be historically accurate comes from the second cantonese opera script
lines.name: English

lines.value: they meet and get engaged with the blessing of parents
lines.name: English

lines.value: her father the emperor is overthrown by revolutionists
lines.name: English

lines.value: she hides as a nun in a monastery but meets zhou again
lines.name: English

lines.value: being found by the new regime she follows zhou's plan to commit suicide eventually
lines.name: English

lines.value: zhou formulates a plan to make sure the late emperor her father properly buried while her little brother released to safety
lines.name: English

lines.value: zhou alone returns to negotiate with the new regime using the bargaining power vested in him by a written request from her
lines.name: English

lines.value: once the new regime makes good on these promises the couple return to her former home for a wedding ceremony
lines.name: English

lines.value: they take poison at wedding night in the palace garden where they are introduced to each other as potential marriage candidate on day one
lines.name: English

lines.value: based on the kunqu version and other publications playwright tang ti sheng adaptation of this into a cantonese opera script debuted in the lee theatre on 7 june 1957
lines.name: English

lines.value: actresses yam kim fai and bak sheut sin were the original cast of leading roles and they played these roles last in 1970
lines.name: English

lines.value: october 2007 yuen siu fai as the princess's father in 2006/7 performances in hong kong and macau 40 total schooled one academic on radio

lines.value: october 2007 talk show retrospective in nature on radio is available online in cantonese

lines.value: translation this title has become this popular today is mostly by word of mouth since the mid 1960s being staged at kai de amusement park cantonese opera theatre and the performances of chor fung ming throughout 1970s and 1980s in newly developed satellite cities and towns were very well received
lines.name: English

lines.value: the role of male lead is extremely heavy by design and demonstrates the masculine traits of yam style eg chinese

lines.value: the more organic actors actresses in this role would find it more emotionally demanding

lines.value: it was non stop and exhausting after intermission
lines.name: English

lines.value: while most well known works of tang cater to the female leads this is an exception

lines.value: the importance of zhou shixian instead of the princess in this 1957 version is also unique compared to other versions such as eternal regret of dynasty ming chinese  and how jing ngo slew the tiger chinese  both of peking opera
