lines.value: honda campus all star challenge is a quizbowl tournament administered by college bowl for historically black colleges and universities
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sponsor of the program is american honda motor company
lines.name: English

lines.value: the program started in 1989 when honda proposed a program to the college bowl company for hbcu s to that end college bowl created a program in which all 4-year degree granting hbcus are eligible to enroll teams and all participating hbcus receive grants
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1990 to 1995 the competition format consisted of sectional matches that led up to televised national championship games on bet all of them hosted by clint holmes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the current basic format was adopted in 1996 which abandoned the sectional games and the televising of games in favor of an all encompassing 64-team national championship tournament nct held each spring
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the 2010 season only 48 teams have qualified each year
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1989 to 2011 honda campus all star challenge used the same gameplay structure as two of its sister shows college bowl and university challenge
lines.name: English

lines.value: gameplay takes place during two eight minute halves and include toss up and bonus questions
lines.name: English

lines.value: toss up questions are always 10 points in value and and a correct response opn a toss up gives the team the right to answer a bonus question which can be worth 20 25 or 30 possible points
lines.name: English

lines.value: the toss up questions do not permit conferring with other team members with buzzers using a lockout system being used to designate who rings in to answer a question
lines.name: English

lines.value: players may ring in before the moderator has completed the question also known as an interrupt but if an incorrect answer is given the team is given a five point deduction and the question is completed for the other team
lines.name: English

lines.value: teams may confer on bonuses but responses are only accepted from the captain or a designated player if the captain chooses so
lines.name: English

lines.value: if team members have conflicting answers then the captain will speak on behalf of the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bonus question may be one all or nothing question worth the full amount of the bonus or may be a series of questions that give the team a chance to receive a portion of the maximum points i.e a 30-point bonus made up of three 10 point questions
lines.name: English

lines.value: other bonuses may require a team to name items from a list at 5 points apiece or award points based on how many clues it takes the team to identify a famous person place or thing a 30-20-10 bonus
lines.name: English

lines.value: only the team who answered the tossup correctly gets to answer the bonus question there are no opportunities to rebound
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of two halves the team with the higher score wins the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: if there is a tie toss up questions are asked until there is a change in score either one team answers correctly for 10 points or interrupts with an incorrect answer losing 5 points and the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning with the 2011-12 season the format was changed to reflect that of the zain africa challenge another academic competition run by college bowl
lines.name: English

lines.value: gameplay takes place over four rounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first three rounds are called face off rounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: in each of the face off rounds there are two types of questions toss ups worth 10 points each and bonuses worth 20 points
lines.name: English

lines.value: in each of the three face off rounds a different player represents the team answering face off questions
lines.name: English

lines.value: that player is the only one who can ring in and answer for his or her team
lines.name: English

lines.value: each round has four categories in play
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team who wins a coin toss decides the first category
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the entire question is read the first player to signal gets to answer
lines.name: English

lines.value: if they answer correctly the team gets a bonus question
lines.name: English

lines.value: if their answer is incorrect the player representing the other team gets a chance to answer
lines.name: English

lines.value: bonus questions come from the same category as their respective face off questions are played by the entire team and are always worth a possible 20 points
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team who answered the last correct tossup gets to choose the next category
lines.name: English

lines.value: in each category there are four face off questions once the fourth and final face off question in a category is read the category is out of play
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the beginning of rounds 2 and 3 the face off representative changes and the team who is behind selects the category for the opening face off question
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of the three face off rounds play moves to the fourth and final round called the ultimate challenge
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team that's behind plays first and selects one of four new categories
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team has 60 seconds to answer 10 questions each worth 25 points
lines.name: English

lines.value: an incorrect answer is not penalized but the moderator moves on to the next question and as long as there is time remaining teams can keep coming back to questions that they missed or passed on
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the trailing team plays their opponents choose one of the three remaining categories to play
lines.name: English

lines.value: after both teams have played the ultimate challenge the team in the lead wins
lines.name: English

lines.value: if there is a tie the teams play face off questions until there is a change in score
lines.name: English

lines.value: as part of a qualification process each college university must host a campus tournament to determine which players will represent the school's team
lines.name: English

lines.value: schools must qualify for the nct by competing in one of the national qualifying tournaments nqt that take place in february
lines.name: English

lines.value: 48 schools are chosen for the nct based on their nqt performance and previous years performance at the nct
lines.name: English

lines.value: schools may increase their chances of qualifying via other ways announced by hcasc officials including service projects and rep my school contests
lines.name: English

lines.value: defending champions automatically qualify for the tournament
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the nqts are completed qualifying schools compete at the national championship tournament nct
lines.name: English

lines.value: teams are placed into eight divisions and play every team in their division once
lines.name: English

lines.value: the divisions are named after famous blacks with two of the eight divisions renamed each year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the preliminary round consists of divisional round robin games
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two teams from each division with the best win loss record move onto the round of 16 playoffs
lines.name: English

lines.value: teams are seeded based on overall performance and the sweet sixteen elite eight quarterfinal and semifinal matches are single elimination with the final two teams playing a best two of three series of final matches
lines.name: English

lines.value: clint holmes who hosted the bet broadcasts moderated the semifinal and final matches through 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning in 2009 moderators from the round robin have been used during the on stage games on the final game day
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tournament begins with an opening banquet and concludes with a closing banquet awards ceremony
lines.name: English

lines.value: break.com formerly big boys.com is an entertainment and humor website founded in 1998 that features comedy videos flash games and pictures among other material

lines.value: the website's target audience is men aged 18 35

lines.value: break.com was founded in 1998 as big boys.com a humor website featuring comedy videos flash games and other material
lines.name: English

lines.value: at one time visitors were able to rank site material on a scale of 1 to 5 but break replaced this feature with a thumbs up or thumbs down system
lines.name: English

lines.value: negative scores were not allowed on videos - a thumb down simply counteracted the vote of a thumb up
lines.name: English

lines.value: users could also comment on most of the individual entries
lines.name: English

lines.value: currently all forms of visitor feedback and comments have been removed

lines.name: English

lines.value: shared files can be promoted to the homepage to be featured
lines.name: English

lines.value: users that host original files promoted to the homepage are paid and the user relinquishes all rights to their material under contract

lines.value: in august 2006 break.com and showtime partnered to promote weeds by encouraging break.com users to upload original videos matching the themes of the show with winners eligible for airing on the channel

lines.value: since then advertising from various television shows and movies has appeared around the site with similar video competitions occurring occasionally

lines.value: in march of 2018 break.com removed the ability to leave comments because they were upset with their viewers criticizing their poor titling skills and sexist labeling of videos

lines.value: according to mediaweek the show is likely to carry pre roll video advertisements and banner ads

lines.value: a rocket vessel was a ship equipped with rockets as a weapon
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most famous ship of this type was hms erebus which at the battle of baltimore in 1814 provided the rockets red glare that was memorialized by francis scott key in the star spangled banner
lines.name: English

lines.value: rocket vessels were also used by the royal navy in the attack on the french fleet at boulogne sur mer in 1806 and at the second battle of copenhagen in 1807
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the battle of the basque roads in 1809 there were no less than three vessels participating that had been fitted to throw rockets two hired armed cutters king george and nimrod and the schooner whiting
lines.name: English

lines.value: the congreve rockets of this period were highly inaccurate and unreliable and were primarily used as a psychological weapon of terror in conjunction with other more effective weapons such as mortar shells thrown by bomb vessels
lines.name: English

lines.value: the erebus was equipped with a 32-pound rocket battery installed below the main deck which fired through portholes or scuttles pierced in the ship's side
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the other rocket vessels used by the royal navy were small boats rather than ships
lines.name: English

lines.value: these carried a rocket launcher frame supported by a mast and raised and lowered by means of halyards
lines.name: English

lines.value: modern warships carry a variety of rocket powered missile weapons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the army medical department of the us army amedd formerly the army medical service ams encompasses the army's six medical special branches or corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was established as the army hospital in july 1775 to coordinate the medical care required by the continental army during the revolutionary war
lines.name: English

lines.value: the amedd is led by the surgeon general of the us army a lieutenant general
lines.name: English

lines.value: the amedd is the us army's healthcare organization as opposed to an army command and is present in the active army the us army reserve and the army national guard components
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is headquartered is at fort sam houston san antonio texas which hosts the amedd center and school ameddc&s
lines.name: English

lines.value: large numbers of amedd senior leaders can also be found in the washington dc area divided between the pentagon and the walter reed national military medical center wrnmmc
lines.name: English

lines.value: the academy of health sciences within the ameddc&s provides training to the officers and enlisted service members of the amedd
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result of brac 2005 enlisted medical training was transferred to the new medical education and training campus consolidating the majority of military enlisted medical training in fort sam houston
lines.name: English

lines.value: the current surgeon general of the us army and us army medical command medcom commander is ltg nadja west
lines.name: English

lines.value: both the amedd and the army medical corps trace their origins back to july 27 1775 when the continental congress established the army hospital which was at that time overseen by the director general and chief physician
lines.name: English

lines.value: congress provided an army medical organization only in times of war or emergency until 1818 at which point it created a permanent medical department
lines.name: English

lines.value: the army nurse corps originated in 1901 the dental corps began in 1911 the veterinary corps in 1916 the medical service corps emerged in 1917 and the army medical specialist corps came into existence in 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: the army organization act of 1950 renamed the medical department the army medical service ams and on june 4 1968 the ams was renamed the army medical department amedd
lines.name: English

lines.value: a regimental coat of arms was devised for the medical department and was most likely first used in 1818
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 20 white stars on a blue background and the red and white stripes represent the us flag of 1818
lines.name: English

lines.value: the green staff entwined with a green serpent combined two symbols the rod of asclepius from classical mythology symbolic of medicine and healing and the color green associated with the medical corps during the last half of the 19th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the colors argent silver white and gules red are those associated with the flag of the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rooster is associated with the ancient greek and roman god of healing and medicine aesculapius
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ancient greeks believed that the rooster's crowing at dawn drove away the evil disease spreading demons from the temples so that it could be a place of healing
lines.name: English

lines.value: the torse twisted rope below the rooster shows alternating blue and silver colors which were the colors of the army in 1818
lines.name: English

lines.value: the latin motto experientia et progressus experience and progress is meant to convey the steady and unfailing progress of the army medical department since 1775
lines.name: English

lines.value: the design of the amedd regimental insignia crest is derived from the regimental coat of arms
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is one of the us army's 14 regimental corps insignias
lines.name: English

lines.value: these insignias are worn over the right breast pocket on the army service uniform asu and signify the service member's branch of service
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new amedd insignia was approved on 27 october 2014
lines.name: English

lines.value: :see also rod of asclepius and caduceus as a symbol of medicine in 1851 a caduceus embroidered in yellow silk on a half chevron of emerald green silk was first authorized and worn by hospital stewards of the medical department
lines.name: English

lines.value: the caduceus in its present form was approved in 1902
lines.name: English

lines.value: today the amedd branch corps insignia is a gold color medal caduceus 1 inch in height
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the exception of the medical corps each corps is identified by a black enamel letter or letters centered on the caduceus indicative of the specific branch
lines.name: English

lines.value: the insignia for medical service corps is silver
lines.name: English

lines.value: rooted in classical mythology and associated with the greek god hermes the us army's long standing use of the caduceus has made it a well known emblem of physicians and medical skill throughout the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: purists however often assert that the rod of asclepius with its single serpent is the more proper medical emblem
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are currently six special officer branches corps in the amedd
lines.name: English

lines.value: the medical corps consists of commissioned medical officers who are physicians doctors of medicine and doctors of osteopathic medicine who have completed at least one year of post graduate training internship or have been promoted from o 1 to o 3 following completion of medical school through usuhs or the hpsp
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mc traces its origins to 27 july 1775 when the continental congress created a hospital essentially a medical department and corps of physicians for the continental army
lines.name: English

lines.value: medical officers in the united states army were authorized uniforms only in 1816 and were accorded military rank only in 1847
lines.name: English

lines.value: congress made the designation of medical corps official in 1908 although the term had long been in use informally among the amedd's regular physicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: today members of the mc work around the world at all echelons of the army
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief of the mc is a major general whereas the senior army medical department officer is the surgeon general a lieutenant general
lines.name: English

lines.value: military physicians serve in one of several general career fields
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three main fields are operational field clinical field and research field
lines.name: English

lines.value: operational medicine is the field of army medicine that provides medical support to the soldier and his her chain of command
lines.name: English

lines.value: many operational physicians serve as division brigade and battalion level surgeons the word surgeon is used to identify a physician that is assigned to a unit as a primary care provider and not necessarily as a general surgeon
lines.name: English

lines.value: these physicians are either assigned through the profis system or through permanent assignment pcs
lines.name: English

lines.value: deployments with units to combat theaters are for the duration of a deployment and the jobs are mostly filled by primary care physicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: a profis provider can expect to be deployed away from their family for a total of 16 months 1 month before deployment 12 months in theater and 3 months for stabilization after return to the assigned units home station
lines.name: English

lines.value: this means that primary care physicians are deployed for longer periods than most specialist physicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: a specialist i.e general surgeon pulmonologist cardiologist trauma surgeon rheumatologist are usually deployed for 6 months
lines.name: English

lines.value: operational physicians should expect that more than 60% of their time will be spent in administrative roles and non patient care
lines.name: English

lines.value: 40% of the operational providers time is spent caring for soldiers or supervising unit physician assistants pa
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the recent brigade combat team bct restructuring the demand for operational surgeons have increased
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is possible that the low retention rates of captains and junior major rank physicians in the primary care fields are due to the discrepancies in deployment length and deployment frequency between primary care and specialty physicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: clinical medicine is the field of army medicine in which a physician in uniform performs similar functions to a physician in the civilian arena
lines.name: English

lines.value: these physicians are assigned to a profis unit in one of the various army medcen medical centers and meddac medical and dental facilities
lines.name: English

lines.value: primary care physicians usually deploy to fill battalion level surgeon positions
lines.name: English

lines.value: medical specialists deploy to support csh combat support hospitals research medicine is filled by a minority of military physicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of these research physicians are based in larger army medical centers and the research institutes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the army nurse corps became a permanent corps of the medical department under the army reorganization act 31 stat
lines.name: English

lines.value: 753 passed by congress on 2 february 1901
lines.name: English

lines.value: its motto is embrace the past - engage the present - envision the future and its mission statement declares all actions and tasks must lead and work toward promoting the wellness of warriors and their families supporting the delivery of warrior and family healthcare and all those entrusted to our care and ultimately positioning the army nurse corps as a force multiplier for the future of military medicine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dental corps dc consists of commissioned officers holding the doctor of dental surgery dds degree or doctor of dental medicine dmd degree
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief of the dental corps is a major general

lines.value: enlisted soldiers may be assigned as dental assistants although their collar insignia lacks the d and is the same as that worn by medics
lines.name: English

lines.value: army dental corps officers may train further in the following advanced training programs after dental school * oral and maxillofacial radiology the chief of the army dental corps is major general thomas r rob tempel jr his father major general thomas r tempel sr served as chief of the army dental corps from 1990-1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: the us army veterinary corps was established by an act of congress on 3 june 1916
lines.name: English

lines.value: recognition of the need for veterinary expertise had been evolving since 1776 when general washington directed that a regiment of horse with a farrier be raised
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has evolved to include sanitary food inspectors and animal healthcare specialists
lines.name: English

lines.value: the veterinary corps consists of commissioned doctors of veterinary medicine
lines.name: English

lines.value: warrant officers are the core of its food inspection service
lines.name: English

lines.value: enlisted personnel can serve as food inspection specialists and veterinary technicians enlisted personnel's collar insignia lacks the v and is the same as that worn by medics
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief of the veterinary corps is brigadier general erik h torring iii
lines.name: English

lines.value: the medical service corps consists of commissioned and warrant officers
lines.name: English

lines.value: members are required to hold at least a bachelor's degree before receiving a commission
lines.name: English

lines.value: the msc has the greatest range of duties performed by personnel
lines.name: English

lines.value: these may include administrative and support duties such as healthcare administrators health services officers in operational units healthcare comptrollers healthcare informatics officers patient administrators health service human resource managers health physicists toxicologists sanitary engineers medical operations and plans officers medical logisticians health services maintenance technicians and medical evacuation pilots
lines.name: English

lines.value: msc officers serve in clinical support roles as clinical laboratory science officers environmental science officers pharmacists and preventive medicine officers
lines.name: English

lines.value: medical service corps officers serve as commanders of field medical units in garrison and combat environments and provide healthcare to patients as psychologists phd psyd social workers msw with state license optometrists pharmacist podiatrists and audiologists
lines.name: English

lines.value: the medical service corps also functions as a transitional branch encompassing commissioned medical dental and veterinary students who have not completed their training through the uniformed services university of the health sciences usuhs or the health professions scholarship program hpsp
lines.name: English

lines.value: medical service corps officers are drawn from the various army commissioning sources usma rotc and the federal and state officer candidate schools following a branch immaterial curriculum
lines.name: English

lines.value: since a primary function of the medical service corps is to manage combat health support activities its officers hold general command authority and can compete for company and field grade command of medical support formations and detachments as well as logistics and aviation commands along with officers of the army competitive category branches infantry ordnance quartermaster etc
lines.name: English

lines.value: in contrast medical corps veterinary corps and dental corps officers are limited to command billets specific to their respective corps e.g amedd immaterial commands for medical nurse and medical specialist corps officers branch specific commands for medical dental and veterinary corps officers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief of the medical service corps is major general patrick d sargent
lines.name: English

lines.value: the army medical specialist corps consists of commissioned officers
lines.name: English

lines.value: members hold professional degrees and serve as clinical dietitians physical therapists occupational therapists and physician assistants
lines.name: English

lines.value: members of the sp serve all around the world and at all echelons of the army
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief of the sp corps is col john e balser
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are currently 24 military occupational specialties moss for enlisted medical soldiers

lines.value: fort frederick was a formidable blockhouse that was built at the winooski then onion river in 1773 by ira allen one of the first english occupants to settle in the locality
lines.name: English

lines.value: he named it after the ten year old frederick duke of york and albany second son of george iii of the united kingdom
lines.name: English

lines.value: allen also established a shipyard nearby at the winooski river bridge in 1772
lines.name: English

lines.value: the blockhouse served both as a fort and as a general store and office for the land speculating onion river company and was built as a matter of security against the yorkers and indians who at that time were held in equal enmity
lines.name: English

lines.value: fort frederick was never used for defense but its protective presence increased the value of onion river property and advanced local settlement
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the american revolutionary war ira allen returned to build a dam across the winooski river with a sawmill at each end
lines.name: English

lines.value: that was the start of the use of the winooski falls to generate energy and continued into the 20th century with the construction of water powered mills on both sides of the river
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lighthouse of alexandria sometimes called the pharos of alexandria (; ancient greek  apos ts aeeavpeias [[koine greek phonology#learned pronunciation 4th century bc until early roman period|contemporary koine]] ), was a lighthouse built by the ptolemaic kingdom between 280 and 247 bc which has been estimated to be 100 metres in overall height
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the seven wonders of the ancient world for many centuries it was one of the tallest man made structures in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: badly damaged by three earthquakes between ad 956 and 1323 it then became an abandoned ruin
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was the third longest surviving ancient wonder after the mausoleum at halicarnassus and the extant great pyramid of giza surviving in part until 1480 when the last of its remnant stones were used to build the citadel of qaitbay on the site
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1994 french archaeologists discovered some remains of the lighthouse on the floor of alexandria's eastern harbour
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ministry of state of antiquities in egypt has planned as of late 2015 to turn submerged ruins of ancient alexandria including those of the pharos into an underwater museum
lines.name: English

lines.value: pharos was a small island located on the western edge of the nile delta
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 332 bc alexander the great founded the city of alexandria on an isthmus opposite pharos
lines.name: English

lines.value: alexandria and pharos were later connected by a mole spanning more than 1200 metres .75 mi which was called the heptastadion seven stadia a stadium was a greek unit of length measuring approximately 180 m).the east side of the mole became the great harbour now an open bay on the west side lay the port of eunostos with its inner basin kibotos now vastly enlarged to form the modern harbour
lines.name: English

lines.value: today's city development lying between the present grand square and the modern ras el tin quarter is built on the silt which gradually widened and obliterated this mole and the ras el tin promontory represents all that is left of the island of pharos the site of the lighthouse at its eastern point having been weathered away by the sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lighthouse was constructed in the 3rd century bc after alexander the great died the first ptolemy ptolemy i soter announced himself king in 305 bc and commissioned its construction shortly thereafter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the building was finished during the reign of his son the second ptolemy ptolemy ii philadelphus
lines.name: English

lines.value: it took twelve years to complete at a total cost of 800 talents and served as a prototype for all later lighthouses in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: the light was produced by a furnace at the top and the tower was said to have been built mostly with solid blocks of limestone
lines.name: English

lines.value: strabo reported that sostratus had a dedication inscribed in metal letters to the saviour gods
lines.name: English

lines.value: later pliny the elder wrote that sostratus was the architect which is disputed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the second century ad the satirist lucian wrote that sostratus inscribed his name under plaster bearing the name of ptolemy
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was so that when the plaster with ptolemy's name fell off sostratus's name would be visible in the stone
lines.name: English

lines.value: lucian how to write history lxii after he [sostratus] had built the work he wrote his name on the masonry inside covered it with gypsum and having hidden it inscribed the name of the reigning king
lines.name: English

lines.value: he knew as actually happened that in a very short time the letters would fall away with the plaster and there would be revealed sostratus of cnidos the son of dexiphanes to the divine saviours for the sake of them that sail at sea thus not even he had regard for the immediate moment or his own brief life time he looked to our day and eternity as long as the tower shall stand and his skill abide
lines.name: English

lines.value: history then should be written in that spirit with truthfulness and an eye to future expectations rather than with adulation and a view to the pleasure of present praise
lines.name: English

lines.value: judith mckenzie writes that the arab descriptions of the lighthouse are remarkably consistent although it was repaired several times especially after earthquake damage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the height they give varies only fifteen per cent from c on a base c square the fullest description of the lighthouse comes from arab traveller abou haggag youssef ibn mohammed el balawi el andaloussi who visited alexandria in ad 1166
lines.name: English

lines.value: the arab authors indicate that the lighthouse was constructed from large blocks of light coloured stone the tower was made up of three tapering tiers a lower square section with a central core a middle octagonal section and at the top a circular section
lines.name: English

lines.value: at its apex was positioned a mirror which reflected sunlight during the day a fire was lit at night
lines.name: English

lines.value: a statue of poseidon or zeus stood atop the lighthouse

lines.value: the pharos's masonry blocks were interlocked sealed together using molten lead to withstand the pounding of the waves
lines.name: English

lines.value: al masudi writes that the seaward facing eastern side featured an inscription dedicated to zeus
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lighthouse was badly damaged in the earthquake of 956 and then again in 1303 and 1323
lines.name: English

lines.value: finally the stubby remnant disappeared in 1480 when the then sultan of egypt qaitbay built a medieval fort on the larger platform of the lighthouse site using some of the fallen stone
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 10th-century writer al mas'udi reports a legendary tale on the lighthouse's destruction according to which at the time of caliph abd al malik ibn marwan () the byzantines sent a eunuch agent who adopted islam gained the caliph's confidence and secured permission to search for hidden treasure at the base of the lighthouse

lines.value: a tribe is viewed developmentally economically and or historically as a social group existing outside of or before the development of states
lines.name: English

lines.value: a tribe is a group of distinct people dependent on their land for their livelihood who are largely self sufficient and not integrated into the national society
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is perhaps the term most readily understood and used by the general public to describe such communities
lines.name: English

lines.value: stephen corry defines tribal people as those who have followed ways of life for many generations that are largely self sufficient and are clearly different from the mainstream and dominant society
lines.name: English

lines.value: this definition however would not apply to countries in the middle east such as iraq and yemen south asia such as afghanistan and many african countries such as south sudan where the entire population is a member of one tribe or another and tribalism itself is dominant and mainstream
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are an estimated one hundred and fifty million tribal individuals worldwide constituting around forty percent of indigenous individuals
lines.name: English

lines.value: although nearly all tribal people are indigenous some are not indigenous to the areas where they now live
lines.name: English

lines.value: the distinction between tribal and indigenous is important because tribal peoples have a special status acknowledged in international law
lines.name: English

lines.value: they often face particular issues in addition to those faced by the wider category of indigenous peoples
lines.name: English

lines.value: many people used the term tribal society to refer to societies organized largely on the basis of social especially familial descent groups see clan and kinship
lines.name: English

lines.value: a customary tribe in these terms is a face to face community relatively bound by kinship relations reciprocal exchange and strong ties to place
lines.name: English

lines.value: tribe is a contested term due to its roots of being defined by outsiders during the period of colonialism
lines.name: English

lines.value: the word has no shared referent whether in political form kinship relations or shared culture
lines.name: English

lines.value: some argue that it conveys a negative connotation of a timeless unchanging past
lines.name: English

lines.value: to avoid these implications some have chosen to use the terms ethnic group or nation instead
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some places such as india and north america tribes are polities that have been granted legal recognition and limited autonomy by the national government
lines.name: English

lines.value: the word tribe first occurs in english in 12th-century middle english literature in reference to the twelve tribes of israel
lines.name: English

lines.value: the middle english word is derived from old french tribu and in turn from latin tribus plural tribus in reference to a supposed tripartite division of the original roman state along ethnic lines into tribus known as the ramnes or ramnenses tities or titienses and luceres corresponding according to marcus terentius varro to the latins sabines and etruscans respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ramnes were named after romulus leader of the latins tities after titus tatius leader of the sabines and luceres after lucumo leader of an etruscan army that had assisted the latins
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 242 240 bc the tribal assembly comitia tributa in the roman republic included 35 tribes four urban tribes and 31 rural tribes
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to livy the three tribes were squadrons of cavalry rather than ethnic divisions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term's ultimate etymology is uncertain perhaps from the proto indo european roots tri three and bhew to be
lines.name: English

lines.value: the classicist gregory nagy says citing the linguist emile benveniste that the umbrian trifu equivalent of the latin tribus is apparently derived from a combination of *tri and *bhu- where the second element is cognate with the greek root phuo uw to bring forth and the greek uan clan race people plural phylai uaai
lines.name: English

lines.value: the greek polis state or city was like the roman state divided into three phylai
lines.name: English

lines.value: in europe during the late medieval era the bible was written mostly in new latin and instead of tribus the word phyle was used derived from the greek phule
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the historical sense tribe race and clan have often been used interchangeably
lines.name: English

lines.value: considerable debate has accompanied efforts to define and characterize tribes
lines.name: English

lines.value: scholars perceive differences between pre state tribes and contemporary tribes there is also general controversy over cultural evolution and colonialism
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the popular imagination tribes reflect a way of life that predates and is more natural than that in modern states
lines.name: English

lines.value: tribes also privilege primordial social ties and are clearly bounded homogeneous parochial and stable
lines.name: English

lines.value: tribes are an organization among families including clans and lineages which generates a social and ideological basis for solidarity that is in some way more limited than that of an ethnic group or of a nation
lines.name: English

lines.value: anthropological and ethnohistorical research has challenged all of these notions
lines.name: English

lines.value: anthropologist elman service presented a system of classification for societies in all human cultures based on the evolution of social inequality and the role of the state
lines.name: English

lines.value: this system of classification contains four categories fried proposed that most contemporary tribes do not have their origin in pre state tribes but rather in pre state bands
lines.name: English

lines.value: such secondary tribes he suggested developed as modern products of state expansion
lines.name: English

lines.value: bands comprise small mobile and fluid social formations with weak leadership
lines.name: English

lines.value: they do not generate surpluses pay no taxes and support no standing army
lines.name: English

lines.value: fried argued that secondary tribes develop in one of two ways
lines.name: English

lines.value: first states could set them up as means to extend administrative and economic influence in their hinterland where direct political control costs too much
lines.name: English

lines.value: states would encourage or require people on their frontiers to form more clearly bounded and centralized polities because such polities could begin producing surpluses and taxes and would have a leadership responsive to the needs of neighboring states the so called scheduled tribes of the united states or of british india provide good examples of this
lines.name: English

lines.value: second bands could form secondary tribes as a means to defend against state expansion
lines.name: English

lines.value: members of bands would form more clearly bounded and centralized polities because such polities could begin producing surpluses that could support a standing army that could fight against states and they would have a leadership that could co ordinate economic production and military activities
lines.name: English

lines.value: archaeologists continue to explore the development of pre state tribes
lines.name: English

lines.value: current research suggests that tribal structures constituted one type of adaptation to situations providing plentiful yet unpredictable resources
lines.name: English

lines.value: such structures proved flexible enough to coordinate production and distribution of food in times of scarcity without limiting or constraining people during times of surplus
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pomegranate punica granatum is a fruit bearing deciduous shrub or small tree in the family lythraceae that grows between tall
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fruit is typically in season in the northern hemisphere from september to february and in the southern hemisphere from march to may
lines.name: English

lines.value: as intact arils or juice pomegranates are used in baking cooking juice blends meal garnishes smoothies and alcoholic beverages such as cocktails and wine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pomegranate originated in the region extending from modern day iran through afghanistan and pakistan to northern india and has been cultivated since ancient times throughout the mediterranean region
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was introduced into spanish america in the late 16th century and into california by spanish settlers in 1769
lines.name: English

lines.value: today it is widely cultivated throughout the middle east and caucasus region north and tropical africa south asia central asia the drier parts of southeast asia and parts of the mediterranean basin
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also cultivated in parts of arizona and california
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 20th and 21st centuries it has become more common in the shops and markets of europe and the western hemisphere
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name pomegranate derives from medieval latin pomum apple and granatum seeded
lines.name: English

lines.value: possibly stemming from the old french word for the fruit pomme grenade the pomegranate was known in early english as apple of grenada a term which today survives only in heraldic blazons
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is a folk etymology confusing the latin granatus with the name of the spanish city of granada which derives from arabic
lines.name: English

lines.value: garnet derives from old french grenat by metathesis from medieval latin granatum as used in a different meaning of a dark red color
lines.name: English

lines.value: this derivation may have originated from pomum granatum describing the color of pomegranate pulp or from granum referring to red dye cochineal
lines.name: English

lines.value: the french term for pomegranate grenade has given its name to the military grenade
lines.name: English

lines.value: a shrub or small tree growing high the pomegranate has multiple spiny branches and is extremely long lived with some specimens in france surviving for 200 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: p granatum leaves are opposite or subopposite glossy narrow oblong entire long and broad
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flowers are bright red and in diameter with three to seven petals
lines.name: English

lines.value: some fruitless varieties are grown for the flowers alone
lines.name: English

lines.value: red purple in color the pomegranate fruit husk has two parts an outer hard pericarp and an inner spongy mesocarp white albedo which comprises the fruit inner wall where arils attach
lines.name: English

lines.value: membranes of the mesocarp are organized as nonsymmetrical chambers that contain seeds inside arils which are embedded without attachment to the mesocarp
lines.name: English

lines.value: containing juice the arils are formed as a thin membrane derived from the epidermal cells of the seeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the number of seeds in a pomegranate can vary from 200 to about 1400
lines.name: English

lines.value: botanically the edible fruit is a berry with seeds and pulp produced from the ovary of a single flower
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fruit is intermediate in size between a lemon and a grapefruit in diameter with a rounded shape and thick reddish husk
lines.name: English

lines.value: in mature fruits the juice obtained by compressing the arils and seeds yields a sour flavor due to low ph 4.4 and high contents of polyphenols which may cause a red indelible stain on fabrics
lines.name: English

lines.value: primarily the pigmentation of pomegranate juice results from the presence of anthocyanins and ellagitannins
lines.name: English

lines.value: p granatum is grown for its fruit crop and as ornamental trees and shrubs in parks and gardens
lines.name: English

lines.value: mature specimens can develop sculptural twisted bark multiple trunks and a distinctive overall form
lines.name: English

lines.value: pomegranates are drought tolerant and can be grown in dry areas with either a mediterranean winter rainfall climate or in summer rainfall climates
lines.name: English

lines.value: in wetter areas they can be prone to root decay from fungal diseases
lines.name: English

lines.value: they can be tolerant of moderate frost down to about
lines.name: English

lines.value: insect pests of the pomegranate can include the pomegranate butterfly virachola isocrates and the leaf footed bug leptoglossus zonatus and fruit flies and ants are attracted to unharvested ripe fruit
lines.name: English

lines.value: pomegranate grows easily from seed but is commonly propagated from hardwood cuttings to avoid the genetic variation of seedlings

lines.value: after the pomegranate is opened by scoring it with a knife and breaking it open the seeds are separated from the peel and internal white pulp membranes

lines.value: separating the seeds is easier in a bowl of water because the seeds sink and the inedible pulp floats

lines.value: freezing the entire fruit also makes it easier to separate
lines.name: English

lines.value: another effective way of quickly harvesting the seeds is to cut the pomegranate in half score each half of the exterior rind four to six times hold the pomegranate half over a bowl and smack the rind with a large spoon

lines.value: the seeds should eject from the pomegranate directly into the bowl leaving only a dozen or more deeply embedded seeds to remove

lines.value: the taste differs depending on the variety or cultivar of pomegranate and its ripeness
lines.name: English

lines.value: pomegranate juice can be sweet or sour but most fruits are moderate in taste with sour notes from the acidic ellagitannins contained in the juice

lines.value: pomegranate juice has long been a popular drink in europe the middle east and is now widely distributed in the united states and canada

lines.value: grenadine syrup long ago consisted of thickened and sweetened pomegranate juice now is usually a sales name for a syrup based on various berries citric acid and food coloring mainly used in cocktail mixing

lines.value: before tomatoes a new world fruit arrived in the middle east pomegranate juice molasses and vinegar were widely used in many iranian foods and are still found in traditional recipes such as fesenjan a thick sauce made from pomegranate juice and ground walnuts usually spooned over duck or other poultry and rice and in ash e anar pomegranate soup

lines.value: pomegranate seeds are used as a spice known as anar dana from pomegranate + seed most notably in indian and pakistani cuisine

lines.value: dried whole seeds can often be obtained in ethnic south asian markets

lines.value: these seeds are separated from the flesh dried for 10 15 days and used as an acidic agent for chutney and curry preparation

lines.value: seeds of the wild pomegranate variety known as daru from the himalayas are regarded as high quality sources for this spice

lines.name: English

lines.value: in greece pomegranate is used in many recipes including kollivozoumi a creamy broth made from boiled wheat pomegranates and raisins legume salad with wheat and pomegranate traditional middle eastern lamb kebabs with pomegranate glaze pomegranate eggplant relish and avocado pomegranate dip

lines.value: the most abundant phytochemicals in pomegranate juice are polyphenols including the hydrolyzable tannins called ellagitannins formed when ellagic acid and or gallic acid binds with a carbohydrate to form pomegranate ellagitannins also known as punicalagins

lines.value: in ancient greek mythology the pomegranate was known as the fruit of the dead and believed to have sprung from the blood of adonis

lines.value: the myth of persephone the goddess of the underworld prominently features the pomegranate

lines.value: in one version of the myth persephone was kidnapped by hades and taken off to live in the underworld as his wife

lines.value: her mother demeter goddess of the harvest went into mourning for her lost daughter thus all green things ceased to grow

lines.value: zeus the highest ranking of the greek gods could not allow the earth to die so he commanded hades to return persephone

lines.value: it was the rule of the fates that anyone who consumed food or drink in the underworld was doomed to spend eternity there

lines.value: persephone had no food but hades offered her a pomegranate and she ate six seeds so from then on had to spend six months in the underworld every year

lines.value: during these six months while persephone sits on the throne of the underworld beside her husband hades her mother demeter mourns and no longer gives fertility to the earth

lines.value: the number of seeds persephone ate varies depending on which version of the story is told

lines.value: she embodies both aspects of the dual goddess life giving and death dealing at once

lines.value: the titan orion was represented as marrying side a name that in boeotia means pomegranate thus consecrating the primal hunter to the goddess
lines.name: English

lines.value: other greek dialects call the pomegranate rhoa its possible connection with the name of the earth goddess rhea inexplicable in greek proved suggestive for the mythographer karl kerenyi who suggested the consonance might ultimately derive from a deeper pre indo european language layer
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 5th century bc polycleitus took ivory and gold to sculpt the seated argive hera in her temple
lines.name: English

lines.value: she held a scepter in one hand and offered a pomegranate like a royal orb in the other
lines.name: English

lines.value: about the pomegranate i must say nothing whispered the traveller pausanias in the 2nd century for its story is somewhat of a holy mystery in the orion story hera cast pomegranate side an ancient greek city in antalya into dim erebus - "for daring to rival hera's beauty which forms the probable point of connection with the older osiris/isis story
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the ancient egyptians identified the orion constellation in the sky as sah the soul of osiris the identification of this section of the myth seems relatively complete
lines.name: English

lines.value: hera wears not a wreath nor a tiara nor a diadem but clearly the calyx of the pomegranate that has become her serrated crown
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pomegranate has a calyx shaped like a crown
lines.name: English

lines.value: in jewish tradition it has been seen as the original design for the proper crown
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some artistic depictions the pomegranate is found in the hand of mary mother of jesus
lines.name: English

lines.value: a pomegranate is displayed on coins from side

lines.value: the ancient greek city of side was in pamphylia a former region on the southern mediterranean coast of asia minor modern-day antalya province turkey
lines.name: English

lines.value: within the heraion at the mouth of the sele near paestum magna graecia is a chapel devoted to the madonna del granato our lady of the pomegranate who by virtue of her epithet and the attribute of a pomegranate must be the christian successor of the ancient greek goddess hera observes the excavator of the heraion of samos helmut kyrieleis
lines.name: English

lines.value: in modern times the pomegranate still holds strong symbolic meanings for the greeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: on important days in the greek orthodox calendar such as the presentation of the virgin mary and on christmas day it is traditional to have at the dinner table polysporia also known by their ancient name panspermia in some regions of greece
lines.name: English

lines.value: in ancient times they were offered to demeter and to the other gods for fertile land for the spirits of the dead and in honor of compassionate dionysus
lines.name: English

lines.value: when one buys a new home it is conventional for a house guest to bring as a first gift a pomegranate which is placed under near the ikonostasi home altar of the house as a symbol of abundance fertility and good luck
lines.name: English

lines.value: pomegranates are also prominent at modern greek weddings and funerals
lines.name: English

lines.value: when greeks commemorate their dead they make kollyva as offerings which consist of boiled wheat mixed with sugar and decorated with pomegranate
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also traditional in greece to break a pomegranate on the ground at weddings and on new years

lines.value: pomegranate decorations for the home are very common in greece and sold in most home goods stores

lines.value: the pomegranate is mentioned or alluded to in the bible many times
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also included in coinage and various types of ancient and modern cultural works
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example pomegranates were known in ancient israel as the fruits which the scouts brought to moses to demonstrate the fertility of the promised land
lines.name: English

lines.value: the book of exodus describes the me'il robe of the ephod worn by the hebrew high priest as having pomegranates embroidered on the hem alternating with golden bells which could be heard as the high priest entered and left the holy of holies
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the books of kings the capitals of the two pillars jachin and boaz that stood in front of solomon's temple in jerusalem were engraved with pomegranates
lines.name: English

lines.value: solomon is said to have designed his coronet based on the pomegranate's crown calyx
lines.name: English

lines.value: some jewish scholars believe the pomegranate was the forbidden fruit in the garden of eden
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally pomegranates are one of the seven species hebrew   shiv'at ha minim of fruits and grains enumerated in the hebrew bible () as special products of the land of israel and the songs of solomon contains this quote thy lips are like a thread of scarlet and thy speech is comely thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks song of solomon 4:3
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is traditional to consume pomegranates on rosh hashana because with its numerous seeds it symbolizes fruitfulness
lines.name: English

lines.value: also it is said to have 613 seeds which corresponds with the 613 commandments of the torah
lines.name: English

lines.value: this particular tradition is referred to in the opening pages of ursula dubosarsky's novel theodora's gift
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pomegranate appeared on the ancient coins of judea and when not in use the handles of torah scrolls are sometimes covered with decorative silver globes similar in shape to pomegranates rimmonim

lines.value: pomegranates symbolize the mystical experience in the jewish mystical tradition or kabbalah with the typical reference being to entering the garden of pomegranates or pardes rimonim this is also the title of a book by the 16th-century mystic moses ben jacob cordovero
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the earliest incontrovertible appearance of christ in a mosaic a 4th-century floor mosaic from hinton st mary dorset now in the british museum the bust of christ and the chi rho are flanked by pomegranates

lines.value: pomegranates continue to be a motif often found in christian religious decoration

lines.value: they are often woven into the fabric of vestments and liturgical hangings or wrought in metalwork

lines.value: pomegranates figure in many religious paintings by the likes of sandro botticelli and leonardo da vinci often in the hands of the virgin mary or the infant jesus

lines.value: the fruit broken or bursting open is a symbol of the fullness of jesus suffering and resurrection

lines.value: introduced to china during the tang dynasty 618-907 ad the pomegranate () in olden times was considered an emblem of fertility and numerous progeny

lines.value: the araliaceae is a family made of 52 genera and 700 species of flowering plants including perennial herbs trees vines and succulents
lines.name: English

lines.value: the family has large usually alternate leaves five petaled flowers arranged in clusters and berries
lines.name: English

lines.value: some genera are used as foliage plants such as hedera ivies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the araliaceae are merged into the closely related apiaceae umbelliferae in some taxonomic treatments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the family from tropical area origin is present in cooler climates too
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are found in the americas eurasia africa australia new zealand new caledonia and pacific islands
lines.name: English

lines.value: araliaceae bear essential oils or without essential oils can be resinous and heterophyllous
lines.name: English

lines.value: it presents many shapes includes some trees and ivies as the angelica tree devil's walking stick aralia spinosa the devil's club oplopanax horridus hedera spp including hedera helix and herbs as ginseng panax spp a native of korea and used as medical herb
lines.name: English

lines.value: leaves are simple or compound sometimes lauroid resembling laurus or peltate or not peltate when compound they are ternate pinnate or palmate
lines.name: English

lines.value: the systematics of the araliaceae are currently under study and taxonomic changes and novelties are to be expected
lines.name: English

lines.value: endemic araliaceae are found in the pluvial montane forest very humid montane and humid lowland river forest regions
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are present too in laurel forest cloud forest and warm humid habitats
lines.name: English

lines.value: the family is closely related to the apiaceae and pittosporaceae and the boundaries between these families and other members of apiales are still uncertain
lines.name: English

lines.value: some recent systems included araliaceae in an expanded apiaceae but this has not been widely followed
lines.name: English

lines.value: molecular phylogenies suggest at least some of the genera traditionally included in apiaceae as subfamily hydrocotyloideae appear to be more closely related to araliaceae and the inclusion of hydrocotyle and trachymene in araliaceae has been recommended
lines.name: English

lines.value: the generic level classification of the araliaceae has been unstable in particular numerous genera have been synonymized under schefflera
lines.name: English

lines.value: recent molecular phylogenies have shown this large pantropical genus is polyphyletic and some believe it should be divided again into several genera though these would probably not correspond with the previously recognized genera
lines.name: English

lines.value: subfamily aralioideae
lines.name: English

lines.value: list of foliage plant diseases araliaceae
lines.name: English

lines.value: the network model is a database model conceived as a flexible way of representing objects and their relationships
lines.name: English

lines.value: its distinguishing feature is that the schema viewed as a graph in which object types are nodes and relationship types are arcs is not restricted to being a hierarchy or lattice
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the hierarchical database model structures data as a tree of records with each record having one parent record and many children the network model allows each record to have multiple parent and child records forming a generalized graph structure
lines.name: English

lines.value: this property applies at two levels the schema is a generalized graph of record types connected by relationship types called set types in codasyl and the database itself is a generalized graph of record occurrences connected by relationships codasyl sets
lines.name: English

lines.value: cycles are permitted at both levels
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief argument in favour of the network model in comparison to the hierarchical model was that it allowed a more natural modeling of relationships between entities
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the model was widely implemented and used it failed to become dominant for two main reasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: firstly ibm chose to stick to the hierarchical model with semi network extensions in their established products such as ims and dl/i
lines.name: English

lines.value: secondly it was eventually displaced by the relational model which offered a higher level more declarative interface
lines.name: English

lines.value: until the early 1980s the performance benefits of the low level navigational interfaces offered by hierarchical and network databases were persuasive for many large scale applications but as hardware became faster the extra productivity and flexibility of the relational model led to the gradual obsolescence of the network model in corporate enterprise usage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the network model's original inventor was charles bachman and it was developed into a standard specification published in 1969 by the conference on data systems languages codasyl consortium
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was followed by a second publication in 1971 which became the basis for most implementations
lines.name: English

lines.value: subsequent work continued into the early 1980s culminating in an iso specification but this had little influence on products
lines.name: English

lines.value: bachman's influence is recognized in the term bachman diagram a diagrammatic notation that represents a database schema expressed using the network model
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a bachman diagram named rectangles represent record types and arrows represent one to many relationship types between records codasyl set types
lines.name: English

lines.value: some well known database systems that use the network model include
lines.name: English
