lines.value: the rm 81 agena was an american rocket upper stage and satellite bus which was developed by lockheed initially for the canceled ws 117l reconnaissance satellite program
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the split up of ws 117l into samos and corona for image intelligence and midas for early warning the agena was later used as an upper stage and an integrated component for several programs including corona reconnaissance satellites and the agena target vehicle used to demonstrate rendezvous and docking during project gemini
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was used as an upper stage on the atlas thor thorad and titan iiib rockets and considered for others including the space shuttle and atlas v a total of 365 agena rockets were launched between february 28 1959 and february 1987
lines.name: English

lines.value: only 33 agenas carried nasa payloads and the vast majority were for dod programs
lines.name: English

lines.value: on some missions the payload was built directly into the agena which provided it with electric power communications and three axis stabilization
lines.name: English

lines.value: payload components were usually located ahead of the agena's standard bulkhead
lines.name: English

lines.value: on missions where the payload was not built into the agena and instead separated after launch the agena was known as an ascent agena
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena was upgraded twice from the original agena a in order to support heavier and more sophisticated satellites such as corona spacecraft with multiple and more powerful cameras
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena name was suggested by the department of defense's advanced research projects agency for the star beta centauri also known as agena because this upper stage would ignite in the sky
lines.name: English

lines.value: this followed lockheed's tradition of naming products for stellar phenomena
lines.name: English

lines.value: the final launch was of an agena d on february 12 1987 configured as the upper stage of a titan 34b
lines.name: English

lines.value: in all 365 agena vehicles were launched by nasa and the us air force
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena was 5.0 feet 1.5 m in diameter three axis stabilized for the benefit of the reconnaissance system cameras and its bell 8096 engine produced 16000 lbs
lines.name: English

lines.value: 71 kn of thrust using unsymmetrical dimethylhydrazine udmh as the fuel and inhibited red fuming nitric acid irfna as the oxidizer
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is a hypergolic fuel oxidizer combination and as such it does not need an ignition system
lines.name: English

lines.value: this rocket engine could be restarted multiple times in orbit by radio command and it frequently was
lines.name: English

lines.value: the engine was notable for its unusual aluminum construction
lines.name: English

lines.value: the regenerativelycooled channels that cooled the throat and nozzle were formed from straight gun drill formed channels
lines.name: English

lines.value: the parabolic shape of the chamber throat made for a difficult gun drilling problem which bell aerosystems engineers solved by arranging the cooling channels in a one sheeted circular hyperboloid shape allowing machinists to gun drill straight cooling channels through the curved surfaces of the combustion chamber
lines.name: English

lines.value: the engine was derived from the xlr 81 propulsion unit for the canceled rocket propelled nuclear warhead pod of the convair b 58 hustler bomber
lines.name: English

lines.value: until 1959 the agena was also known as the discoverer vehicle or bell hustler
lines.name: English

lines.value: attitude control of the horizontal flying agena was provided by an inertial reference package with three gyroscopes two horizon sensors and micro jets using a nitrogen freon mixture of cold gas
lines.name: English

lines.value: pitch and roll were sensed by two hermetic integrating gyro units
lines.name: English

lines.value: a rate gyro unit determined yaw error by sensing orbital rate
lines.name: English

lines.value: pitch and roll gyro errors were corrected from the horizon sensors which were later supplemented by sun and star trackers
lines.name: English

lines.value: this enabled the agena to accommodate the higher pointing stability required for better ground resolution imaging with the improved corona cameras
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the agena was designed to hold a fixed orientation in space while orbiting earth a passive thermal control system was devised
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main source of the agena's electrical power was silver peroxide zinc batteries which from the early 1960s on were supplemented by solar arrays
lines.name: English

lines.value: an s band beacon enabled the agena to receive ground command sequences image motion compensation altered attitude etc which could be stored for later execution
lines.name: English

lines.value: three versions of the agena were flown
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena a was the first type of agena to be built
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was launched atop thor and atlas rockets mostly into polar orbits from vandenberg air force base launch complex 75 and point arguello launch complex 1 respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: two atlas launches occurred from launch complex 14 at cape canaveral
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena a was propelled by a bell 8048 xlr-81-ba-5 engine which could produce 69 kilonewtons of thrust for two minutes
lines.name: English

lines.value: eighteen agena as were launched in 1959-61 all of them for the discoverer midas and samos programs
lines.name: English

lines.value: during 1960 lockheed introduced the improved agena b which could be restarted in orbit and had longer propellant tanks for increased burn time
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was equipped with a bell 8081 engine which could generate 71 kilonewtons of thrust and be restarted in orbit
lines.name: English

lines.value: the stage carried enough propellant for the engine to burn for a total of four minutes
lines.name: English

lines.value: these launched the samos e samos f elint ferret and midas missile defense alarm system military early warning satellites ranger lunar probes mariner planetary probes ogo and nimbus satellites
lines.name: English

lines.value: agena b's maiden voyage was the unsuccessful launch of discoverer 16 on october 26 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena b took months to be ready for atlas launches and did not fly on that booster until midas 3 on july 12 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: the final agena b flight was the launch of ogo 3 on june 7 1966
lines.name: English

lines.value: a total of 75 were launched
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena d was the result of a proposal by lockheed engineering executive lawrence edwards who suggested standardizing the basic agena configuration up to this point each agena was custom built for both the payload and the launch vehicle it was used with and adding additional features depending on payload requirements and a requirement from the pentagon that the agena be made compatible with the titan rocket
lines.name: English

lines.value: this proposal originated in late 1962 when mounting frustration over the high failure rate of thor and atlas agena prompted the suggestion that greater standardization of launch vehicles would improve reliability
lines.name: English

lines.value: david n spires summarizes the standardization as follows its orbital configuration had a diameter of and a length of and provided 19500 wh of electrical power from batteries
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2014 the agena d is the most launched american upper stage
lines.name: English

lines.value: a special production line was set up to turn out 40 agena d spacecraft per year
lines.name: English

lines.value: edwards remained responsible for the engineering for several years until the air force declared the agena d as operational and froze its design
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the time of its retirement the reliability of the agena d exceeded 95 percent
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first agena d launch was of kh 4 7 on june 28 1963 and a total of 269 agena ds were launched
lines.name: English

lines.value: thor agena flew for the last time in 1972 when it launched a kh 4b satellite
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last atlas agena used an agena d stage atop a refurbished atlas f missile to launch seasat in 1978
lines.name: English

lines.value: twelve more agenas were launched on titan vehicles through 1987 before the stage was completely retired
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena d was used to launch kh 7 gambit spy satellites three mariner probes to venus and the two mariner space probes to mars
lines.name: English

lines.value: the final agena d upper stage was launched on a titan iiib rocket on february 12 1987 carrying usa 21 the last sds 1 satellite
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena target vehicle was based around the agena d with equipment fitted to support use as a rendezvous and docking target for missions conducted as part of project gemini
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was equipped with a bell aerospace model 8247 engine which was qualified for up to 15 restarts
lines.name: English

lines.value: on later missions the agena's engine was fired while the gemini spacecraft was docked in order to boost the spacecraft to a higher orbit and to bring it back again
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the gemini 11 mission an elliptical orbit with an apogee of was reached which set an altitude record for manned spaceflight that held until apollo 8 the first manned mission to the moon was launched
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early 1970s lockheed studied the use of agena as a payload booster in the space shuttle payload bay
lines.name: English

lines.value: an agena c with an increased diameter was proposed but never built
lines.name: English

lines.value: the agena 2000 was intended as a modernized agena and would have been used on the atlas v light evolved expendable launch vehicle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the atlas v light was cancelled in favor of standardizing the medium configuration and as a result the agena 2000 was never built
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first launch of an agent d was agena flight 64 on 27 june 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the end of 1967 a total of 162 agena d had been launched
lines.name: English

lines.value: is a city located at the confluence of the honami and onga rivers in central fukuoka prefecture japan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city was founded on january 20 1932
lines.name: English

lines.value: iizuka was an important post station on the nagasaki kaido during the edo era
lines.name: English

lines.value: as japan industrialised iizuka became the center of the most productive coal fields in japan located throughout the surrounding chikuho district
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the end of second world war there was a large influx of people into the city as it was one of the few areas that offered a large number of jobs in the coal mines and related fields
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the coal mines closed iizuka city has suffered from a consistently declining population base
lines.name: English

lines.value: however its proximity to both fukuoka city and kitakyushu city cushioned the effect of the coal industry shutdown and kept the local economy from going into freefall
lines.name: English

lines.value: now iizuka has a strong light industrial base and is a center for education and a rapidly expanding it economy
lines.name: English

lines.value: on march 26 2006 iizuka absorbed the towns of chikuho honami kaita and shonai all from kaho district to create the new and expanded city of iizuka
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of august 31 2016 the city has an estimated population of 130015 and a population density of 607.35 persons per km
lines.name: English

lines.value: the total area is 214.07 km
lines.name: English

lines.value: iizuka has a humid subtropical climate koppen climate classification cfa with hot summers and cool winters
lines.name: English

lines.value: precipitation is significant throughout the year but is much higher in summer than in winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city formerly had a north korean school chikuho korean elementary school
lines.name: English

lines.value: *kyushu institute of technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university of zimbabwe uz in harare is the oldest and top ranked university in zimbabwe
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was founded through a special relationship with the university of london and it opened its doors to its first students in 1952
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university has ten faculties agriculture arts commerce education engineering law science social studies veterinary sciences and college of health sciences offering a wide variety of degree programmes and many specialist research centres and institutes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university is accredited through the national council for higher education under the ministry of higher and tertiary education
lines.name: English

lines.value: english is the language of instruction
lines.name: English

lines.value: although once a very successful university uz has been facing challenges since 2008 and now the university is on a rebounding drive
lines.name: English

lines.value: major work is being done to uplift the status of the university
lines.name: English

lines.value: refurbishments are being carried out on the main campus and many facilities are being upgraded to make the university an international academic brand
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university has faced criticism for awarding fraudulent degrees to members of the mugabe regime particularly the obscure phd given to grace mugabe
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1945 manfred hodson after whom a residence is now named formed the rhodesia university association inspired by the promise of 20000 by robert jeffrey freeman for establishing such a university
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year the legislative assembly of southern rhodesia adopted a motion proposed by hodson for the establishment of a university college to serve the needs of rhodesia and neighbouring territories
lines.name: English

lines.value: the governor of southern rhodesia established the rhodesia university foundation fund in 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: the legislative assembly accepted an offer of land in mount pleasant from the city of salisbury now harare for the construction of the campus in 1948
lines.name: English

lines.value: four years later a bill was enacted for the incorporation and constitution of the university
lines.name: English

lines.value: first classes began for some 68 students on a temporary site at 147 baker avenue now nelson mandela avenue
lines.name: English

lines.value: independent of the initiatives of hodson and the legislative assembly the central african council's commission on higher education led by sir alexander carr saunders after whom another residence is now named recommended the establishment of a university college to serve rhodesia and nyasaland with its first preference being to integrate with the southern rhodesian initiative
lines.name: English

lines.value: construction began on the mount pleasant site funded by grants from the british and federation of rhodesia and nyasaland governments anglo american corporation the british south africa company the rhodesia selection trust the beit trust the ford foundation and the dulverton trust and in july 1953 elizabeth the queen mother laid the foundation stone
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1955 the british government formally adopted the institution establishing the university college of rhodesia and nyasaland ucrn by royal charter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the college was admitted to the privilege of special relation with the university of london the following year and in 1957 all activities were transferred to the mount pleasant campus
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year the college was granted pieces of land upon which the college farm and the lake kariba research station were constructed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1963 the medical school opened and was affiliated to the university of birmingham
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the dissolution of the federation of rhodesia and nyasaland the university college continued as an independent institution of higher education and research open to all races
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1970 a phased termination of the associations with the universities of london and birmingham began
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the success of the zimbabwe war of liberation the university was renamed university of zimbabwe in 1980
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1981 the first black principal prof walter kamba was appointed and in 1982 the royal charter was replaced by an act of parliament
lines.name: English

lines.value: student numbers rose from 1000 in 1980 to 2000 by 1985
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university of zimbabwe act was controversially amended in 1990 giving the government more powers and according to many faculty students and observers attacking academic freedom
lines.name: English

lines.value: the late 1980s and most of the 1990s saw a rise in student protest resulting in several closures and mass expulsions
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the ongoing tensions the university continued to grow and the student population had reached 8000 by 1995 and 10139 by 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the 2000s began the university struggled to meet lecturers and professors expectations on salary levels leading to numerous strikes
lines.name: English

lines.value: many donors including the government of sweden which had previously been a major financer of uz cut or cancelled their aid
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the economic crisis grew in zimbabwe uz began to fail to recruit lecturers and professors to fill vacancies
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 2007 the shortage of staff was preventing the teaching and examination of some programmes
lines.name: English

lines.value: problems with water and electricity supply as well as maintenance of infrastructure became critical by the late 2000s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the decline of uz culminated in the university's failure to reopen for the 2008–2009 academic year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university briefly opened in early 2009 but no classes were held due to strike action by lecturers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the institution was closed again in late february following demonstrations by students against new hard currency fees
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university has faced criticism for awarding fraudulent degrees to members of the mugabe regime in 2014 grace mugabe was given a doctorate in sociology only two months after being registered on the programme and although a dissertion does not exist in the university archives
lines.name: English

lines.value: also other senior members of the mugabe regime were given doctorates without writing dissertations
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 20 november 2017 the university of zimbabwe students boycotted writing exams citing that the former first lady dr grace mugabe's controversial phd should be revoked
lines.name: English

lines.value: they also protested and declared that they would not write examinations until robert mugabe resigned
lines.name: English
